Policy: Customary Law and Language Commission Act, 2004.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of a Customary Law and Language Commission. The Commission shall carry out tasks relative to the codification of customary law of the Marshall Islands. The President may publish the Code for the benefit of the public and shall present it to the Nitijela, as soon as practicable, for due consideration. The Code shall only have effect as law if the Nitijela declares it by Act as the Customary Law in the Marshall Islands, in accordance with Article X, Section 2 of the Constitution.

Policy: Non-governmental Organization Administration Proclamation (No. 145/2005).
Policy_Content: This Act defines rights and duties of local and international NGO's and the powers and duties of other the Ministry of Labour and Human Welfare and other government entities in respect of NGO's. The activities of every NGO shall be limited to relief and/or rehabilitation works. An NGO wishing to change programs may do so only after applying to the Ministry in writing and obtaining approval for such change. "Relief' includes the provision of food, water, sanitary materials, medicines, shelter and other emergency supplies to tile victims of natural or man-made disaster or displaced people. NGO's shall register with the Ministry. The Minister may issue Regulations for the better implementation of the provisions of this Proclamation.

Policy: Proclamation to Determine the Administration of Non-governmental Organizations, No. of 145 of 2005
Policy_Content: - This law empowers the Ministry of Labour and Human Welfare to deal with matters regarding NGOs including; to receive written applications of local and international NGOs wishing to engage in relief and/or rehabilitation works and, after examining and reviewing the documents, issue within 30 days, work permits or, where it rejects the applications, inform the applicants in writing its reasons therefor; coordinate between government entities and NGOs; approve and coordinate programs and projects to be funded and implemented by NGOs; authorize the importation of goods by NGOs and ascertain that taxes and duties are levied and paid on the said goods in accordance with the law by the importing NGOs; to audit the accounts of NGOs; among others. Other government entities are also given certain powers and duties with regards to NGOs. The law provides for the rights and obligations of NGOs, these include; the right to receive information regarding their work programs from the Ministry or other government entities; the right to request security and protection for the safety of personnel and property at places of work; the right to terminate programs or activities by giving 3 months’ prior notice; the right to hire and dismiss personnel in accordance with the provisions of the Labour Proclamation No. 118 of 2001; the obligation to register by submitting a detailed application stating the reasons of engagement in the country and the right application; the obligation to start work with the concerned government entities by concluding contracts of work, obtaining work permits, among others. The law limits the scope of activities of NGOs to relief and rehabilitation works and where an NGO desires to engage in development work, the NGO must conclude an agreement with the affected ministry or agency.
Subject: General
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa, Least Developed Countries, Red Sea  Gulf of Aden

Policy: Law on Using Renewable Energy Resources for Electricity Production.
Policy_Content: This Law provides for rules and principles to protect renewable energy resource areas and to certify the electric energy produced from these resources. Development plans for public or treasury lands that could have a negative impact on renewable energy resource areas are prohibited. A “Renewable Energy Resource Certificate” will be issued to those who produce electric energy from such resources. Commercial transactions between producers and licensed distributors of electric energy produced from such resources are regulated and defined in the Law. Individuals and companies who produce electric energy from renewable resources only to meet their needs are exempted from all fees related to the investment. Government or forestry lands may be leased for power plants producing electric energy from renewable resources. Public distribution companies are exempted from commercial obligations defined in the law until 1 January 2007. Implementation principles of the Law will be defined by a separate regulation.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law enters into force on 18 May 2005.

Policy: Resolution No. 16/2005 on the Long-Term Strategic Plan for Agricultural Development towards 2015 and the Action Plan for 2005-2008
Policy_Content: This resolution, composed of two articles and one Annex, approves the Strategic Plan for Agricultural Development onwards 2015 and the Action Plan for 2005-2008. The Annexed Strategic Plan is composed of 8 main chapters dealing with: rural sector production (agriculture and fisheries) situation, strategic development framework, the relevant weaknesses, opportunities and constraints, and the strategies for agricultural development. Special attention is devoted to sustainable livelihood strategies, targeted measures for each classified ecological area (ZAE), sectoral strategies (animal production, silvo-pastoralism, and vegetal production). Finally, it states the financial amounts and related funding sources dedicated to the implementation of the Action Plan.

Policy: Bavarian State Forestry Law.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes the «Bavarian State Forests». Article 1 establishes that the public forest contributes to the general welfare in a special way and is therefore in accordance with Article 18 of the Bavarian Forest Law to be managed exemplary. It is the purpose of the present Law to transfer the task of good management of public forests from the state administration to a legal entity of public law, as well as to establish its tasks and organization. The entity shall be called “Bavarian State Forests”. The text – consisting of 21 articles – deal, inter alia, with the following aspects: purpose of the Law, establishment of entity, tasks, hunting, fishing, control, Advisory Board, statutes, use of forestry assets, financing, liability and personnel.

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté réglemente la délivrance de l’autorisation de bâtir. Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 177 validating the Regulation on allotment of land for housing.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of allotment, in case of availability, of land for housing free of charge. Allotment of land for housing shall be carried out in accordance with general land-use planning schemes. Objects of allotment shall be plots of land located in inhabited areas that can be conceded in ownership. Dimensions of the plots of land for housing shall be determined by the local self-government. The right of allotment of a plot of land for individual housing shall be granted to: (a) those residing for at least three years in Bishkek and Osh, and for at least 1 year in other territories; (b) landless persons on all the national territory; (c) persons that do not own residential properties; and (d) persons that have not worsened their living condition by selling, exchanging or donating their residential properties in the past 5 years.

Policy: Ley Nº 3058 - Ley de hidrocarburos.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley norma las actividades hidrocarburíferas y establece los principios, normas y procedimientos fundamentales que rigen en el ámbito del territorio nacional en lo que se refiere al sector hidrocarburífero. La Ley ha sido promulgada en ejecución y cumplimiento de los resultados del Referéndum del 18 de julio de 2004. El artículo 5º reconoce que titular de la propiedad de todos los hidrocarburos es el Estado Boliviano, el cual ejercerá su derecho a través de Yacimientos Petrolíferos Bolivianos Fiscales (YPFB). El artículo 6º dispone la refundación de YPFB, recuperando la propiedad estatal de las acciones de los bolivianos en las empresas petroleras capitalizadas. Los artículos de 9º a 15 definen la política nacional de hidrocarburos, la cual se regirá por los principios de eficiencia, transparencia, calidad, continuidad, neutralidad, competencia y adaptabilidad. El artículo 31 clasifica las actividades hidrocarburíferas de la siguiente manera: (a) exploración; (b) explotación; (c) refinación e industrialización; (d) transporte y almacenaje; (e) comercialización; (f) distribución de gas natural por redes. Las actividades de hidrocarburos, en sus diferentes fases, podrán desarrollarse en áreas protegidas, reservas forestales, tierras de producción forestal permanente, reservas de patrimonio privado natural respetando su categoría y zonificación, cuando el Estudio Ambiental Estratégico, previo a la autorización o concesión, lo apruebe y no se pongan en riesgo los objetivos de conservación, servicios ambientales, recursos genéticos, espacios arqueológicos y socioculturales, en el ámbito del desarrollo sostenible (art. 32).
Subject: Mineral resources, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: An Act to Amend 2 CMC 8 4323 to requiring the Marianas Public Lands Authority to grant title to public land to qualified persons who demonstrated fifteen (15) years of continuous and actual occupancy of public land, but did not receive such title despite being qualified because of his or her exclusion from the list of qualified persons established by MPLA, to mandate that MPLA review all past and pending claims and grant such title to qualified persons; to amend 2 CMC 4324 to extend the time limitation for new claims made pursuant to 2 CMC 0 4323 from twelve (12) to twenty-five (25) years; and for other purposes (P.L. 14-66).

Any person who can demonstrate continuous and actual occupancy or use of public land for agricultural purposes for a period of 15 years prior to this date, or who can demonstrate that he or she would have continuously and actually occupied or used public land for agricultural purposes for a period of 15 years prior to this date but has been removed from such land in specified circumstances, shall be legally entitled to all the rights and interest of ownership of such land.

Policy: Electricity Market Law (2005)
Policy_Content: This Law regulates electricity market. Its purpose is to establish prerequisites for the operation of an efficiently functioning electricity market; to ensure that, taking into account the requirements of laws and regulations, all energy customers are provided with electricity in a safe and qualitative manner, in the most efficient possible way for justified prices; to ensure all customers with the right to choose an electricity trader freely; to promote the production of electricity by using renewable energy resources; to promote energy independence ensuring different suppliers of energy resources necessary for production of electricity. This Law governs the types of activities to be performed in the electricity market, which shall include the production of electricity, transmission of electricity, distribution of electricity, trade of electricity as a free circulation commodity and the provision of services necessary for the trade thereof. This Law shall determine the requirements, which the participants of the electricity market and the participants of the electricity system shall observe in their activities in the electricity market, as well as the responsibility for non-complying with the requirements of this Law. This Law also determines the competence of the ministry responsible for the energy industry and the Public Utilities Commission in the monitoring and regulation of the electricity market.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities for declaring an ecological disaster and for the delimiting and classifying the disaster area. The purposes of declarations of ecological disaster shall be: (a) delimitation of its boundaries; (b) assessment of the ecological state of the territory; (c) valuation of damage and of the possibility of recurrence; and (d) adoption of measures for the mitigation of consequences. The Ministerial Decree establishes criteria and indices for declarations of ecological disaster.

Policy: Ley Nº 4.184 - Ley de información ambiental.

En este sentido la Ley regula el procedimiento a seguir para acceder a dicha información. A estos efectos la Ley define como información ambiental a toda aquella que obre en poder de la autoridad de aplicación o de cualquier autoridad, organismo o institución pública, incluyendo a subcontratistas, concesionarias y empresas privadas que presten servicios públicos en el territorio de la Provincia de Misiones.

Policy: Regional Law No. 323-ZO “On subsoil management containing common widespread minerals for purposes not related to mineral extraction”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that common widespread minerals shall be considered non-metal and fossil fuels. Regional Government shall have the following competence: (a) to establish the modalities of subsoil management; (b) to validate the modalities of state registration and issuance of general subsoil management (exploration and mining) licences; and (c) to allot jointly with the Russian Federation parcels for subsoil management. Authorized regional state institution in the sphere of subsoil management shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) institution and keeping territorial geological information fund; (b) distribution of geological information; (c) assessment of mineral deposits; (d) state supervision over rational management of subsoil; (e) organization and carrying out tenders and auction sale of the right to subsoil management; and (f) issuance of exploration and mining licences.

Policy: Ministerial Order No. 93/2005 regulating the distribution among local communities of the 20% of tax funds collected from the use of forest and wildlife resources.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Order, composed of 6 articles, requires that the 20% of any tax or fees collected from the use of forest and wildlife resources shall revert to the local communities living in the area where such resources are being used. The Ministerial Order foresees the institution of special Management Committees composed by representatives of both local communities and public authorities. Moreover, it requires the establishment of a Registry of the beneficiary local communities. Finally, it rules on the detailed procedures for collecting and distributing the funds through a dedicated Bank account.

Policy: Countryside Access (Means of Access, Appeals etc.) (Wales) Regulations 2005 (S.I. No. 1270 (W.90) of 2005).
Policy_Content: Part I of the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 makes provision for access to the countryside. Section 35 of the Act relates to agreements between access authorities and owners and occupiers of land with respect to the means of access to land over which there is a public right of access under section 2 of the Act ("access land"). Section 36(3) of the Act provides that, if an owner or occupier fails to observe any restriction in an agreement under section 35 of the Act, the access authority may give to the person with whom it has entered into the agreement notice to carry out works to remedy the breach of the restriction. Section 37 of the Act enables an access authority to carry out works to provide means of access to relevant land where the authority is satisfied that it is unable to conclude on reasonable terms an agreement under section 35 of the Act. Before carrying out those works, the access authority must, under section 37(1) of the Act, give notice to all owners and occupiers that the authority intends to carry out the works specified in the notice. Section 38(1) of the Act gives the owner and occupier the right to appeal against a notice under section 36(3) or 37(1) and these Regulations make provision for the initial stages of such an appeal. Regulation 3 enables the initial stages of an appeal to be dealt with by electronic means. Regulation 4 sets out the manner in, and specifies the period of time within, which an appeal under section 38(1) must be brought. Regulations 5 to 16 make the necessary amendments to the Countryside Access (Appeals Procedures) (Wales) Regulations 2002.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. 9385 on forests and the forestry service.

The Law is composed of ten Chapters: (I) General Provisions, (II) Policies, development programmes and forestry management plans, (III) Forestry service, (IV) Forest functions, composition of the National Forestry Fund and the cadastre, (V) Protection and administration of the National Forestry Fund, (VI) Treatment, exploitation and sale of timber and other forestry and non-forestry products, (VII) Financial resources and their usage, (VIII) Scientific research in the National Forestry Fund, (IX) Sanctions, (X) Final Provisions. The authorities in charge of the Law enforcement are the General Directorate of Forestry Service and the Forestry Police under the authority of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food.

Policy: Cotton (Establishment of Zones and Isolated and Segregated Areas), Regulations, 2005 (S.I. No. 40 of 2005).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, made by the Minister responsible for agriculture by sections 8 and 9 of the Cotton Development Act, establish in Uganda zones for cultivation and dealing in marketing and ginning of cotton. The zones are established for the development of the cotton production sector and to avoid the mixing of seed varieties. The Organisation shall implement the zoning policy set out in these Regulations and in for this purpose may seize, impound, confiscate, restrict or prohibit movement of cotton plants, cotton seed, seed cotton or lint cotton generally or in respect of a particular dealer from one zone to another. Every person who deals in seed cotton, cotton seed and cotton lint must apply to the Organisation for registration in a given zone. A so-called Zonal Dealer shall have precise functions with respect to registration of cotton farmers and the development of the cotton sector in the zone. The Regulations also establish isolated and segregated areas for purposes of seed multiplication activities. No cotton plants, cotton seed, seed cotton or lint cotton shall be exported from or imported into such area without the consent in writing of the Organisation.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 85/2005 ruling on waste incineration.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law, composed of 49 articles and five Annexes, introduces in the national legal system EC Council and Parliament Directive No. 2000/76/CE. This Decree-Law rules on waste incineration with the aim of preventing or reducing its negative effects over environment, especially the pollution caused by air, soil and water emissions as well as for reducing risks for human health. Such regime applies to all legislation in force regarding waste management, environment, air quality, water quality, health and safety at workplace. The Decree-Law defines the licensing procedures and regulates the methods for waste incineration. Moreover, it defines the limit values for air emissions, and for waste discharges. Furthermore, it regulates waste transport, storage and recycling, as well as control and monitoring procedures. Finally, it rules on public participation and reporting requirements.

Policy: Government Resoultion No. 169/2005 approving the national strategy for energy.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, composed of two articles and one Annex, approves the National Strategy for Energy. The aim is to improve energy efficiency and security in the supply through the diversification of primary sources and energy services, and through the promotion of competition in energy sector, granting, at the same time, environmental protection and thereduction of environmental impacts derived from energy production processes. The Annex provides the national strategy for Energy defining overall objectives and specific measures to be adopted in the legal, trade, commuincatioopn, research, financing and tax related sectors.

Policy: Law No. 9379 on energy efficiency.
Policy_Content: This Law sets forth the framework for the exploitation of energy resources. It aims at ensuring reliable and sustainable energy supply, as well as the reduction of adverse impacts on the environment. Energy efficiency means the rate of effectiveness of energy processes, defined as a percentage ratio of the total energy output and the total energy input of the same process. The Law consists of five Chapters: (I) General provisions; (II) Energy efficiency policies; (III) Energy auditing; (IV) Energy Efficiency Fund; (V) Final provisions. The National Agency of Energy is designated as the competent authority in energy matters. Local energy offices are established in each region under the authority of the National Energy Agency. The local offices shall establish and update the database on local energy consumption and available resources. Further provisions concern administrative offences and related penalties.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Southern Europe

Policy: Demoted Tenancies (Review of Decisions)(Wales) Regulations 2005 (S.I. No. 1679 of 2004).
Policy_Content: A landlord wishing to end a demoted tenancy must serve the tenant with a notice stating that he or she has decided to apply to the court for an order for possession, setting out the reasons for that decision and informing the tenant of his right to request a review of the decision. These Regulations make provision about the procedure to be followed in such a review. Regulation 2 provides that a review must be undertaken by a person who was not involved in the original decision. If the original decision was made by an officer then any review of that decision by another officer may only be carried out by an officer occupying a more senior position within the landlord's organization than the officer who made the original decision. Regulation 3 requires the landlord to give the tenant notice of the date of the review. Regulation 4 enables the tenant to obtain an oral hearing in certain circumstances and explains how that right may be exercised. Regulations 5 to 9 set out the details of the review procedure.

Policy: Measures for the procedure for formulating regulations on environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Measures is to regulate the procedures for formulating regulations on environmental protection and ensure the quality of legislation. The department that takes the specific charge of drafting laws or regulations on environmental protection shall organize the relevant legislative personnel to carry out the drafting (Chapter III). Policy: Act No. XVIII of 2005 concerning district heating services and implementing Decree N. 157/2005 (VIII. 15.) Korm.
Policy_Content: This Act shall be applied to all legal relationships in connection with heat production, conveying, provision and utilization through the district heating system. Chapter I contains general provisions. Chapter II addresses public administrative competences and their distribution among institutions and authorities, and contains provisions regarding consumer protection as well. Chapter III states general rules of licensing. Chapter IV provides for rights on stranger's land. Chapter V governs the operation and the development of the district heating system. Chapter VI provides rules regarding the legal relation between the producer and the provider of district heating, and between the provider, the user and the payer. Chapter VII provides for pricing. Chapter VIII contains miscellaneous and final provisions. Renewable resources shall be prefered for energy production for heating purposes.

Policy: Resolution No. 14/2005 approving the Kyoto Protocol to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Policy_Content: This Resolution approves the Kyoto Protocol to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. Each Party included in Annex 1, when fulfilling its quantified emission limitation and reduction commitments, in order to promote sustainable development, must: a) Implement and/or improve policies and measures according to their national circumstances, such as: i) Increasing energy efficiency in relevant sectors of the national economy; ii) Protection and increase sinks and reservoirs of greenhouse gases not controlled by the Montreal Protocol, taking into account its commitments made in relevant international agreements on the environment, the promotion of sustainable forest management, afforestation and reforestation practices; iii) Promote sustainable forms of agriculture in the light of climate change considerations; iv) Research, promotion, development and increased use of new and renewable forms of energy, carbon dioxide sequestration technologies and environmentally safe technologies, which are advanced and innovative; v) Gradual reduction or elimination of market imperfections, tax incentives, tax and tariff exemptions and subsidies for all sectors emitting greenhouse gases that are contrary to the objective of the Convention and the application of market instruments; vi) Encourage adequate reforms in relevant sectors, with a view to promoting policies and measures that limit or reduce greenhouse gas emissions not controlled by the Montreal Protocol; vii) Measures to limit and/or reduce greenhouse gas emissions not controlled by the Montreal Protocol in the transport sector; viii) Limitate and/or reduce methane emissions through its recovery and use in the treatment of waste, as well as in the production, transport and distribution of energy.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Least Developed Countries, North Atlantic, Sahel, Small Island Developing States, Western Africa
Entry into force notes: This Protocol shall enter into force on the 90th day after the date on which at least 55 Parties to the Convention have entered into force.

Policy: Décret n° 2005-378 relatif au programme national d'action contre la pollution des milieux aquatiques par certaines substances dangereuses.
Policy_Content: Ce décret porte dispositions relatives à la mise en oeuvre des programmes d'action destiné à prévenir, réduire ou éliminer la pollution des eaux de surface, des eaux de transition et des eaux marines intérieures et territoriales par les substances figurant sur la liste annexée au présent décret. Le programme fixe des objectifs de prévention, de réduction ou d'élimination de la pollution, détermine les mesures propres à assurer la surveillance et la maîtrise des rejets de ces substances et fixe le calendrier de leur mise en oeuvre. Pour chaque substance inscrite sur la liste mentionnée à l'article précédent, le ministre fixe par arrêté des normes de qualité dont le respect doit permettre que les milieux aquatiques ne soient pas affectés de façon perceptible.
Subject: Sea, Water, Environment gen.

Policy: Natural Gas Supply Act (No. 1116 of 2006).
Policy_Content: The Act applies to transmission, distribution, supply and storage of natural gas, including liquefied natural gas (LNG). It also applies to biogas, gas from biomass and other types of gas on land, territorial sea, in the exclusive economic zone and on the Danish continental shelf area. The Minister for Climate, Energy and Building shall determine that transmission companies whose facilities do not have direct influence on the Danish natural gas market are fully or partially exempt from this Act.NO charges are applied to consumers in case of change of suppler. After prior application The Energy Monitoring Agency (Energi.net) shall certify companies for meeting requirements of procedures. Permission to LNG facilities may be granted only if the applicant can demonstrate that there is sufficient need for the LNG and upon compliance with terms of the exact construction and operation of the LNG facility, including collateral for disposal.

Policy: National Plan of Action for Nutrition of Malaysia II (2006-2015).
Policy_Content: The National Plan of Action for Nutrition of Malaysia (NPANM) II is a 10-year plan for the period of 2006 to 2015. The general objective is to achieve and maintain optimal nutritional well-being of Malaysian. The National Nutrition Policy strategies constitute the basis in formulating the objectives of NPANM II. Five strategies of the policy, identified as having direct impact on achieving the specific objectives of the plan, serve as the enabling strategies. These are: improving household food security especially among the low income group; promoting optimal infant and young children feeding practice; preventing and controlling nutritional deficiencies; promoting healthy eating and active living; supporting efforts to protect consumers in food quality and safety.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 226 on approval of the Charter of the Ministry of Agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Decree states that the Ministry of Agriculture is the central executive body aims at agricultural development. The Ministry of Agriculture shall carry out normative, legal and economic arrangements and shall develop and implement state policy in the agrarian sector by focusing on development of production and processing of agricultural products, provision of information to agricultural producers, plant protection and quarantine, veterinary and efficient use of soil. This Decree sets forth provisions on duties, responsibilities and structure of the Ministry of Agriculture.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 226 on approval of the Charter of the State Phytosanitary Control Service under the Ministry of Agriculture.
Policy_Content: This Decree states that the State Phytosanitary Control Service is the executive body and shall carry out state control over plant protection and quarantine, pesticides, biological agents and other plant protection practices. This Decree specifies the duties of the State Phytosanitary Control Service such as: a) carrying out state control over plant protection and quarantine in compliance with the legislation, b) setting up rules regarding application of pesticides and other chemicals, c) inspection on chemical, agro-technical, biological, institutional and other activities of land owners and users, d) identification of objects for quarantine and taking quarantine measures, and e) import control over quarantine pests, plant pathogens and wild flora to prevent the spread of plant pests. This Decree sets forth provisions on functions, responsibilities and structure of the State Phytosanitary Control Service.

Policy: Styria Electricity Management and  Organization Law 2005.
Policy_Content: The present Law lays down provisions relating to the production, transfer and distribution of electricity in the Land of Styria. The aim of the Law is to make available to the people and to the industry electricity being at the same time environment-friendly, reasonable priced, sufficient, secure and of high quality; to create a market organization according to EU-guidelines and to the principles of national law; to further an even greater part of renewable energy in the sphere of electricity production; and, finally, to protect the people from harmful effects from production plants. The text consists of 68 articles divided into 11 Parts as follows: General provisions (I); Production plants (II);  Electricity plants, regulated areas (III); Entitlement to accede to electricity plants (IV); Funds, group balance-sheet (V); Conditions for running electricity plants (VI); Expiry of licence to run electricity plants (VII); General conditions for authorization, competent authorities, duty to report (VIII); Electricity Counsel (IX); Proof of origin (X); Penalties, transitional and final provisions (XI).
Subject: Energy

Policy: Styria Environment Information Law.
Policy_Content: The present Act regulates the procedures and conditions under which the general public may acquire access to environmental information kept by public bodies. Save for restrictions imposed by the need to keep certain information confidential, data on natural resources (air, soil, water, fauna, flora) and on pollution (waste, noise, etc.) are freely accessible to the public, who may obtain it upon oral or written application. The public may challenge refusals to supply this information. Moreover, the text – consisting of 19 articles – deals with the following aspects: purpose of the Law, definition of «environment information”, competent authorities, free access to environment information, motivation for refusal to supply information, treatment of office secrets, legal protection, publication of environmental information, environment protection report, coordination of environmental information, duty to give information and penalties.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: The present Law enters into force on 1 September 2005.

The text consists of 7 articles.

Policy: Loi n°117/AN/05/5ème L Portant Code Pétrolier.
Policy_Content: La présente loi porte code pétrolier. Sur le territoire de la République de Djibouti, la prospection, la recherche, l'exploitation et le transport des hydrocarbures ainsi que le régime fiscal de ces activités sont régis par les dispositions du présent code et des textes réglementaires pris pour son application. Policy: Délibération de l’assemblée de la province Nord n° 52-2005/APN du 15 avril 2005 relative aux installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement.
Policy_Content: Sont soumis aux dispositions de la présente délibération les usines, ateliers, dépôts, chantiers et d'une manière générale les installations exploitées ou détenues par toute personne physique ou morale, publique ou privée, qui peuvent présenter des dangers ou inconvénients soit pour la commodité du voisinage, soit pour la santé, la sécurité, la salubrité publiques, soit pour l'agriculture, soit pour la protection de la nature et de l'environnement, soit pour la conservation des sites et des monuments. Les installations sont définies dans la nomenclature des installations classées annexée à la présente délibération. Policy: Décret n° 2005/118 portant organisation du Ministère de l'Agriculture et du Développement Rural.

Policy_Content: Ce décret porte attributions,organisation et fonctionnement du Ministère de l'agriculture, de l'élevage et de la pêche, ayant pour mission de créer les conditions favorables à l'amélioration des revenus agricoles et du niveau de vie des population et la mise en oeuvre de politiques adéquates en vue de favoriser le progrès technique en ces domaines, faciliter l'exploitation des ressources naturelles et halieutiques à des niveaux compatibles avec la satisfaction des besoins du pays et en veillant au respect des équilibres écologique et de faciliter les investissements dans le secteur agricole et rural. Policy: Arrêté sur les opérations mécaniques lourdes dans les milieux naturels.
Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté met en exécution, entre autres, la Loi fédérale sur la protection de la nature et du paysage (LPN) du 1er juillet 1966 et la loi cantonale sur les forêts (LCFo), du 27 novembre 19965, et son règlement d'exécution. Le présent arrêté a pour but de réglementer les opérations mécaniques lourdes entreprises dans les milieux naturels et susceptibles d'entraîner une modification de la nature et de la structure du sol, telles que le girobroyage. Par «girobroyage», on entend le broyage et le mélange des éléments constitutifs du sol, soit la terre, la matière végétale et la matière minérale. Par cette action, le sol est durablement transformé sur une certaine profondeur avec des incidences notables sur l'environnement. L’article 3 établit que telles opérations mécaniques sont interdites dans les zones suivantes: a) les biotopes d'importance nationale désignés par le Conseil fédéral; b) les objets, les zones à protéger et les réserves naturelles délimités en application de la loi susvisée; c) les pâturages boisés. Le texte comprend 7 articles.

Policy: Loi nº 04-2005 portant Code minier.
Policy_Content: Le présent code règlemente les activités minières, notamment celles de prospection, de recherche, d'exploitation ainsi que la possession, la détention, la circulation et la transformation des substances minérales et fossiles. Le code comprend 193 articles répartis en 3 livres, à savoir: Dispositions générales (I); Droits et obligations spécifiques relatifs aux  opérations minières,de la securite industrielle. de l’hygiène, de la préservation de l'environnement et de la surveillance administrative(II); Fiscalité minière, infractions, contentieux, délégation de pouvoirs et dispositions diverses transitoires et finales.(III). Les substances minérales ou fossiles visées par les dispositions du présent Code peuvent se classer en les catégories énumérées ci-après: - substances énergétiques fossiles; -  substances énergétiques radioactives;   les substances métalliques ferreuses et non ferreuses; -  substances non métalliques; - substances précieuses ; - les eaux minérales et thermales; - les géo matériaux de construction, les matériaux pour la céramique et les autres industries, ainsi que les matériaux d'amendement des sols a l'exclusion des engrais des minéraux naturels azotes phosphates et potassiques. Elles constituent le patrimoine minier national, dont l'Etat protège et garantit la mise en valeur. Les titres miniers pour les substances minérales ou fossiles visées comprennent: - l'autorisation de prospection; - le permis de recherches; - l'autorisation d'exploitation artisanale: - l'autorisation d'exploitation industrielle: - le permis d'exploitation: - les autorisations de détention, de circulation et de transformation des substances minérales précieuses. Ces titres miniers confèrent des droits à leurs titulaires tels que prévus dans la présente loi et les différents textes en vigueur.

Policy: Law No. HO-82-N “On environmental control”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates the environmental legislation in the Republic of Armeniaб the issues of organizing and implementing supervision over the implementation and enforcement of environmental legislation, specifications, categories, conditions, relations and environmental issues by establishing legal and economic basis of control. State environmental inspection shall perform control related to environment (pollution control), including atmospheric air (air quality and air pollution), water (freshwater pollution), land and soil (soil pollution), hazardous substances, wild fauna and flora (payment of environmental fees for use of wild fauna and wild flora species) with a view of ensuring safety of natural environment and protection of public health, and prevention of harmful impact on the natural environment. Objectives of environmental control shall be set as follows: (a) environmental protection and rational use of natural resources; (b) detection of environmental offences and enforcement of environmental legislation; (c) prevention of harmful effects on environment by business entities; and (d) prevention of environmental overuse. Environmental control must ensure public participation in the solution of environmental issues. Environmental control shall be performed in accordance with annual plans. This Law consists of 8 Chapters. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 regards environmental control. Chapter 3 establishes state environmental inspectorate system, environmental information system and establishes rights and duties of state environmental inspectorate. Chapter 4 establishes the particulars of environmental control by state environmental protection bodies. Chapter 5 regards implementation of environmental control. Chapter 6 establishes the rights and duties of entities subject to environmental control and inspection. Chapter 7 determines the system of state environmental inspection, state administration and local government in the sphere of environmental control. Chapter 8 establishes responsibility of environmental state inspection, state administration and local government in the sphere of environmental control.

Policy: Loi organique nº 04/2005 du 8 avril 2005  portant modalités de protéger, sauvegarder et promouvoir l'environnement au Rwanda.
Policy_Content: La présente loi organique détermine les modalités de protéction, sauvegarde  et promotion de l'environnement au Rwanda. Elle vise notamment à: - protéger l'environnement, la population et son habitat; - établir les principes fondamentaux relatifs à la protection de l'environnement contre toutes les formes de dégradation afin de valoriser les ressources naturelles, de lutter contre toutes sortes de pollutions et de nuisances; - améliorer les conditions de vie de la population; - assurer la durabilité des ressources dans le respect du même droit entre les générations présentes et futures; - garantir un développement économique durable; - mettre en place les mécanismes de protection et d'atténuation des effets négatifs sur l'environnement et veiller à la restauration des mileux endommagés. La loi compte 188 articles répartis en 7 titres, à savoir : Dispositions générales, définitions de quelques mots utilisés, principes fondamentaux et domaine d'application (I); Environnement naturel et humain (II); Obbligations de l'Etat, des collectivités locales et de la population (III); Mesures incitatives aux conservateurs de l'environnement (IV); Contrôle, suivi et inspection (V); Dispositions préventives et répressives (VI); Dispositions finales (VII).

Policy: Act relative to procedures of environmental impact assessment of public plans and programmes (No. 200 of 2005).
Policy_Content: This Act provides rules for environmental impact assessment of public plans, projects and programmes. It concerns the decision-making process and promotes public participation such decision-making for sustainable development and access of the public to environment information. The Act, among other things, implements in Finland Directive 2001/42/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the assessment of the effects of certain plans and programmes on the environment. As a general rule, the authority responsible for a plan or program shall ensure that the environmental impact of the plan or program is investigated and assessed to a sufficient extent during the preparation, if the implementation of the plan or program may have a significant environmental impact. An authority's plan or program shall be subject to an environmental assessment, if 1) it is developed for agriculture, forestry, fishing, energy supply, industry, transport, waste management, water conservation, telecommunications, tourism, regional development, area use, environmental protection or nature conservation, and the assessment shall be a condition for authorization (to be decided by Decree), or 2) the plan or program is subject to the obligation to make an assessment referred to in section 65 of the Nature Conservation Act (1096/1996). The Act also concerns assessment of transboundary effects in case of international projects.

Policy: Circulaire du 5 avril 2005 portant sur les moyens à mettre en oeuvre dans les marchés publics de bois et produits dérivés pour promouvoir la gestion durable des forêts.
Policy_Content: Conscient de la valeur du bois en termes de développement durable, le Gouvernement a annoncé, le 7 avril 2004, un plan d'action en faveur des forêts tropicales. Un des volets de ce plan est consacré aux achats publics. Le plan d'action arrêté par le Gouvernement vise à accroître progressivement la part, dans les achats publics de bois, des bois tropicaux dont l'origine licite est garantie et qui sont issus d'exploitations forestières engagées dans un processus de gestion durable. Cette part devra être, en 2007, d'au moins 50 % des achats de bois. L'objectif visé pour 2010 est que la totalité des achats publics de produits à base de bois réponde à cette exigence. L'annexe à la présente circulairea pour objet de favoriser la prise en compte de la gestion durable des forêts dans les marchés publics. Elle comporte trois chapitres (I. - Définition des besoins ; II. - Sélection des candidatures ; III. - Attribution du marché). Elle est complétée par un document d'informations techniques élaboré par le groupe permanent d'étude des marchés « développement durable, environnement » (GPEM/DDEN), qui décrit notamment les écolabels et les systèmes de certification de la gestion durable des forêts abordés.

Policy: Law No. 2509-IV on combined thermal and electric energy production (co-generation) and utilization of the combined power potential.
Policy_Content: The present Law establishes legal, economic and organizational conditions of the activity of the subjects of relations in the sphere of energy saving as regards the utilization of co-generation plants regulates relations connected with the particulars of production, transmission and supply of thermal energy form co-generation plants. The purpose of the Act is setting legal conditions for the improvement of the use of fuel in the process of energy production and in other technological processes, development and regulation of the technologies of the combined production of electric and thermal energy, and ensuring stable and reliable energy supply at the regional level. Operation of co-generation plants shall be carried out on condition of the maintenance of the necessary balance between power output and quality of electric energy produced by co-generation plants, for the purpose of ensuring the reliable functioning of energy network. The state policy in the sphere of the utilization of co-generation plants is based upon efficient use of fuel and meeting standards of environmental safety. The authorized institution if the sphere of energy saving shall be responsible to carry out inspection in the sphere of the utilization of co-generation plants. The Law consists of 6 Sections composed of 15 articles.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 107-P validating the Regulation on protected area natural park “Ergaky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes the procedure for management and special protection regime protected area natural park “Ergaky” of regional significance. The territory of the natural park includes natural complexes and objects with significant ecological and aesthetic value and intended for use in environmental, educational, recreational purposes. The natural park was formed without the expropriation of land plots (water areas), used for national needs, as well as without expropriation of land plots (water areas) from tenants, owners and managers of land plots (water areas). The main objectives of the organization of the natural park shall be as follows: (a) preservation of unique and typical natural complexes and objects, notable natural formations, rare, under the risk of extinction and other valuable wild fauna and wild flora species, their genetic fund; (b) creation of conditions for regulated tourism and recreation, including for development of physical culture and sports, and the preservation of recreational resources; (c) ecological education of the population; and (d) monitoring of changes in the state of the environment. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of natural park: (a) stay, driving and passing off public roads, excluding officials when they perform their official duties, forestry workers when carrying out work on protection and reproduction of forests; stay, driving and walking along public roads shall be authorized with a preliminary notification of the Directorate of the natural park; (b) any activity that threatens the state of natural complexes and objects, including entailing a change of historically existing natural landscape, decline and destruction of ecological, aesthetic and recreational value of natural landscape, change of habitat of rare and endangered plant and animal species; (c) geological exploration, soil disturbance, outcrops of minerals and rocks; (d) felling of forest plantations (excluding selective sanitary felling envisaged by forestry regulations); (e) procurement of soft resin; (f) harvesting and collection of food forest resources, medicinal plants, non-timber forest resources; (g) construction of roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, construction of buildings and structures of permanent or temporary type; (h) hunting and fishing, with the exception of the removal of wild fauna species for scientific purposes; (i) introduction of living organisms for the purpose of their acclimatization; (j) the use of pesticides, chemical reagents and other hazardous to wild fauna species and their habitat; (k) grazing and transit of livestock; (l) littering of the territory with household waste; (m) collection of zoological, botanical and mineralogical collections, excluding collections to ensure the tasks and objectives of natural parka; (n) burning of vegetation; and (o) use of pyrotechnic products (with the exception of search and rescue operations). On the territory of the natural park shall be authorized scientific research activities carried out by specialized scientific research institutions, organizations, higher education institutions of the relevant profile, foreign scientific research organizations and individual specialists, including foreign ones, on the basis of agreements concluded with Directorate of the natural park. Environmental education activities are carried out by staff of the Department of Environmental Education of the Directorate of natural park.

Policy: Règlement grand-ducal du 4 avril 2005 portant sanction et exécution des dispositions - du règlement (CE) N°1829/2003 du Parlement Européen et du Conseil du 22 septembre 2003 concernant les denrées alimentaires et les aliments pour animaux génétiquement modifiés et - du règlement (CE) N°1830/2003 du Parlement Européen et du Conseil du 22 septembre 2003 concernant la traçabilité et l'étiquetage des organismes génétiquement modifiés et la traçabilité des produits destinés à l'alimentation humaine ou animale produits à partir d'organismes génétiquement modifiés, et modifiant la directive 2001/18/CE.
Policy_Content: Le présent règlement porte sanction et exécution des dispositions du règlement (CE) N°1829/2003 du Parlement Européen et du Conseil du 22 septembre 2003 concernant les denrées alimentaires et les aliments pour animaux génétiquement modifiés et du règlement (CE) N°1830/2003 du Parlement Européen et du Conseil du 22 septembre 2003 concernant la traçabilité et l'étiquetage des organismes génétiquement modifiés et la traçabilité des produits destinés à l'alimentation humaine ou animale produits à partir d'organismes génétiquement modifiés, et modifiant la directive 2001/18/CE. Est puni des peines prévues à l'article 42 de la loi modifiée du 13 janvier 1997 relative au contrôle de l'utilisation et de la dissémination des organismes génétiquement modifiés quiconque met sur le marché un OGM destiné à l'alimentation humaine, une denrée alimentaire contenant des OGM ou consistant en de tels organismes ou des denrées alimentaires produites à partir d'ingrédients produits à partir d'OGM ou contenant de tels ingrédients, sans avoir obtenu l'autorisation à ce requise en vertu du règlement (CE) N° 1829/2003 du Parlement Européen et du Conseil du 22 septembre 2003 concernant les denrées alimentaires et les aliments pour animaux génétiquement modifiés, publié au Journal Officiel de l'Union européenne N° L 268 du 18 octobre 2003 aux pages 1 à 23; quiconque met sur le marché des OGM ou des denrées alimentaires visés au tiret qui précède munis de l'autorisation y prévue, mais ne satisfaisant pas aux exigences prévues au prédit règlement (CE) et/ou dans l'autorisation susvisée; quiconque met sur le marché, utilise ou transforme un OGM destiné à l'alimentation des animaux, des aliments pour animaux contenant des OGM ou consistant en de tels organismes ou des aliments pour animaux produits à partir d'OGM, sans avoir obtenu l'autorisation à ce requise en vertu du règlement (CE) susvisé; quiconque met sur le marché, utilise ou transforme des OGM ou des aliments pour animaux visés au tiret qui précède munis de l'autorisation y prévue, mais ne satisfaisant pas aux exigences prévues au prédit règlement (CE) et/ou dans l'autorisation susvisée. Est puni des peines prévues à l'article 42 de la loi modifiée du 13 janvier 1997 relative au contrôle de l'utilisation et de la dissémination des organismes génétiquement modifiés, quiconque contrevient aux dispositions du règlement (CE) N° 1830/2003 du Parlement Européen et du Conseil du 22 septembre 2003 concernant la traçabilité et l'étiquetage des organismes génétiquement modifiés et la traçabilité des produits destinés à l'alimentation humaine ou animale produits à partir d'organismes génétiquement modifiés, et modifiant la directive 2001/18/CE, publié au Journal Officiel de l'Union européenne N° L 268 du 18 octobre 2003 aux pages 24 à 28.

Policy: Order No. 50 of the Federal Forest Service validating the Regulation on fees for extraction of standing timber.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that fees for timber extraction of standing timber shall be applicable to main use felling and other types of felling of forest stock, except for forests previously owned by agricultural organizations. In case of timber extraction by means of intermediate felling, including thinning and sanitary felling, fees shall be reduced by 50 percent and for other types of intermediate felling fees shall be reduced by 30 percent. Rates of fees for standing timber shall vary according to forest species, timber, industrial wood and fuel wood. Fees shall be calculated for final harvesting on 1 hectare from 100,1 to 150 cubic metres and with a downhill gradient of 20 degrees.

Policy: Persistent Organic Pollutants: National Implementation Plan of Latvia for 2005-2020
Policy_Content: The Persistent Organic Pollutants: National Implementation Plan of Latvia for 2005-2020 is a multi-sectoral document. By implementing a sustainable policy, the document aims to ensure the protection of human health and the environment from the impact of POPs by developing and regularly improving the most effective and optimal POPs management system. Policy: Genetically Modified Organisms Act No. 27.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to contain the use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs), the deliberate release of GMOs into the environment, the placing on the market of a GMO or of a combination of GMOs, the transfer of GMOs and the import, export and transit of GMOs in order to protect human health and the environment  The Act consists of 143 articles divided into 8 Chapters: General provisions (I); Competent authorities (II); Contained use of GMOs (III); Procedure for deliberate release of GMOs into the environment and placing in the market of a GMO or of a combination of GMOs as or in products (IV); Import, export, Transit and unintentional transboundary movement of GMOs (V); Confidential information (VI); Control (VII); Coercive administrative measures and administrative penalty provisions (VIII). The Minister of Environment and Water and the Minister of Agriculture and Forestry shall conduct the state policy in the sphere of GMOs and shall coordinate the activity of the control authorities. Contained use of genetically modified micro-organisms, plants and animals are classified in classes as described in arts. 18 to 20. Contained use of GMOs shall be carried out in premises registered at the Ministry of Environment and Water (arts. 23 to 28). An assessment of the risk on short-term and long-term effects on human health and the environment shall be carried out and an authorization shall be obtained before the deliberate release of GMOs into the environment and the placing of GMOs on the market. Articles 79 to 82 specify which GMOs are prohibited to be released.

Policy: Greenhouse Gas Emissions Trading Scheme Regulations 2005 (S.I. No. 925 of 2005).
Policy_Content: These Regulations provide the framework for a greenhouse gas emissions trading scheme for the purpose of implementing Directive 2003/87/EC of the European Parliament and the Council establishing a scheme for greenhouse gas emission allowance trading within the Community and amending Council Directive 96/61/EC. They control emissions of carbon dioxide from any of the activities listed in Schedule 1 to the Regulations. Regulation 2 provides for the Scottish Ministers, Department of the Environment in Northern Ireland and National Assembly for Wales to act as appropriate authority for installations situated in their area. Part 1 of the Regulations sets out general provisions. Regulation 2 contains definitions including designating the regulators for installations under the scheme. The other regulations in Part 1 deal with general matters such as the service of notices under the Regulations. Part 2 deals with the need for a permit to operate an installation covered by the Regulations (reg.7), the procedure for granting permits and the contents of permits (regs. 8 to 10) and the treatment of permits once granted (regs. 14 to 18). The conditions of permits (reg.10) must ensure that the emissions of the installation are properly monitored and reported. Regulation 11 enables an installation in respect of which the European Commission has provided for temporary exclusion to apply for a certificate excluding it from the scheme. Regulations 14 to 17 deal with the variation, transfer, surrender and revocation of permits. Part 3 deals with the allocation of allowances. Regulation 20 requires the Secretary of State to develop a national allocation plan for each phase of the scheme and Regulation 21 provides for the Secretary of State to make a final allocation decision. Regulations 22 to 24 set the framework for the allocation of allowances to installations which obtain a permit after the national allocation plan has been submitted to the European Commission and for the treatment of installations which cease to be covered by the scheme. Regulation 26 makes provisions consequential to the Registries Regulation. Regulation 27 enables operators of certain installations to apply to form a pool. Part 4 (regs. 28 to 31) contains the enforcement powers under the Regulations. Part 5 (regs. 32 to 34) and Schedules 2 to 4 provide for appeals against decisions of the regulator and for appeals for the appropriate authority, responsible authority or the Secretary of State to reconsider decisions under the Regulations. Part 6 (regs. 35 to 37) sets out information gathering powers and publicity requirements. Part 7 (regs. 38 to 41) sets out offences for contraventions of the Regulations and civil penalties where an operator fails to surrender sufficient allowances to cover its specified emissions. Part 8 (regs. 36 and 37) enables the appropriate authority to give directions and guidance to regulators and Part 9 (regs. 44 and 45) enables the Secretary of State to give directions and guidance to the registry administrator. Part 10 (reg.46) identifies powers under the Regulations which can be exercised only with the agreement of the devolved administrations in relation to installations situated in their area.

Policy: Ley Foral Nº 4/2005 - Ley de intervención para la protección ambiental.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley de intervención para la protección ambiental, tiene por objeto regular las distintas formas de intervención administrativa de las Administraciones públicas de Navarra para la prevención, reducción y el control de la contaminación y el impacto ambiental sobre la atmósfera, el agua, el suelo, así como sobre la biodiversidad, de determinadas actividades, públicas o privadas, como medio de alcanzar la máxima protección posible del medio ambiente en su conjunto. En particular, esta Ley Foral tiene las siguientes finalidades: a) Establecer un control administrativo ambiental previo de determinados planes, programas, proyectos, actividades e instalaciones; b) Regular el proceso de integración de las variables ambientales en la redacción, puesta en marcha y ejecución de planes, programas y proyectos relativos a las actividades de las que puedan derivarse efectos significativos sobre el medio ambiente, mediante la propia evaluación ambiental, así como mediante el seguimiento y vigilancia posterior; c) Simplificar los procedimientos autorizatorios y de informe en materia ambiental; d) Fomentar y ordenar el intercambio, la difusión y la publicidad de la información ambiental; e) Incrementar la transparencia de la actividad administrativa, así como la participación ciudadana con el objetivo de lograr una mayor implicación de la sociedad en la protección del medio ambiente; f) Establecer mecanismos eficaces de inspección ambiental sobre distintas actividades e instalaciones a fin de controlar su adecuación a la legalidad y revisar la eficacia de las medidas correctoras impuestas; g) Regular las actuaciones para la restauración de la legalidad ambiental mediante la legalización de actividades, la imposición de medidas correctoras y, en su caso, la reparación o compensación de los daños causados al medio ambiente; h) Establecer un régimen sancionador para las infracciones a lo establecido en esta Ley Foral.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 90-p validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Berezovsky”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Berezovsky” shall be protection and reproduction of game subject to commercial hunting, conservation and restoration of the population of rare and endangered wild fauna species, including birds, valuable from economic, scientific and aesthetic point of view. The reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of the biodiversity of a unique natural complex in conditions of intensive anthropogenic change in the natural environment; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the national and regional Red Books of protected and endangered species; and (c) monitoring of the natural environment, wildlife, performance of scientific research. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature complex reserve: (a) hunting; (b) industrial fisheries; (c) main use felling, except for timber extraction within established amount by public institutions, agricultural organizations and local residents; (d) procurement of soft resin; (e) hydro amelioration, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) industrial harvesting of cedar nuts, mushrooms, berries, medicinal plants, technical raw materials and non-timber forest products; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage and application of toxic chemicals, radioactive and other hazardous substances; (k) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); (l) construction of roads and pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, allotment of land plots and construction of permanent or temporary buildings and structures, with the exception of buildings required for the protection and state control of the reserve territory, without prior authorization by the regional administration; and (m) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs.

Policy: Code of Practice for the Discharge of Produced Water from Coalbed Gas Operations (B.C.Reg. 156/2005).
Policy_Content: The present Code of practice enacts the Environmental Management Act. The Code lays down provisions relating to the discharge of produced water from coalbed gas operations. For the purpose of the present Regulation "produced water" means water extracted from a coal seam or a formation contiguous to a coal seam that: a) originates from within the coal seam or contiguous formations, b) is pumped out in advance of and in aid of the release of gas from the coal seam, and c) is produced in the course of a coal-bed gas exploration and production industry operation. Section 2 establishes that produced water may be discharged under this code only to: a) a perennial stream, b) a seasonal stream, or c) the ground by percolation through the ground. The text consists of 14 sections divided into 3 Parts as follows: Interpretation and application (1); Discharge of produced water (2); Monitoring, record-keeping and reporting (3).Three Schedules are enclosed.

Policy: Resolution No. 1322 of 2005 creating the Disaster Management Support Centre.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Resolution is to create the Disaster Management Support Centre and its  departments, and to define their duties. This Resolution is composed of 7 articles. Article 1 decrees that the Centre shall be placed under the control of the Council of Ministries. Article 2 defines functions and duties of the Centre which shall include: (a) creation of a database for probable disasters; (b) development of plans to control the impact of disasters; (c) capacity building of specialists and technical cadres; (d) response to probable disasters; (e) monitoring of disasters; (f) coordination between the different competent authorities for the choice of appropriate means to respond to disasters; (g) education about large disasters; (h) preparation of studies related to alternative lodging and accommodation; and (i) disaster impact assessments. Article 3 addresses functions and duties of the departments. Article 4 subdivides the Centre into the following departments: Planning and Training; Research; Analysis and Assessment; Information and Database; Communication and Coordination; and  Administrative Affairs. Articles 5-7 pertain to the subdivision and management of the departments.

Policy: Decree No. 36 of the Ministry of Taxes and Dues on calculation and payment of environmental fees.
Policy_Content: This Decree establishes that the payers of environmental fees shall be legal persons, foreign legal persons and international organizations, companies and economic groups. State-financed shall not pay environmental fees. Environmental fees for waste disposal shall be paid by the owners thereof or by the persons authorized by them. Environmental fees for emissions of the pollutants into atmospheric air during construction, repairs and maintenance with the use of paintwork materials shall be paid by the customer. Environmental fees shall be applicable to: (a) mining and extraction of minerals; (b) oil processing; (c) emissions into atmospheric air; (d) effluent waste water discharge; (e) waste disposal. Environmental fees the excess of the established limits for the extraction of natural resources shall be tenfold. Environmental fees for the excessive emissions and discharge of effluent waste water shall be fifteenfold. The calculation of environmental fees shall be based upon real volume of the extracted natural resources, minerals, disposed waste, emitted pollutants and discharged effluent waste water.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 233 validating the Regulation on determining and mapping coastlines.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree sets forth the modalities for the accurate determination and mapping of coastlines. The crossline between the surface of surface waterbodies (seas, lakes, rivers, ponds and water reservoirs) and the surface of dry land over a specified period of time shall delineate the coastline. Coastline of seas, lakes, rivers and water reservoirs can be permanent and steady; and impermanent and unsteady (average multiyear level). The coastline of the Caspian Sea shall be determined according to its average multiyear level. The coastlines of water reservoirs shall be established at the normal water level sufficient for their operation.

Policy: Ordonnance concernant la lutte contre le bostryche.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance met en exécution la loi fédérale du 4 octobre 1991 sur les forêts (LFo), l’ordonnance fédérale du 30 novembre 1992 sur les forêts (OFo), la loi du 2 mars 1999 sur les forêts et la protection contre les catastrophes naturelles (LFCN) et le règlement du 11 décembre 2001 sur les forêts et la protection contre les catastrophes naturelles (RFCN). Considérant que la prolifération du bostryche typographe est de nature à mettre en danger la conservation de la forêt. Des mesures de lutte doivent être entreprises dans les forêts de montagne qui correspondent aux forêts protectrices et à la zone tampon qui les entoure, selon la terminologie fédérale. Les mesures ordonnées sont indemnisées par la Confédération et le canton. La Direction des institutions, de l’agriculture et des forêts peut décider d’octroyer une aide financière cantonale pour les mesures de lutte conseillées dans les autres forêts, l’ordonnance a pour objet la détermination des mesures qu’il y a lieu d’observer aux fins de lutte contre le bostryche. Le texte comprend 12 articles répartis en 4 chapitres comme suit: Object (1er); Mesures de lutte (2); Subventionnement (3); Dispositions finales (4).
Subject: Forestry
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe
Entry into force notes: La présente ordonnance entre en vigueur avec effet rétroactif au 1er mars 2005.

Policy: Regional Law No. 450-OZ “On state support of agro-industrial complex”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the grounds for state support of agro-industrial complex with a view of promoting agricultural development, raising agricultural production and ensuring food security. State support of agro-industrial complex shall be considered system of arrangements and measures, including financial support out of regional budget. State support shall be granted to the producers of agricultural commodities, including individual entrepreneurs, farmers and cooperatives. Financial support shall be granted in the form of subsidies, incentives and credits.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Food & nutrition
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Law No. 451-OZ “On development of non-traditional renewable energy sources”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to regulates relations between regional administration, local government, producers and consumers of renewable energy. It shall be applicable to all the aspects and types of renewable energy management. The right of ownership of solar energy, wind energy and low potential thermal energy shall be regulated by this Regional Law. Electric, thermal and mechanic energy obtained from renewable energy sources shall be property of the producer and shall be used at discretion thereof in compliance with acting legislation. Priority location of renewable energy sources shall be areas of decentralized energy supply where construction of traditional electric power stations is economically unprofitable or practically impossible also due to low density of the population. Producers of renewable energy shall be granted state support in the form of preferential regional taxation, public loans and credits.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decreto Nº 7-2005 — Ley del Consejo Nacional Anticorrupción (CNA).
Policy_Content: La presente Ley crea el Consejo Nacional Anticorrupción (CNA), que apoyará las políticas y las acciones que, en el combate contra la corrupción, emprenda el Gobierno. Serán sus funciones de: 1) Proponer políticas, estrategias y planes de acción para prevenir y combatir la corrupción; 2) Concertar con las entidades gubernamentales competentes la implementación de las acciones contenidas en la Estrategia Nacional Anticorrupción y sus planes de acción; 3) Colaborar con las autoridades en el diseño de los mecanismos de seguimiento y evaluación y participar en su puesta en práctica; 4) Instar la formación de alianzas estratégicas anticorrupción y/o pro-transparencia entre instituciones de los sectores públicos y privados; 5) Asesorar a las autoridades o particulares que lo soliciten y a las organizaciones locales y regionales; 6) Promover una cultura nacional contra la corrupción con todos los sectores de la sociedad mediante campañas permanentes de sensibilización ciudadana; 7) Conocer, por medio de la Unidad Ejecutora. los informes de casos y situaciones que lleguen a su conocimiento, trasladando, si procediere, su informe y recomendaciones a los órganos públicos competentes para los fines legales consiguientes; 8) Atender oportunamente las solicitudes que, en el campo de su competencia, le formulen el Ministerio Público u otras autoridades.

Policy: Regional Act No. 12 on town and country planning.
Policy_Content: There is hereby laid down the legislative framework in matter of town and country planning, in compliance with the principles of subsidiarity, cooperation and sustainability. Plans shall be subjected to environmental assessments, so as to contribute to the protection of the environment and regional landscape.

Policy: Law pertaining to principles of emergency response and compensation for damages in pollution of marine environment by oil and other harmful substances.
Policy_Content: The objective of this Law is to define the obligations and responsibilities of the related parties, ministries, public institutions and agencies regarding emergency intervention against sea pollution by oil and oil products. It also sets out the principles of compensation of injuries due to the sea pollution. The coordinating institution for implementation of this Law is the Ministry of Environment and Forestry. Preparating emergency intervention plans and implementing them in coastal areas, detecting the types and impacts of pollution, measuring the extent of the damage on the environment, and rehabilitating the effected areas are the main tasks of the Ministry. The undersecretary of maritime affairs is responsible for the implementation of emergency intervention plans originating from sea vessels, intervention preparedness, intervention, and compensation of injuries. Security affairs related to interventions are carried out by the coast guard. All parties responsible for an incident that pollutes the sea environment are accountable for meeting the costs of cleansing, protective measures, rehabilitation of the environment, transportation and disposal of the wastes, and for compensation of the injuries towards third parties, including loss of income. Relevant details are given in the text.
Subject: Environment gen., Sea
Geographical_area: Asia, Black Sea, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: The Law shall enter into force three months after the publication in the Official Journal.

Policy: Decree No. 14293 of 2005 issuing requirements and conditions for buildings, installations, elevators and for the protection against fires and earthquakes in order to guarantee public safety and security.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Decree is guarantee the public safety. This Decree is composed of 10 articles and 3 Annexes. Article 1 deals with terms and definitions. Article 2 defines requirements and conditions necessary for public safety in construction areas. Article 3 adopts the technical requirements mentioned in article 1 related to the guarantee of public safety in constructions and installations as well as the Horizontal Acceleration Coefficient against earthquakes. Article 4 deals with the following matters, on which this Decree shall be applied: (a) new constructions and installations; and (b) buildings and installations already constructed or in phase of construction. Article 5 refers to  the verification of public safety requirements. Article 6 pertains to liability and insurance.  All Annexes are to be considered as an integral part of this Decree (art. 7). Annex I contains 3 Chapters dealing with the mechanisms of technical revision. The technical revision phases are the following: (a) general technical requirements applied to the obligatory technical verification; (b) principal duties for the technical verification; and (c) optional secondary duties for the technical verification such as function for installations, noise isolation, architectural barriers, technical management of buildings and the protection of the environment. Annex 2 contains 3 Chapters dealing with: (a) hiring of technical revisers and definition of their duties; (b) classification categories of technical revisers; and (c) rules and morals of the technical reviser profession. Annex 4 contains 4 Chapters dealing with particular rules related to public safety in all kinds of elevators.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Mediterranean, Middle East, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Western Asia
Entry into force notes: This Decree enters into force on 24 March 2005.

Policy: Regional Law No. 94-GD “On land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates land relations within the framework of plenary powers transferred to the regional executive bodies by the federal legislation. Regional Government shall perform the following plenary powers: (a) decision-making related to expropriation, including bailout, in cases envisaged by acting legislation; (b) land reclamation; (c) modalities of calculation of land lease and land rent payment for public land pertaining to regional ownership; (d) validation of cadastre land evaluation; and (e) application of land use restrictions. Local government shall have the following competence: (a) improvement of soil fertility; (b) land-use planning; (c) setting maximum and minimum land area allotted to citizens out of stock of public and municipal land for subsidiary smallholding; and (d) application of public servitude to the benefit of local government and local population.

Policy: Factories and other Places of Work (Noise Prevention and Control) Rules, 2005 (L.N. No. 25 of 2005).
Policy_Content: These Regulations prescribe measures against noise in any factory, premises, places processes and operations to which the provisions of the factories and other Places of work Act apply. Regulation 4 prescribes compulsory noise levels. Where noise exceeds the continuous equivalent a specified level, the occupier of a premises must develop and implement an effective noise control and hearing conservation programme in accordance with regulation 5. Regulation 6 prescribes regular noise measurements to be carried out by an occupier. Other noise prevention and reduction measures are prescribed such as establishment of noise hazard areas, information and training and control of equipment. (20 regulations)
