Policy: Joint Decree No. 5/6 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection and the Ministry of Agriculture and Food validating the Regulation on management of unfit pesticides.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 10 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1); 2) the modalities of management of unfit pesticides (sect. 2); 3) duties of the owners of unfit pesticides (sect. 3); 4) registration and inventory of unfit pesticides (sect. 4); 5) storage and transport of unfit pesticides (sect. 5); 6) repackaging of unfit pesticides (sect. 6); 7) the modalities and methods of identification of unfit pesticides (sect. 7); 8) fire safety and accident prevention in the process of management of unfit pesticides (sect. 8); 9) environmental monitoring in the location area of the storehouses of unfit pesticides (sect. 9); 10) environmental requirements for the sterilization of unfit pesticides (sect. 10). The present Regulation establishes environmental requirements for the management of unfit pesticides. Unfit pesticides shall be considered pesticides with the expired date of application, that became worthless under other circumstances, prohibited for the utilization or in the absence of quality certificate and shall be classified as hazardous waste. Management of unfit pesticides shall regard activity dealing with collection, storage, repackaging, transport and disinfection of unfit pesticides. Long-term storage of unfit pesticides shall mean safe storage for environment and human health for the period of over twenty-five years in special packages or in special storehouses. The registration of unfit pesticides shall be carried out for the purpose of qualitative and quantitative valuation thereof. Packages for the transport and storage of unfit pesticides must be made of plastic and must be hermetic. Joint storage of unfit pesticides and agricultural machinery and equipment, animal feed and other outfit shall be prohibited. Transportation of unfit pesticides in bulk shall be prohibited. Sterilization of unfit pesticides by means of burial thereof shall be prohibited.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Town and Country Planning (Temporary Stop Notice)(England) Regulations 2005 (S.I. 206 of 2005).

Section 171F(1)(a) provides that a TSN does not prohibit the use of a building as a dwelling house. Section 171F(1)(b) enables the Secretary of State to prescribe descriptions of activities which are not prohibited by a TSN, and circumstances in which the carrying out of an activity is not prohibited by a TSN.

Policy: Order No. 40 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection validating Model Regulation on ecological inspection.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that ecological inspection shall be constituted on territorial basis and it shall carry out control and supervision functions in the sphere of environmental protection and natural resources. The main tasks of ecological inspection shall be: (a) state supervision and control in the sphere of protection of environment and natural resources within its competence; and (b) enforcement of environmental protection legislation. Ecological inspection shall carry out the following functions: (a) inspection and supervision; (b) enforcement of ecological requirements; (c) state control over land tenure and land protection; (d) analysis of environmental pollution; (e) calculation of damages caused by infringement of environmental legislation; and (f) legal proceedings related to environmental offences.

Policy: Regional Law No. 205-Z N 415-III “On ecological awareness and education.”
Policy_Content: This Regional Law is aimed at regulation of legal relations in the field of environmental awareness and education. Environmental education shall be intended continuous, systematic process and purposeful formation of emotional and moral, humane and respectful attitude of man to nature and moral and ethical environmental standards. Environmental awareness shall be intended dissemination of environmental knowledge, information about the state of environment, natural resources, environmental security with a view of formation of the foundations of ecological culture in society. The main tasks in the field of environmental education and awareness shall be as follows: (a) delineation of powers in the field of environmental education and awareness  between public authorities, local authorities, self-government, educational authorities at various levels, and also between non-profit organizations and citizens responsible for the formation of the ecological culture of the individual; and (b) creating conditions for environmental education, awareness and implementation of environmental knowledge in everyday life, coordination of the activities of organizations, public associations and citizens related to the formation of the ecological culture of each person and society as a whole. Measures aimed at participating in the implementation of the unified state policy in the field of environmental education and awareness on the regional territory shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the priority of environmental knowledge in the system of education; (b) ensuring the openness and accessibility of environmental information; (c) ensuring consistency, complexity, continuity of environmental education and awareness; (d) ensuring transparency in the implementation of the unified state policy and programs in the field of environmental education and awareness on the regional territory; (e) ensuring the responsibility of public authorities and local authorities for creating conditions for access of citizens of to environmental education and awareness; (f) implementation of coordinated actions of state authorities, local governments, educational institutions, educational, scientific and cultural organizations and institutions, mass media, non-profit organizations and citizens in the field of environmental education and awareness; (g) combination of public administration and public self-government in the system of continuous environmental education and awareness; (h) support for interregional and international cooperation in the field of environmental education and awareness; (i) using the experience of the indigenous peoples of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia) in the system of environmental education and awareness, as well as training of staff in this field; and (j) recognition of the value and necessity of using ecological and educational experience of indigenous peoples residing on the regional territory.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Decree No. 68 of the Council of Ministers validating the Regulation on Chernevichi biosphere reserve.
Policy_Content: Chernevichi biosphere reserve shall be allotted the area of 10180 hectares and shall have as its purpose the conservation in its natural state the unique landscape along Berezina river and the natural habitats of protected and endangered wildlife species recorded in the Red Book of Belarus. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of Chernevichi biosphere reserve: 1) any activity causing change of the natural landscape and hydrological regime, including peat extraction; 2) ploughing up the natural hayfields; 3) waste disposal; 4) grazing in the forests; 5) industrial collection (procurement) of non-timber forest products and medicinal herbs; 6) clearing of riverside natural growth except for recreational areas; 7) setting up tourist camps; 8) all types of felling except for sanitary felling; 9) introduction of alien forest species. The proclamation of Chernevichi biosphere reserve shall not entail the expropriation of land. The regional executive bodies shall be the managing authority of Chernevichi biosphere reserve. The damages caused to Chernevichi biosphere reserve shall be compensated by the legal and natural persons in conformity with the modalities established by law.

Policy_Content: The present Agreement constitutes a final settlement of the aboriginal rights of the Labrador Inuit in Canada and exhaustively sets out the rights of the Labrador Inuit that recognized and confirmed by section 35 of the Constitution Act, 1982. In exchange for the rights and benefits specified in the Agreement, Inuit will cede and release to Canada and Newfoundland and Labrador all of their aboriginal rights outside of Labrador Inuit Lands and Aboriginal rights related to subsurface resources in Labrador Inuit Lands. The Labrador Inuit will retain all other aboriginal rights in Labrador Inuit Lands. Continuing Aboriginal rights are modified as set out in the Agreement and must be exercised in ways that are consistent with the Agreement.

Policy: Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) Order 2005 (S.I. 85 of 2005).
Policy_Content: This Order amends the "1995 Order", mainly in relation to permitted development rights. This Order amends the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995. Part 3 of Schedule 2 to that Order grants planning permission for certain changes of use by reference to classes of use specified in the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987. That Order is amended by the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) (Amendment) (England) Order 2005 which substitutes for the former class A3 (food and drink), three new use classes: restaurants and cafes (A3), drinking establishments (A4) and hot food takeaways (A5). Article 2 of this Order, which amends Part 3 of Schedule 2 to the 1995 Order, reflects the three new use classes, which replace the former class A3 (food and drink). The three new use classes are given permitted development rights to change to shops (A1) uses or financial and professional services (A2) uses specified in the 1987 Order. Drinking establishments and hot food takeaways are given permitted development rights to change to restaurants and cafes.
Subject: Food & nutrition, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Regional Law No. 422-OZ “On allocation of land parcels in ownership to citizens free of charge”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of allocation of parcels of public land to citizens free of charge for gardening, horticulture and stockbreeding, and establishes minimum and maximum land area of the aforesaid parcels. It establishes that regional resident – natural person that has never had nor has parcel of agricultural land in ownership for subsistence farming, gardening or horticulture, shall be granted the right to receive in ownership a land parcel for each of the aforesaid purposes once-only. The aforesaid land parcels shall be allotted from public of municipal land stock. Maximum land areas of agricultural land parcels shall be established as follows: (a) for gardening – 0.15 ha; (b) for horticulture – 0.1ha; and (c) for subsistence farming – 1ha at maximum.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Regulation on the procedure for rate setting of discharge of pollutants to waterbodies.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that rate setting of discharge of pollutants to waterbodies shall be established by fixing maximum allowable limits of discharge of pollutants together with effluent waste water to waterbodies. Maximum allowable limits of the discharge of pollutants shall be the basis for planning of pollution control activities and shall be integral part of the authorization for special water uses. In cases where the water management system and water protection activities of operating enterprises do not meet the rules and regulations in the field of water use and protection of water (water abstraction above established limits, the absence or inefficient operation of sewage treatment or other water protection waterworks, poor technical condition of water management facilities, water pollution etc.), the aforesaid enterprises shall not be issued authorization for special water uses. In these cases, the environmental authorities draw up a statement indicating the reasons for the refusal to issue a permit for special water uses and give a mandatory prescription to eliminate these causes within certain periods. At the same time, environmental protection authorities set to the enterprise water abstraction limits and maximum allowable limits of discharge of pollutants. Annex 1 contains the form of Annex to the authorization for special water uses fixing maximum allowable limits for discharge of pollutants to waterbodies.
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Surface water,Pollution control,Effluent waste water/discharge,Waterworks,Authorization/permit,Water abstraction,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution

Policy: Regulation on the positions important for ensuring nuclear safety and radiological protection and on radiological protection inspectors

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 7057 validating the Regulation on preparation of documentation, registration and issuance of certificates for land plots allotted in ownership, tenancy and lease.

Land plots can be conceded in ownership to Turkmenistan nationals for subsidiary smallholding in rural areas, and for individual housing construction in the towns and townships. Policy: Order No. 12 of the Committee on Forestry and Hunting validating the Regulation on transfer of unforested land to forested land within state forest fund.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that transfer of unforested land to forested land within state forest fund shall be carried out by public forest owner in accordance with the modalities set by this Governmental Order. Felling areas, burnt forest areas, grassy glades and areas of dead vegetation shall be subject to transfer to forested land category after afforestation and reforestation arrangements or natural afforestation and reforestation. Transfer shall be carried out after inspection of the areas by the officials of the authorized forestry institution. Assessment of the state of natural afforestation of coniferous and broad-leaved forest species shall be carried out in accordance with scale set by normative legal acts regulating the issues of timber extraction. Annex 1 contains the scale of normative assessment indices of forest species subject to transfer to forested land.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 1 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Sviyazhsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve “Sviyazhsky” shall be classified as complex (environmental and zoological) protected area. The scope of constituting the aforesaid state nature reserve of regional significance shall be conservation of precious natural complexes, including wetlands and natural and artificial ecosystem of the Sviyaga river and Kuybyshev water reservoir, biological diversity and fish stocks of marketable and rare freshwater fish species. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural ecosystems and landscapes; (b) conservation of rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (c) conservation and reproduction of marketable and rare freshwater fish species; (c) regulation of recreational activity; and (d) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature reserve: (a) modification of hydrological regime; (b) commercial hunting; (c) drainage and land reclamation; (d) spring hunting; (e) burning of vegetation; and (f) littering.

Chapter II specifies the objects of auction, which include forest products and also animals, wild plants, etc. (art. 2), and auction bidders and applicants. Chapter III deals with matters related to auction price, cost of administration, auction fee and poor compensation. Chapter IV gives provisions on the implementation of auction which include announcement of the auction and proceedings in case of positive or negative outcome of the auction. Proceeds of auction shall be paid to the state treasury as specified in Chapter V. Chapter VI provides for the measurement of object of the auction based on the draught survey method. A Certificate of Goods Found for found forest products shall be made and the public shall be informed to eventually claim the ownership of the products (Chapter VII). The Department of Forestry shall perform supervision, control and development of the found, seized and confiscated forest products.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1-RZ “On state support of peasant farms and smallholders”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law ensures state support of peasant farms and smallholders with a view of raising amount and improvement of efficiency of the production of agricultural commodities, and raising rural employment. It shall be applicable to peasant farms, smallholders and associations thereof. State support arrangements shall include: (a) preferential taxation terms for peasant farms and smallholders; (b) allotment of land plots on lease out of stock of land destined for re-distribution; and (c) provision of peasant farms and smallholders with livestock, seeds and planting material on leasing. State support shall be granted in the form of public subsidies allocated out of the regional budget.

Policy: Finland’s National Strategy for Adaptation to Climate Change 2005.
Policy_Content: The Finnish Government submitted a Government Report on the National Climate Strategy to the Parliament in March 2001. In early 2003 the Ministry of Trade and Industry together with other ministries prepared a progress report for the Parliament on the implementation of the National Climate Strategy. The strategy describes the impacts of climate change in the following sectors: agriculture and food production, forestry, fisheries, reindeer husbandry, game management, water resources, biodiversity, industry, energy, traffic, land use and communities, building, health, tourism and recreation, and insurance. The strategy describes the present sensitivity to climate change and outlines actions and measures to improve the capacity and to adapt to future climate change. The strategy aims at reducing the negative consequences and taking advantage of the opportunities associated with climate change. The Adaptation Strategy includes a proposal on starting a research programme.

Policy: National Strategy for Conservation of Biodiversity in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
Policy_Content: The National Biodiversity Strategy for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia is a sectoral document aiming at introducing the conservation and sustainable use of biodiversity into the national planning process; providing the basic information and a significant contribution to the Convention on Biological Diversity ratified by Saudi Arabia. Because the Strategy covers many issues, its effective implementation requires a high level of political support as well as coordination between government, non-governmental organization, and the private sectors. The Strategy consists of V Parts, as follows: Purpose and scope (I); Islamic Vision (II); Status of terrestrial, marine and freshwater biodiversity (III); 17 Strategic Goals (IV); Mechanism of implementation and subsequent monitoring. The main purpose of the conservation and sustainable use of Biodiversity will be achieved through the following specific strategic goals: in-situ conservation both inside and outside protected areas; ex-situ conservation; conserving and developing forests and woodlands, desert rangelands, living marine resources and agricultural biodiversity; botanic and zoological gardens regulating access to genetic resources in addition to national parks and introducing national biosafety standards; enacting environmental legislation, supporting scientific research, enhancing environmental education, and achieving socio-economic development; encouraging collaborative management and promoting cooperation for biodiversity; generating income from wildlife resources and developing ecotourism and nature-based tourism.

Policy: Strategic Plan for the Ministry of Water and Irrigation.
Policy_Content: This Strategic Plan (2005 – 2009) sets the strategic objectives that the Ministry of Water and Irrigation will pursue during a five-year period. It identifies the role of the Ministry in support of water, sanitation, and irrigation sector development. The strategic objectives are in line with the national development goals as articulated in the Economic Recovery Strategy for Wealth and Employment Creation (2003). They also seek to implement sector-wide strategies outlined in the Sessional Paper No. 1 of 1999 on National Policy on Water Resources Management and Development, and the Water Act (2002). To sustain this effort as well as redress the increasing degradation of water catchment areas, reduce unaccounted for water and increase coverage, a radical reform programme in the water and sanitation sector is in the process of being implemented. This reform is driven by the National Policy on Water Resources Management and Development (1999), National Water Resources Management Strategy of 2003, the draft National Water Services Strategy (2003) and the Draft Zero Investment Plan (2003). The Water Act of 2002 creates the legal framework for the implementation of these policies.

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Cross Compliance) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (S.R. No. 6 of 2005).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision in Northern Ireland for the administration and enforcement of compliance of farmers with a range of laws and standards regarding "good agricultural and environmental condition". The Department of Agriculture and Rural Development, as the competent national authority, shall be responsible for providing farmers with a list of the statutory management requirements and standards of good agricultural and environmental condition on their land. These Regulations set out the standards of good agricultural and environmental condition which will apply in Northern Ireland, as required by Article 5(1) of the Council Regulation No 1782/2003. The standards concern: soil management, supplementary feeding, overgrazing, undergrazing, field boundaries, protection of semi-natural habitats and historic monuments, compliance with various statutory provisions, new works, and  burning of ground cover.

Policy: Provisions on the Gas Control of State-owned Coal Mines.
Policy_Content: The purpose of these Regulations is to carry out gas controlling guidelines of pumping prior to mining, monitor and control and determin the output by wind quantities, and prevent the occurrence of major gas accidents. The Text consist of 10 Articles.  State-owned coal mines shall set up gas controlling institutions and have professional technical personnel, establish gas controlling responsibility systems and management systems and raise funds for the control. The main person-in-charge of a coal mine shall be the first responsible person for the gas control; the chief engineer of a coal mine shall assume technical responsibilities for the gas control and shall be in charge of the formulation of gas controlling schemes, safety technical measures and fund arrangements and uses. The deputy manager of a coal mine in charge of the safety work shall be responsible for the supervision over and check of the gas controlling work; and other deputy managers shall be responsible for the implementation of gas controlling schemes and measures in their respective assigned fields.  The person-on-duty of a coal mine shall undertake full responsibilities for the production safety work on the current day, shall know the number of persons of current shift that have gone down into the mine, and shall take immediate measures to deal with any found hidden trouble relating to gas. A coal mine must establish a gas gradation appraisal system for coal mines and a reliable monitoring and control system.

Policy: Order No. 1 of the State Committee of Land Resources validating the Regulation on the modalities of issue and cancellation of special permits for removal and transfer of the fertile soil layer of the plots of land.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the modalities of issue and cancellation of special permits for removal and transfer of the fertile soil layer of the plots of land. The provisions of the Regulation establish the modalities of application for obtaining special permit for removal and transfer of the fertile soil layer of the plots of land that are compulsory for land users whose activity is related to the disturbance of the upper (fertile) soil layer. Owners of the plots of land and land users that carry out mining, prospecting, exploration and other activities related to the removal and transfer of the fertile soil layer must obtain special permit. Special permits shall not be required for removal of fertile soil layer within the boundaries of a single plot of land allotted for agricultural production, gardening and individual farming for personal consumption. In order to obtain special permit land users shall submit written application to the territorial body of the State Land Inspection accompanied by land ownership certificate, passport of the citizen, land survey plan and copy of the authorization to carry it out, agro-chemical certificate of the plot of land, copy of contract for carrying out removal and transfer of fertile soil layer and copy of payment of special permit fee. Special permits can be cancelled in case of expropriation of the plot of land, non-observance of the environmental standards as regards re-cultivation of land and of soil conservation requirements. If after the imposition of an administrative penalty the applicant refuses to stop the violation of land legislation and eliminate its consequences, the inspection body of the State Land Committee re-imposes an administrative penalty on him under Article 188-5 of the Code of Ukraine on Administrative Offenses.

Policy: National Environmental Policy Act (7 CFR 1b.1-1b.4).
Policy_Content: The National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) sets forth departmental policy concerning NEPA, establishes categorical exclusions of actions carried out by the Department and its agencies, and sets forth those USDA agencies which are excluded from the requirement to prepare procedures implementing NEPA. According to its policy regulations, all policies and programs of the various USDA agencies shall be planned, developed, and implemented so as to achieve the goals and to follow the procedures declared by NEPA in order to assure responsible stewardship of the environment for present and future generations. Each USDA agency is responsible for compliance with this part, the regulations of the Council on Environmental Quality, and NEPA. Further, the categorical exclusions enumerate categories of activities which have been determined not to have a significant individual or cumulative effect on the human environment and are excluded from the preparation of environmental assessment or environmental impact statement, unless individual agency procedures prescribed otherwise.  Examples of the excluded categories include policy development, planning and implementation which relate to routine activities, such as personnel, organizational changes, or similar administrative functions or activities which deal solely with the funding of programs, such as program budget proposals, disbursements, and transfer or reprogramming of funds, etc. The list of USDA agencies and agency units found to have no individual or cumulative effect on the human environment includes Agricultural Marketing Service, Economic Research Service, Federal Corp Insurance Corporation, Food and Consumer Service, Food Safety and Inspection Service, Foreign Agricultural Service, Grain Inspection, Packers and Stockyards Administration, National Agricultural Library, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Office of the General Counsel, and Office of the Inspector General.

Policy: Policy and Strategy for the Forestry and Range Management Sub-Sectors
Policy_Content: Policy and Strategy for Forestry and Range Management Sub-Sectors is a national Policy aims to protect, rehabilitate, and develop forests and ranges in the country. The Policy emphasizes the sustainable use and sustainable development of forests and rangeland. The Policy aims to achieve a balance between maximization of productivity of agricultural lands and natural resources in one hand, and the protection and development of natural and wildlife resources on the other hand. To meet this objective, the Policy sets a number of strategies for utilization of forests and ranges, establishment of a sustained balance between production of dryland farming, irrigated farming, livestock husbandry, forest products, wildlife exploitation in one hand and their protection on the other hand, improvement of the community-based management and development of forests, rangeland, and wildlife. The Policy sets provisions for the regulation of forests resources, ranges, and wildlife for use of people and authorities; community’s contribution in decision making and planning; recognition of right of people to use the forests, ranges, and wildlife resources; consideration of the public benefits; consideration of all potential uses of forests and ranges resources; provision of a standard system for evaluation of lands; promotion of social protection system; improvement of fodder supplies for animals; combating drought and desertification in the country; usage of modern technical methods for improvement of forests’ productions and environment protection. The Government is required to prepare a legal system for the use of forests and ranges by people and transfer the grazing lands to qualified people or institutions. The integrated natural resource management approach shall be taken by sub-sector partners for management of forests and rangelands. To meet the community-based managerial approach, people and communities are required to create planning and organization committee, make fundamental decisions on local strategies, provide human and technical resources, monitor the implementation of regulations, evaluate the market, and facilitate the access to basic services. The Policy asks for the establishment of a Central Forests Research Facility.

Policy: Regulation on water pollution control.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets forth principles and procedures aimed at ensuring the protection of underground and surface waters. State Hydraulic Works shall ensure that water resources quality meets the required quality criteria. Territorial surface waters are classified into: (i) high quality waters; (ii) minimal polluted waters; (iii) polluted waters; and (iv) highly polluted waters. Lakes, ponds and dam reservoirs are also classified and details are given in the tables attached. Underground waters are classified into: (i) high quality underground waters; (ii) medium quality underground waters; and (iii) low quality underground waters. Sea and coastal waters are classified into: (i) fishery areas; (ii) recreational areas; and (iii) areas destined to commercial, industrial and other uses. Prohibitions imposed for all water resources and discharge conditions as well as disposal and treatment procedures are laid down as well.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal grounds of state policy in the sphere of social support of low income categories of the population. Measures of state support shall include provision of financial means and in kind, in the form of privileges and services performed with the consideration of social guarantees legally established by the state. Social aid to the population shall have as its scope improvement of well-being of the less protected strata of the population. Social support of the population shall be regulated by social contract concluded by low income citizen and public welfare institution.  Social contract shall envisage social adaptation arrangements including subsidiary small-holding (individual personal farming) by citizen. Low income citizens shall have the right to obtain from regional bodies foodstuffs and infant food for children of 1-2 years of age.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 331-p validating the Regulation on state nature complex reserve of regional significance “River Tatarka”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature complex reserve of regional significance “River Tatarka” shall be protection and reproduction of game subject to commercial hunting, conservation and restoration of the population of rare and endangered wild fauna species, including birds, valuable from economic, scientific and aesthetic point of view. The reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of the biodiversity of the natural landscape of the western slope of the Yenisei Ridge; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the national and regional Red Books of protected and endangered species; (c) conservation of fish stocks (spawning grounds, feeding grounds) and (d) monitoring of the natural environment, wildlife, performance of scientific research. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature complex reserve: (a) hunting; (b) industrial fisheries; (c) main use felling; (d) procurement of soft resin; (e) hydro amelioration, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) industrial harvesting of cedar nuts, mushrooms, berries, medicinal plants, technical raw materials and non-timber forest products; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage and application of toxic chemicals, radioactive and other hazardous substances; (k) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); (l) construction of roads and pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, allotment of land plots and construction of permanent or temporary buildings and structures, with the exception of buildings required for the protection and state control of the reserve territory, without prior authorization by the regional administration; and (m) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 331-p validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Mashukovsky”.
Policy_Content: The scope of constituting protected area - state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Mashukovsky” shall be protection and reproduction of game subject to commercial hunting, conservation and restoration of the population of rare and endangered wild fauna species, including birds, valuable from economic, scientific and aesthetic point of view. The reserve shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation of the biodiversity of the unique natural landscape of the southern taiga of Krasnoyarsk Territory; (b) maintaining optimal conditions for reproduction and migration of wild fauna species, including species listed in the national and regional Red Books of protected and endangered species; (c) conservation of fish stocks (spawning grounds, feeding grounds) and (d) monitoring of the natural environment, wildlife, performance of scientific research. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state nature complex reserve: (a) hunting; (b) industrial fisheries; (c) main use felling; (d) procurement of soft resin; (e) hydro amelioration, irrigation, exploration of subsoil and mining; (f) blasting operations; (g) water logging; (h) industrial harvesting of cedar nuts, mushrooms, berries, medicinal plants, technical raw materials and non-timber forest products; (i) burning of vegetation; (j) storage and application of toxic chemicals, radioactive and other hazardous substances; (k) movement and parking of motor vehicles outside roads of common access (except for service vehicles); (l) construction of roads and pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, allotment of land plots and construction of permanent or temporary buildings and structures, with the exception of buildings required for the protection and state control of the reserve territory, without prior authorization by the regional administration; and (m) destruction or damaging of barriers, boards and other information displays and indication signs.

Policy: Investment Promotion Act, 2004.
Policy_Content: This Act provides that investors, whether local or foreign need to obtain an investment certificate from the Authority prior to investing in the country. The condition to getting the certificate include: (a) the application is complete and satisfies the applicable requirements under the law; (b) the amount to be invested by a foreign investor is at least one hundred thousand United States of America dollars or the equivalent in any currency; (c) the amount to be invested by a local investor is at least one million shillings or the equivalent in another currency; and (d) the investment and the activity related to the investment are lawful and beneficial to Kenya. The Authority makes a decision to issue the certificate on the following principles: (a) creation of employment for Kenyans; (b) acquisition of new skills or technology for Kenyans; (c) contribution to tax revenues or other Government revenues; (d) a transfer of technology to Kenya; (e) an increase in foreign exchange , either through exports or import substitution; (f) utilization of domestic raw materials, supplies and services; (g) adoption of value addition in the processing of local, natural and agricultural resources; (h) utilization, promotion, development and implementation of information and communication technology; among others. The Act continues the existence of the already established Investment Promotion Centre which it renames to the Kenya Investment Authority. The Authority performs the following functions: (a) assist foreign and local investors and potential investors;(b) promote, both locally and internationally, the opportunities for investment in Kenya; (c) review the investment environment and make recommendations to the Government and others, with respect to changes that would promote and facilitate investment, including changes to licensing requirements; (d) facilitate and manage investment sites, estates or land together with associated facilities on the sites, estates and land; (e) appoint agents within the country and in any other country to carry out certain functions on its behalf, as it may consider necessary; among others. The Act provides for the administration and constitution of the Authority, to wit, it provides for constitution of a Board to manage its daily activities, terms of office, remuneration of board members, etc. The National Investment Council is also established to: (a) advise the Government and government agencies on ways to increase investment and economic growth in Kenya; and (b) promote co-operation between the public and private sectors in the formulation and implementation of government policies relating to the economy and investment.

Elle fixe les règles particulières relatives au commerce du cacao et du café, et a pour objet de consacrer la libéralisation, de favoriser le développement d'une concurrence saine et loyale entre les opérateurs des filières du cacao et du café, et de protéger le producteur. Sont interdites: la concession en monopole des zones d'achat et l'attribution de quotas réservés aux opérateurs des filières cacao et café. Le cacao et le café sont achetés aux producteurs suivant un prix: différencié par qualité, négocié et fixé d'accord parties sur la base des prix de référence publiés par le système d'information dans les conditions fixées par voie réglementaire. Sont interdites, la pratique des mélanges de qualités ainsi que les ententes entre les acheteurs ou leurs organisations en vue d'imposer un prix unique aux producteurs.

Policy: Combustion Plants Emission Protection Act.
Policy_Content: The present Act makes provisions to reduce emissions of certain pollutants into the air from large combustion plants. The Act applies to combustion plants, the rated thermal input of which is equal to or greater than 50 MW, regardless of the type of fuel used (solid, liquid or gaseous). For the purposes of these provisions, "combustion plant" means any technical apparatus in which fuels are oxidized in order to use the heat thus generated. Moreover, the present Act draws up a prgoramme for the progressive reduction of total annual emissions from existing plants. The text consists of 31 articles and 4 Annexes as follows: Threshold values (1); Methods of measurements of emsisions (2); List of hazardous substances (3), General criteria (4).

Policy: Law of Georgia on Fees for Use of Natural Resources (No. 946-RS of 2004)
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Law is to ensure the rational use of state-owned natural resources by establishing a user-pays principle based on potential environmental capabilities and sustainable development. The payers of fees for the use of natural resources are: a) persons whose activity(ies) related to the use of natural resources is/are subject to licencing under the legislation of Georgia; b) persons who use the wood resources of the State Forest Reserves; c) persons who use wood resources that have been harvested through special forest felling; and d) persons who extract objects of fauna (removal from the natural environment). The object of fees for the use of natural resources is the volume (quantity) of natural resources existing throughout the territory of Georgia (including its territorial waters, airspace, continental shelf and exclusive economic zones), namely: a) volume (quantity) of minerals; b) volume (quantity) of wood resources of the Forest Reserves; c) volume (quantity) of plant non-wood resources (including fir-cones); d) volume (quantity) of water resources; and e) volume (quantity) of fauna resources.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1097 VH-I “On soil fertility of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the basis for ensuring soil fertility of agricultural land with a view of soil rehabilitation of reproduction of soil fertility of agricultural land. The scope of this Regional Law shall be to provide a legal framework for state regulation and restoration of agricultural land fertility, in the process of performance by possessors, owners, users, including tenants, of agricultural land plots of economic activity on the regional territory. Restoration of agricultural land fertility shall be intended conservation and improvement of agricultural land fertility through systematic agrotechnical, agrochemical, reclamation, phytosanitary, anti-erosion and other arrangements. Possessors, owners, users, including tenants, of land plots shall perform agrotechnical, agrochemical, land reclamation, phytosanitary and anti-erosion reproductive measures for restoration of agricultural land fertility by methods excluding or restricting negative environmental impact of the aforesaid activities.Owners and tenants of agricultural land plots, including lease-holders, shall have the right to apply agrotechnical, agrochemical, drainage, phytosanitary and anti-erosion arrangements aimed at restoration of soil fertility. Owners and tenants of agricultural land plots, including lease-holders, shall have the duty to perform production of agricultural commodities by methods ensuring restoration of soil fertility and preventing negative impact on soil and complying with agrotechnical, agrochemical, drainage, phytosanitary and anti-erosion standards.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1132 VH-I “On healthcare and recreational areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations originating from development, management, promotion and protection of healthcare and recreational areas, destined for cure and recreation of the population and classified as protected areas. Regional Government shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) establishment of the modalities and rates of payment for utilization of healthcare and recreational areas; (b) rational management of healthcare and recreational areas; (c) international cooperation; and (d) registration of healthcare and recreational areas. Healthcare and recreational areas shall be national or regional property. Mineral water from healthcare and recreational areas shall be authorized for industrial bottling.
Subject: Environment gen., Food & nutrition, Water
Keyword: Protected area,Public health,Mineral water,Recreational water use,Thermal and medicinal waters

Policy: Regional Law No. 1105 VH-I “On concession of the plots of subsoil for geological exploration and mining of common minerals”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes the modalities of concession of the plots of subsoil for geological exploration and mining of common minerals. The list of common minerals shall be compiled and validated by the regional authorities. Plots of subsoil shall be conceded for the following purposes: (a) geological exploration, including prospecting and assessment of mineral deposits; (b) prospecting and mining of common minerals; (c) joint management – combination of geological exploration, prospecting and mining of minerals; and (d) for purposes not related to extraction of minerals. Subsoil management shall be subject to mandatory licensing. Periods of subsoil management shall be set forth as follows: (a) for geological exploration – for five years; (b) for prospecting and mining of minerals – for the period of exhaustion of mineral deposits; (c) for extraction of groundwater – for 25 years; and (d) short-term licences for mining – for one year.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on 1 January 2005.

Policy: Regional Law No. 1117 VH-I “On radiation safety”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure radiation safety of the population with a view of protection of public health. Arrangements for ensuring radiation safety of the population shall include complex measure of legal, organizational, engineering and technical, sanitary and hygienic, medical preventive and educational character. Regional administration shall set forth limits for exposure to radiation and shall inform the population of radiation levels and arrangements for ensuring radiation safety of the population. Handling and operation of the sources of radiation shall be subject to mandatory licensing.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific
Entry into force notes: This Regional Law enters into force on 1 January 2005.

Policy: Regional Law No. 986 VH-I “On peasant farm”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes legal, economic and social grounds for constituting and functioning of peasant farms, including family farms. Plots of agricultural land can be allotted (free of charge or for payment) or purchased in ownership by peasant farms and family farms. Minimum land plots shall not be applicable to family farms performing gardening, horticulture, floriculture, seedgrowing, poultry farming, apiculture and fishfarming with the utilization of methods and technologies allowing use of land plots of the area smaller than minimum land area established for agricultural activities.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil

Policy: Regional Law No. 256-ZS "On protection of the population and the territory against natural and technological disasters".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against intermunicipal and regional disasters. Regional territorial subsystem of the national early warning system shall be responsible for data collection, processing and dissemination of the information related to disasters and timely information of the population thereof. Environmental security certificate shall be elaborated for the following purposes: (a) determination and assessment of risks related to disasters; (b) assessment of possible consequences of disasters; (c) assessment of performance of disaster prevention; and (d) elaboration of arrangements for reduction of risks and mitigation of the consequences of disasters.

Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations in the sphere of protection of the population and territory against natural and technological disasters. It shall have as its purposes: (a) prevention of the outbreak and spreading of disasters; (b) reduction of losses and damages caused by disasters; and (c) mitigation of the consequences of disasters. Regional Administration must ensure transparency in dealing with disasters and guarantee access to the population access to reliable information related to disaster.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 218 validating the Regulation on state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Kozhozersky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Kozhozersky” is constituted with a view of conservation and restoration of particularly valuable or typical natural landscapes and parts thereof. The proclamation of the territory reserve shall not entail expropriation of land plots from tenants and owners. All users, owners and owners of land plots are obliged to observe the regime established in the reserve and bear responsibility for its violation administrative, criminal and other liability established by the current legislation. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry of all types of motor vehicles outside roads in the snowless period; (b) movement of caterpillar transport during the snowless period outside technological roads except for transport of environmental protection law enforcement bodies and life-saving bodies in the process of fulfilment of their duties; and (c) timber extraction and water logging (except for intermediate felling and selective sanitary felling). The following activities shall be authorized on the territory of state nature landscape reserve: (a) organized tourism; (b) deployment of economic and production facilities related to the activity of natural reserve; (c) charged artisanal and industrial fisheries in accordance with permits issued by the competent authority; and (d) traditional activities (haymaking, grazing of cattle, collection of mushrooms and berries).
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy_Content: The present Decree establishes the composition and the contents of the information within the national environment monitoring system; it establishes also the reporting thereof to the chief information and analysis centre, and also the exchange of information between branch information and analysis centres of the national system of environmental monitoring. The national environmental monitoring system shall include: (1) data periodically obtained from the authorized observation points; (2) generalized data; (3) analytical information; (4) data obtained from early warning system and data of socio-hygienic monitoring.

Policy: Order No. 621 of the Ministry of Emergency Situations validating the Regulation on the prevention of oil pollution.
Policy_Content: This Regulation sets common requirements for measures aimed at preventing oil pollution and mitigating its consequences. It shall be applicable to organizations carrying out exploration, extraction, processing, transport, storage and use of oil and oil products, including harbour administration. Plans for prevention of oil pollution and mitigation of the its consequences shall be applicable to the largest possible area polluted by oil, taking into consideration unfavourable environmental factors such as hydrometeorological conditions, season, time of the day, ecological particulars and intended use of the territory. Such plans shall be classified as local, territorial, regional and federal. The Regulation contains the form of a model plan.

Policy: Regulation No. 221 of the Minister of Economic Affairs and Communications validating the Requirements for Content and Format of Patent Applications and Procedure for Filing of Patent Applications with Patent Office.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that invention of biological material shall be subject to patent protection. A patent application shall include the following documents: (a) a request for the grant of a patent; (b) the description of the invention; (c) patent claims consisting of one or several claims; (d) drawings or other illustrative material referred to in the description of the invention or patent claims; and (e) an abstract of the subject matter of the invention. Patent application documents are filed with the Patent Office in Estonian, except the name of the invention in the request for the grant of a patent and the abstract of the subject matter of the invention which are filed in Estonian and English.

Policy: Regional Law No. 295 “On industrial policy”.
Policy_Content: Industrial production shall pertaining to the sphere of competence of this Regional Law shall be economic activities related to mining, energy generation, including thermal energy generation, natural gas extraction and supply, water abstraction, water supply and sewerage, waste management and recycling, and pollution control. This Regional Law regulates relations originating between subjects operating in the sphere of industry, regional and state bodies and local self-government in the process of formation and implementation of industrial policy. The tasks of industrial policy shall be as follows: (a) formation and development of modern industry; (b) stimulation of industrial activity; (c) introduction of ecofrienfly processes and resource saving technologies; (d) increase of industrial production output; and (e) ensuring technological independence of the regional economy. Particular attention shall be paid to promotion of inter-regional and international cooperation in various branches of industry.

Policy: Regional Law No. 303 "On protected areas".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law shall be applicable to all categories of protected areas of regional significance constituted either with expropriation of land areas from land owners or without it. Conservation and management of protected areas shall be based upon the following principles: (a) priority of conservation of protected areas with regard to management thereof; (b) priority of management of protected areas for scientific research purposes; (c) prohibition of any economic activity incompatible with the regime of protected areas. In protected areas in accordance with the acting legislation can be applicable: (a) prohibition or restriction of economic or other activities not complying with the purposes and tasks thereof; and (b) restriction on visiting of protected areas. State nature reserves, biosphere reserves, dendrological parks, botanical gardens and nature monuments shall be constituted in accordance with federal legislation and decisions of the Regional Government.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 940-PP validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Landscape reserve Sparrow Hills”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that regional state nature reserve “Landscape reserve Sparrow Hills” shall be classified as regional protected area constituted with a view of protection and conservation of natural complexes, natural landscapes, biological diversity, particular wild fauna and wild flora species vulnerable in urban conditions, and keeping recreational potential of natural reserves. It shall be destined for nature protection, ecological education and recreational purposes.  Regional state nature reserve “Landscape reserve Sparrow Hills” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of historical, cultural and natural complexes; (b) protection and reproduction of habitats of wild fauna species, and rare and endangered animal, bird, plant and insect species; (c) scientific research; (d) ecological education; and (e) formation of recreational potential of urban area.  The following activities shall be prohibited: a) modification of historically formed protected natural landscape; (b) damage of natural habitats of endangered animal and plant species; (c) soil pollution; (c) waste disposal; (d) damage or unauthorized felling; (e) burning of dry vegetation; (f) gardening, horticulture and smallholding; and (g) performance of work in the period of egg laying and brood time of waterfowl from 1 April to 31 July.

Policy: Regional Law No. 67-OZ on rates of charges for standing timber exceeding minimum rates of charges.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Regional Law is to fix charges for standing timber exceeding minimum rates of charges. The Regional Law consists of 3 Articles. Article 1 establishes that regional rates of charges for standing timber exceeding minimum rates of charges constitute the difference between the current minimum rates of charges valid for the current financial year established by the Government of the Russian Federation with the application of 1, 5 factor and the indicated minimum rates of charges for standing timber. Article 2 establishes that regional rates of charges for standing timber exceeding minimum rates of charges shall not be applicable to the calculation of the rates of charges for use of forest stock for proper needs by the veterans of WWII, invalids of the I and II groups, pensioners living in rural areas, victims of natural disasters, natural and legal persons engaged in traditional activities and trades. Article 3 establishes the modalities of entry into force of the present Regional Law.

Regional early warning system shall be integral part of the national early warning system. It shall be granted to producers of agricultural commodities share of agricultural production output for the previous year amounted to no less than 50 percent. The scope of state support of agricultural production shall be to ensure food security, increase of regional agricultural commodities at the regional consumption level and support of direct producers of agricultural commodities. Policy: Public Health Law No. 20 of 2004.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 85 articles divided in XIII chapters, aims at establishing the basic rules to govern human health in West Bank and Gaza. It assigns the responsibility of combating infectious diseases and epidemics by all means possible to the Ministry of Health (MOH) and enumerates its responsibilities for the purpose of implementing the Law. The Ministry shall: 1) provide preventive, diagnostic, curative and rehabilitative services to the mother and child; 2) monitor food safety; 3) prohibit any profession or craft that affect the public health or the environmental health unless there was a written permit obtained from the Ministry itself; 4) conduct, in cooperation with the competent bodies health and environmental awareness optical, visual, and hearing programs; 5) in coordination with competent bodies, determine the health hazards that negatively affect public health or the environmental health in any way possible; 6) determine conditions for transfer, storage, treatment or disposal of hazardous items, usage and exchange of pesticides for agricultural and public health purposes, collection, recycling or reuse of wastewater and rain water; 7) distribute the governmental health institutions and their services and specifications in accordance with people’s needs; 8) authorize medical or auxiliary professions; 9) approve all medications and drugs should be registered in the Pharmacopoeia; 10) conduct inspections in any health institution, pharmacy or any place expected to have medicines, and medical products. The Ministry shall among others approve, license and monitor businesses, crafts and food industries and the places of selling. It also has the authority to take all necessary and precautionary measures to stop the spread of disease through: 1) imposing vaccinations and needed medications; 2) confiscating and destroying all material contaminated with the disease, or that could be a source of spread of the disease, in coordination with competent bodies; 3) imposing quarantine measures to prevent the spread of disease and 4) to bury the dead in the manner the Ministry deem fit.

Policy: Law No. 1.598 establishing State Policy to Support Cooperatives within the State of Acre.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting 17 articles divided into four Chapters, establishes the State Policy to Support Cooperatives within the State of Acre. It specifies principles, objectives, guidelines, rules and instruments aimed at encouraging the activity of cooperative and its development in the State. The State Power is responsible to: create instruments and mechanisms that stimulate the continuous growth of activity Cooperative; to support technically and operationally cooperatives in the State; to stimulate the cooperative form of social, economic and cultural organization in the various branches of action within the State, based on the general principles of cooperative and current legislation; to promote the inclusion of the study of cooperatives in schools, aiming at the emergence and strengthening of a cooperative culture within the population and the diffusion of cooperative activity; to encourage the organization of production, consumption, credit, housing and services based on the principles of cooperatives; to promote studies, research and events in order to contribute to the development of the cooperative activity; Provide means for greater capacity building for co-operative suitors or associate citizens; to provide technical assistance with quality and efficiency to cooperatives based in the State; to stimulate and finance a cooperative training and capacity building program; and to establish financial and fiscal incentives for the creation and development of the cooperative system.

Policy: Order No. 278 of the State Committee of Forest Resources validating the Regulation on forest fire safety rules.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that the national Forest Fund is subject to high level risk of forest fires and its protection against forest fires is a moral duty of every citizen. Forest fire safety rules shall be mandatory for all central and local state executive bodies, enterprises, institutions and organizations irrespectively of the form of ownership and citizens staying in forests for any reason. This Order sets forth forest fire safety requirements in order to ensure forest protection against fires. Fire safety in the forest must be ensured by means of planned preventive measures, operative detection and liquidation of forest fires on the territory of the forest area managed by enterprise, organization, institution. Immediate measures for protecting forests against fires, their extinguishment and registration shall be the competence of permanent forest users. Terms of participation of temporary forest users in the implementation of fire protection measures shall be determined by forest management contract.
Subject: Forestry
Keyword: Forest management/forest conservation,Forestry protection measures,Forest service/forest officers,Forest fires,Contract/agreement

Policy: Ley N° 2139 - Declaración de interés público del uso sustentable del recurso suelo.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley establece normas orientadas a promover el uso sustentable del recurso suelo y las acciones privadas y públicas destinadas al manejo de su recuperación, preservación y conservación, como así también al control de su capacidad productiva, a la prevención de procesos de degradación y a la promoción de la educación para su uso racional. A los fines de prevención y control de los procesos de degradación, la autoridad competente queda facultada para definir áreas de manejo y conservación en el ámbito provincial. También se regula la adopción de planes de manejo por parte de los productores o consorcios de las zonas o predios declarados área de manejo, conservación y/o recuperación. Se crean el Consejo Asesor de Suelos y el Fondo de Promoción para la Integridad del Recurso Suelo.

This Regulation shall apply to ships, port reception facilities and waste reception vessels in the maritime zone of the Republic of Turkey. This Regulation has been drafted in accordance with the Directive 2000/59/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 November 2000 on port reception facilities for ship-generated waste and cargo residues.

Policy: Loi n° 04-20 relative à la prévention des risques majeurs et à la gestion des catastrophes dans le cadre du développement durable.
Policy_Content: Cette loi a pour objet d'édicter les règles de prévention des risques majeurs et de gestion des catastrophes dans le cadre du développement durable. Ces règles ont pour fondement les principes suivants: - le principe de précaution et de prudence; - le principe de concomitance; - le principe d'action préventive et de correction par priorité à la source; - le principe de participation et le principe d'intégration des techniques nouvelles. L'Etat assure aux citoyens un accès égal et permanent à toute information relative aux risques majeurs et il est institué, en vertu de la présente loi, un enseignement des risques majeurs dans tous les cycles d'enseignement.

General rules of application of emission standards are laid down in Article 3. Technological standards are determined in Annex 1, while Annex 2 provides limit values for direct waste water discharge into waters, determined taking into account water quality protection zones. Policy: Order No. 281 of the Forestry and Hunting Committee validating the Regulation on aerial work for conservation and protection of forest estate.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that aerial work is and integral part of the protection against forest fires, pests and diseases. It shall be organized by the authorized forest institution, forest owners and forest managers. Aerial work shall include: (a) preventive arrangements; (b) aerial patrolling and forest fire extinguishing; (c) detection and prevention of the infringement of environmental legislation; (d) general inspection of the state of forests; (e) flying at request of forest service, hunting institution and administration of protected areas. Forest owners must divide the territory of the forests into fire fighting districts. Aerial patrolling of forested areas shall be carried out in accordance with the established routes. Each detected forest fire must be put under aerial observation from the moment of detection until complete extinguishment.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret modifie certaine dispostions du Code rural, notamment le chapitre V du titre Ier du livre VI (partie réglementaire) du code rural, qui est complété par une section 3 rédigée: «Conditionnalité des mesures de soutien direct dans le cadre de la politique agricole commune». Les agriculteurs qui demandent les aides mentionnées à l'article R. 615-9 sont tenus de mettre en place une surface consacrée au couvert environnemental égale à 3 % de la surface aidée de leur exploitation en céréales, oléagineux, protéagineux, lin, chanvre et gel. L'utilisation de fertilisants minéraux ou organiques ainsi que de pesticides chimiques sur les surfaces consacrées au couvert environnemental est interdite. Les agriculteurs qui demandent les aides mentionnées à l'article R. 615-9 sont tenus: - de ne pas brûler les résidus de paille ainsi que les résidus des cultures d'oléagineux, de protéagineux; - de céréales, à l'exception de ceux des cultures de riz et d'assurer une diversité de cultures sur la superficie agricole utile de leur exploitation; - de respecter les règles d'entretien des surfaces définies par arrêté préfectoral pour chaque catégorie de terres; - de respecter les règles d'affectation de surfaces aux pâturages permanents fixées par arrêté du ministre chargé de l'agriculture.

Policy: Greenhouse Gas Emission Regulation No. 1851.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes rules with regard to the allowed quota of industrial activities and production generating greenhouse gases. These quota limits do however NOT apply to activities for research, development and testing of new products and processes, nor to production based on biomass. For what concerns aviation, trading activities and greenhouse quota is limited to CO2 emissions related to flights to and from airports in the European Economic Area.  Monitoring and reporting of emissions is mandatory and must be registered with the national Climate and Pollution Agency for authorization. New companies or companies with significant capacity increase by 30 June 2011 may apply for free allowance for stationary industrial activities from a common European allowance reserve. The EEA Joint Committee determines the total number of allowances to be available to aircraft operators for 2012 and from 2013 to 2020. As a consequence an application for free allowances for the period 1 January 2012 to 31 December 2012 may be submitted. The same applies for the period 1 January to 31 December 2020. Permits therefo shall be subject to a national tax of NOK/øre 56.

Policy: Environment Information Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to transpose the Directive 2003/4/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on public access to environmental information and repealing Council Directive 90/313/EEC of 28 January 2003 into German law. In particular, the Act is to ensure free access to the information on the environment possessed by authorities and the diffusion of this information, as well as to lay down the fundamental prerequisites according to which information of this nature is to be made available. Article 3 contains the definition of certain terms such as "Authority" and "information about the environment”, “measures or activities”. The text consists of 14 articles divided into 5 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Access to information upon application (2); Reasons to decline an application (3); Diffusion of information on the environment (4); Final provisions (5).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Order No. 324 of the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service validating the Regulation on the issuance of authorizations to import toxic substances into the Russian Federation.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates the issuance by the Federal Ecological, Technological and Nuclear Supervision Service of authorizations to import toxic substances into the Russian Federation. Applicants must submit the following documentation: (a) application; (b) copy of the constituent documents of the importer; (c) copy of the contract for the import of toxic substances; (d) commission agreement of the importer if the applicant is a legal person acting as intermediary; (e) copy of the authorization for the transportation, storage and use of toxic substances; and (f) copy of the information note with the description of the toxic substances to be imported. This Order shall not be applicable to the transit of toxic substances through the territory of the Russian Federation.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Act on trading greenhouse gas emission privileges.
Policy_Content: The Act is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (sect. 1); System of trading emission privileges (sect. 2); The National Register of Emission Privileges (sect. 3); National plan of emission privileges distribution (sect. 4); Granting and use of emission licences (sect. 5); Licences (sect. 6); Emission quantity monitoring and accounting for emission privileges (sect. 7); Pecuniary penalties (sect. 8); Changes in valid provisions (sect. 9); Transitional and final provisions (sect. 10). The Act establishes principles of functioning of the trading greenhouse gas emission privileges (and other substances) system. The aim of the system is to limit emissions in a more profitable and economically effective way. The system applies to installations privileged to emission and installations transitionally excluded from the system.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Federal Law No. 172-FZ on transfer of land or plots of land from one category into another.
Policy_Content: Transfer of land or plots of land from one category into another shall be carried out in accordance with the application by the persons concerned submitted to executive organ of state power or to organ of local self-government that are authorized to examine such applications. Application regarding transfer of land and plots of land from one category into another shall contain the following specifications: 1) cadastre number of the plot of land; 2) category of land to which the plot of land pertains and category of land into which it is supposed to be transferred; 3) substantiation of transfer; 4) right of ownership of the plot of land. The Federal Law consists of 3 chapters that contain 21 articles. Chapter 1 (arts. 1-6) lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 (arts. 7-13) establishes the particulars of transfer of land and plots of land from one category into another. Chapter 3 (arts. 14-21) lays down transitional and final provisions.

Policy: Unified Industrial System Law (Act) of the Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf.
Policy_Content: This Law (Act) is composed of 9 Sections divided into 33 articles. Sections I and II give terms and definitions and define the scope of application. Section III defines objectives of this Act, in particular: protection of the environment against pollution; protection of the public health and security; compatibility with rules, criteria and mechanisms issued by the WTO Agreement on trade exchanges; recruitment and training of national manpower; meet needs and requirements of the country's economic programs and economic development plans; provision and use of inputs necessary for manufacture; and, securing the economic needs of the country. Sections IV to IX provide for the following matters: establishment of the Technical Committee for Industry Affairs; industrial licences; industrial register; encouragement and development of industrial projects, with particular reference to projects that have priority as they promote the development of particular areas, the production of products for export, environmental protection, the use of abundant natural resources in the countries of the GCC or encourage the technological development; obligations of industrial project’s owners; control on industrial projects by the competent department of the Ministry; and, offences and penalties.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 77/13 on forest management and forestry within the safety areas of training grounds.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the particulars of forest management and forestry within the safety areas of training grounds with the consideration of environmental conditions and purposeful use of forests. Forest management shall be carried out with the consideration of the ecological functions of forests. Some types of forest management can be restricted for safety reasons. Each training ground shall have its own forest fire prevention plan. Plots of forest land within safety areas of training grounds shall not be used for housing facilities and garden areas. Protection of the plots of forest stock against forest fires, offences, pests and diseases shall be carried out by forest officers.

Policy: Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 3991 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Council Directive 2003/4/EC on public access to environmental information and repealing Council Directive 90/313/EEC, except in relation to Scottish public authorities. Regulation 2 contains definitions of expressions in these Regulations, including the definition of environmental information, which is the same as in Council Directive 2003/4/EC.  Regulation 3 applies the Regulations to public authorities and makes provision in relation to the environmental information held by public authorities. It also provides that a public authority will not be subject to these Regulations to the extent that it is acting in a judicial or legislative capacity and that the Regulations do not apply to either House of Parliament to the extent required for the purpose of avoiding an infringement of the privileges of either House. And it provides that each Government department is to be treated separately for the purposes of Parts 2, 4 and 5 of the Regulations. Part 2 of the Regulations contains provisions relating to access to environmental information. Regulation 4 requires public authorities progressively to make available environmental information to the public by electronic means which are easily accessible. And public authorities must take reasonable steps to organize the environmental information they hold relevant to their functions with a view to the active and systematic dissemination of the information to the public.
Subject: Environment gen.
