Policy: Joint Order No. 38/37 establishing the environmental requirements for the location and operation of works for sorting and recycling of domestic waste.
Policy_Content: Works carrying out sorting and recycling of domestic waste shall include sorting and biomechanical plants, thermic waste processing plants and other works recycling domestic waste for the purpose of energy production and manufacturing of commodities. As regards  the location and operation of works consideration shall be given to qualitative and quantitative analysis of domestic waste, the system of separate collection of domestic waste, availability of routes for the transportation of domestic waste, availability of collection points and other arrangements necessary for the complex waste management. Recycling plants shall comply with the following requirements: (1) all the incoming waste must be registered; (2) waste must be sorted out to separate mackle-paper, glass, plastic, ferrous and non-ferrous metals, textile, etc.; the amount of utility resources must not be less than forty percent of the total amount of the incoming domestic waste; (3) hazardous waste, including waste containing heavy metals shall be disposed of properly. Pollutants discharged in the treatment of domestic waste shall comply with emission standards in conformity with the Annex 3.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Waste & hazardous substances
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Según lo dispuesto por la presente Ley, los gobiernos provinciales a los cuales pertenece el área del territorio nacional correspondiente a la delimitación geográfica de la denominación de origen formularán ante la autoridad de aplicación un informe técnico sobre el debido cumplimiento de los requisitos que, para los solicitantes de la Denominación de Origen establece el artículo 6° de la Ley Nº 25.380.

Policy: Act No. 99 of 2004 relating to greenhouse gas emission allowance trading and the duty to surrender emission allowances (Greenhouse Gas Emission Trading Act).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to limit emissions of greenhouse gases in a cost-effective manner by means of a system of quota requirements for  greenhouse gas emissions and freely transferable emission allowances. This Act applies to emissions within the realm and to emissions from activities on the Norwegian part of the continental shelf, subject to any restrictions deriving from international law. This Act applies to CO2 emissions listed in section 3.  An operator shall by 1 May each year transfer a number of allowances corresponding to the volume of emissions for which reporting is mandatory generated by the installation in the previous calendar year to a specified retirement account in the registry. In addition, a discharge permit pursuant to section 11 of the Pollution Control Act is required. In determining the total number of allowances to be allocated, the King shall among other things take into account Norway’s international commitments to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, actual and projected emissions in Norway, the proportion of actual and projected emissions that come within the scope of section 3, the fact that discrimination between sectors and enterprises should be avoided, and the technological and economic potential for reducing emissions that come within the scope of section 3. Sections 7 and 8 concern the method of allocation of allowances. The Norwegian Emissions Trading Registry shall contain information on the allocation, issue, holding, transfer, surrender and cancellation of allowances. Other provisions concern reporting and control and prescribe offences and penalties.

Policy: Law on Inventory of Trees and Round Timber in Transactions (2004)
Policy_Content: The Law determines principles for inventory of trees and round timber in transactions. Its purpose is to implement single inventory procedures for trees and round timber in transactions in all stages of the circulation of trees and round timber, as well as to promote fair competition and the collection of taxes. The Law applies to natural persons and legal persons who have obtained trees or round timber in a property or legal possession or who perform storage, treatment and processing of round timber. According to the law, persons who perform transactions with trees or round timber must determine the amount of trees and round timber and perform inventory in accordance with the procedures prescribed in Chapter III of this Law. Policy: Governmental Decree No. 1795-N validating Technical Regulation for surfactants and detergents and cleaning agents containing surfactants.
Policy_Content: Surfactants and detergents and cleaning agents containing surfactants are intended for washing and cleaning of all types of textiles and dishes, as well as tiles, floors, kitchen utensils and bathroom accessories, industrial and medical equipment. This Technical Regulation establishes the safety indicators for cleaning agents and labelling and packaging requirements, and the procedure for conformity compliance. Trade of cleaning agents on the territory of the Republic of Armenia without certification of conformity compliance shall be prohibited. Cleaning agents subject to mandatory certification of conformity compliance and in circulation on the national territory shall be labelled with conformity mark and accompanied by a certificate of conformity or a registered declaration of conformity. Cleaning agents shall be safe for human life and health both in the production process and during storage, transport and use, must not have a local skin irritant effect and must not have toxic, dermato-resorptive, allergenic, mutagenic, carcinogenic effect on the body. Cleaning agents must not have the property of accumulation in the body (cumulative property). Cleaning agents must have a good solubility in water and must not have a pungent smell. Degree of primary biodegradation of surfactants used for the manufacturing of cleaning agents may not be less than 80 per cent. Degree of complete biodegradation of surfactants used for the production of detergents must reach a minimum of 60 (carbon dioxide) within 28 days.

Policy_Content: La presente Ley reconoce y protege los derechos de la juventud tamaulipeca, y establece los principios rectores de las políticas públicas que contribuyan a su desarrollo integral mediante su inclusión social plena al proceso de desarrollo económico, educativo y cultural. Asimismo regula el funcionamiento del Instituto de la Juventud de Tamaulipas. En el ámbito del Capítulo I del Título II de la Ley (derechos de los jóvenes) cabe destacar el artículo 6º, que establece que los jóvenes tienen derecho al uso, goce y disfrute de los recursos naturales, a una justa y equitativa repartición de la riqueza. Para garantizar este derecho, el Ejecutivo establecerá políticas estatales que fomenten la creación de condiciones socioeconómicas de desarrollo que les permitan alcanzar una vida digna. Por otro lado, en el Capítulo III se reconoce el derecho de los jóvenes a una vida digna, que contempla la dimensión de la salud (física y mental). En lo referente al derecho a la salud, se encarga al Ejecutivo desarrollar acciones que divulguen información sobre, entre otros aspectos, la nutrición. El artículo 23 menciona la cuestión de la pobreza; los artículos 42 y 43 reconocen el derecho a un medio ambiente sano.

The Law follows the common European hierarchical criteria of options for waste management, which were also approved in the National Plan for waste: prevention, reuse, recycling, energy recovery and safe disposal.

Policy: Order No. 268 of the Forestry and Hunting Committee on forest fire safety.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth requirements for the forest owners and forest managers regarding forest fire safety. It also establishes the modalities of carrying out forest fire prevention arrangements, timely detection of forest fires and liquidation thereof. Forest service shall carry out the functions of the authorized institution in the field of forest fire safety. Public forest owners shall observe forest fire safety requirements and shall carry out the following arrangements for the prevention of forest fires: (a) forest fire preventive and sanitary measures, timely detection and suppression of the violations of this Order, and forest fire extinguishing on the territory of forest estate; (b) assistance to the forest managers in the elaboration of forest fire preventive arrangements; (c) registration of forest fires and the consequences thereof. During the fire risk season the following shall be prohibited: (a) to light a fire; (b) to leave burning matches and cigarette ends; (c) to leave rags sodden with combustive-lubricating substances; (d) to fuel vehicles with the motor running; (e) to burn out grass and bushes on the territory of forest estate.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1310 validating the classification of natural and technological disasters.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree validates the classification of natural and technological disasters as follows: (a) “territorial” shall mean limited to an object or production site causing the death of five to ten persons; (b) “local” shall mean limited to the territory of two districts of a province and causing the death of ten to 50 persons; (c) “regional” that is limited to the territory of two provinces and causing the death of 50 to 200 persons; and (d) “global” shall mean limited to the territory of three and more provinces of Kazakhstan, with transboundary effects and causing the death of more than 200 persons.

Policy: Order No. 265 of the Forestry and Hunting Committee validating the Sanitary Regulation in the forests.
Policy_Content: This Order sets forth basic sanitary requirements for the forest management and other economic activities for the purpose of the conservation of forest sustainability and the prevention of damage to forests by pests and diseases. Natural and artificial forests, nursery forests, forests plantation and extracted timber shall be subject to protection against pests, diseases and hazardous environmental and anthropogenic impact. Protection of public forest shall include: (a) forest pathology research; (b) monitoring of the development of pests and diseases; (c) aerial work for combating pests and diseases; (d) preventive arrangements and liquidation of the pestholes; and (e) sanitary inspection of forests. The following sanitary arrangements shall be taken timely: (a) land clearing; (b) placing of trap logs; (c) felling of objectionable forest species; (d) selective sanitary felling; (e) final harvesting.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Regional Law No. 381-OZ “On state support of agro-industry”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law lays down grounds for state support of agro-industry out of regional budget with a view of raising efficiency of its branches, formation of stable agrofood market and meeting demand of the population in foodstuffs. State support shall be granted to the following categories: (a) producers of agricultural commodities; (b) organizations and individual entrepreneurs carrying out processing and trade of agricultural commodities on condition that the share of sold agricultural commodities in total revenues shall be over 70 percent; (c) poultry farms; (d) pedigree stockbreeding farms and state veterinary institutions; and (e) peasant farms. State support shall be carried out in the form of subsidies for interests applicable to credits and partial compensation of expenditure.

Policy: Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Cross Compliance) (Wales) Regulations 2004 (W.S.I. No. 3280 (W.284) of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision in Wales for the administration and enforcement of compliance of farmers with a range of laws and standards regarding "good agricultural and environmental condition". Policy: Law No. 54 of 2004 creating the National Centre for Earthquakes.
Policy_Content: The aims of this Law are to establish the National Centre for Earthquakes and to define its functions and duties. The present Law is composed of 4 Chapters divided into 22 articles. Chapter 1 deals with terms and definitions. Chapter 2 defines the functions and duties of the Centre which are: (a) carrying out statistical and geological studies and research related to national and regional active earthquakes; (b) studying earthquake impact assessments; (c) developing plans to indicate the range and sphere of earthquakes in Syria and neighbourhood countries; (d) managing and developing earthquake monitoring centres and nets; (e) managing and putting into operation geophysical application systems related to earthquake monitoring; (f) creating an earthquake database; (g) developing plans to face emergencies; (h) educating the public on earthquake hazards; and (i) cooperating with local, Arab, regional and international organizations. Chapter 3 provides for the composition, management and duties of the Board and Director-General. Chapter 4 contains general provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Plant Health (Forestry) (Phytophthora ramorum) (Great Britain) Order 2004 (S.I. No. 3213 of 2004).
Policy_Content: Implementing EC Commission Decisions, this Order prohibits the introduction into and spread within Great Britain of the plant pest Phytophthora ramorum (art. 3). The Order places certain controls on the importation of material (bark, trees and wood) of a number of susceptible plant species from the USA. In the case of susceptible trees and susceptible wood, such material must be accompanied by phytosanitary certificates which may be issued only after specific checks have been carried out during production and before consignment; or alternatively, where the material originates in a part of the USA recognised by plant health authorities as free from Phytophthora ramorum, confirming that fact (art. 4 and Schedule). Imports of such material must be notified to an inspector at least three days before landing. These requirements do not apply in the case of wood of Quercus L. imported from Switzerland. The importation of susceptible bark originating in the USA is prohibited. Susceptible trees imported from the USA must be accompanied by a plant passport. Licenses may be granted for the importation, movement and keeping of Phytophthora ramorum for research purposes (art. 9).
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Law No. AL-122 “On energy saving and renewable energy”.
Policy_Content: The purposes of the present Law shall be defining the principles of the state policy on development of the energy saving and renewable energy and the mechanisms of the enforcement of those aimed at: (a) strengthening the economic and energy independence of the Republic of Armenia; (b) increasing the economic and energy security and energy systems safety level of the Republic of Armenia; (c) establishment and development of new industry infrastructure and organization of services promoting energy saving and renewable energy; and (d) reduction of adverse techno-born impacts on the environment and human health. The principles of state policy in the area of energy saving and renewable energy are: (a) increasing level of supply of locally generated renewable energy carriers to satisfy the energy demand of the economy; (b) implementation of energy saving, as well as development and enforcement of legal and economic mechanisms for the promotion of renewable energy; (c) ensuring high priority of efficient use of energy given the increasing volumes of imported and extracted energy resources; (d) ensuring increase of renewable energy resources usage as well as application and development of renewable energy new technologies aimed promoting that; (e) ensuring competitiveness of renewable energy resources and protection/enforcement of rights of businesses engaged in the area of renewable energy; (f) ensuring high priority of issues of environmental protection and efficient (economic) usage of natural resources while implementing measures/activities aimed at the development of the energy saving and renewable energy; (g) promotion of energy efficient production of electric and/or heat energy, including for autonomous energy producers; (h) promotion of integrated activities between the autonomous energy producers, using renewable energy resources, and the energy system aimed at the exchange of electric energy; (i) promotion of consumer choices and use of different energy carriers and energy efficiency technologies; and (j) implementation of energy saving and renewable energy state (national) targeted programs.

Policy: Decree No. 197/2004/ND-CP on compensation, support and resettlement when land is recovered by the State.
Policy_Content: The Decree consists of 51 articles divided into 7 Chapters. It provides for the compensation, support and resettlement when land is recovered by the State for defence and security purposes, for national interests, public interests and economic development purposes. The Decree provides for compensation for different types of land use (agricultural land, residential land, etc.) and defines the cases in which land is recovered without compensation. It also provides for compensation for property (this includes also churches, historical relics, pagodas, cultivated plants and reared animals, etc.). The Decree prescribes relocation support and resettlement arrangements. International agreements which Viet Nam has signed will apply even if the provisions contained are different from those of this Decree.

Policy_Content: This Decree provides for the collection of land use levies. It includes 22 articles divided into 6 Chapters. The Decree specifies in which situations the State will collect land use levies; the subjects not liable to pay (see also articles 33, 35, 50 and 87 of the Land Law No. 13/2003/QH11 of 2003); the basis for calculation of land use levies. Chapter II contains specific provisions on the conditions for land use levy collection: assignment of the land by the State; changes in the purposes of land use; use of the land as industrial park or for construction of hi-tech parks, economic zones. The principles for land use levy exemption or reduction are listed in Chapter III. Furthermore, the Decree determines time limits for paying the levies, responsibilities of tax offices and of owners, etc., and it establishes penalties on violations and complaints.

Policy: Order No. 391 of the State Committee on Land Resources validating the Methodical Instructions on carrying out the state expertise of land survey documentation.
Policy_Content: The Methodical Instructions establish the organizational basics and requirements for the organization and carrying out the state expertise of land survey documentation and registration in the aforesaid sphere. All land survey documentation regarding also land valuation, data of the state land cadastre, elaborated at the national, regional and local levels by the subjects of entrepreneurial activity shall be subject to the state expertise. The principal requirements as regards the contents of the documentation regarding land survey, normative and expert land valuation of land recorded in the state land cadastre shall be set by the normative legal acts. The forms of the state expertise shall be compulsory, selective and voluntary. The types of the state expertise shall be primary, recurring and additional. The procedure of the state expertise shall be composed of three stages: 1) preparatory; 2) principal; 3) conclusive. The compulsory state expertise shall be applicable to: 1) the national programs of land tenure and land protection; 2) land survey schemes; 3) land use planning as regards protected areas, recreational areas and areas of cultural heritage; 4) technical documentation regarding appraisal of soil; 5) technical documentation regarding land valuation. The selective state expertise shall be applicable to land survey documentation that is not subject to the compulsory state expertise. The voluntary state expertise shall be carried out at the customer’s initiative and shall be applicable to land survey documentation that is not subject to the compulsory state expertise.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Law on protected natural territories.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the Law is regulation of relations in the field of organization, protection and use of protected natural territories. The main tasks of the Law are conservation of typical, unique, valuable objects and complexes, genetic fund of plants and animals, prevention of negative influence of human activity to the nature, studying the natural processes, monitoring of natural environment, improvement of ecological awareness and education (art. 2). Protected natural territories are sites of land and (or) water area (aquatoriums) of priority ecological, scientific, cultural, aesthetic, recreational and sanitary-treatment significance, which have been completely or partially, permanently or temporarily withdrawn from economic exploitation. Protected natural territories constitute the unified ecological system designed for ensuring biological and landscape diversity as well as maintaining ecological balance (art. 4). Protected natural territories depending on their target purpose and regime shall be classified into the following categories: 1) state reserves; 2) complex (landscape) sanctuaries; 3) natural parks; 4) state natural monuments; 5) territories for conservation, reproduction and restoration of separate natural objects and complexes; 6) protected landscapes; 7) territories for management of separate natural resources (art. 5). The protected natural territories are generally accessible for citizens, except for the cases, established by the present Law. For the purpose of protection of rare and endangered species of plants and animals, environment of their growth and habitat, the access of citizens to the separate parts of protected natural territories can be limited or forbidden by state bodies, legal and physical persons under whose authority these territories locate (art. 8). The activity of legal and physical persons on reserved land sites, which threatens conservation of designated for protection natural objects and complexes should be limited or prohibited. Granting for ownership and use of these land sites or for rent to legal and physical persons is allowed only if there is a positive conclusion made by state environmental audit (art. 12). The natural parks are protected natural territories designated for conservation and use in nature protection, recreational, scientific and cultural purposes of the natural objects and complexes, which have special ecological, cultural and aesthetic value (art. 23). For the purpose of steady economic and social development of territories the state biosphere reserves can be created – that is protected natural territories designated for conservation of a biological diversity, rational use of natural objects and complexes. The state biosphere reserves can be included in the international network biosphere reserves and participate in global monitoring of natural environment (art. 44).

Policy: Order No. 258 of the Forestry and Hunting Committee regarding afforestation and reforestation on the plots of forest estate.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates afforestation and reforestation arrangements on the plots of forest estate. Afforestation and reforestation must ensure: (a) reproduction of the forest resources in the briefest period of time by the most efficient forestry, ecological and economic means; (b) rational use of the public forest land; (c) increase of forest productivity and quality of forests; (d) optimal forest cover; and (e) improvement of water protection, protective and beneficial qualities of forests. The state management of afforestation and reforestation shall be carried out by the authorized forest institution. Public forest owners shall carry out the following activities: (a) registration of the afforested and reforested plots of land; (b) determination of the extension, queue, time limits, methods and types of afforestation and reforestation arrangements separately for each category of land; (c) selection, forest seed growing and plant variety testing of forest wood species; (d) prevention of water and wind erosion of soil, and waterlogging of the public forest land.

Policy: Landfill Allowances and Trading Scheme (England) Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 3212 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations make provision for implementing Chapter 1 of Part 1 of the Act (waste sent to landfills) including the landfill allowances scheme under that Part. Part 2 includes provisions on the allocation, banking, borrowing and transfer of landfill allowances. After the Secretary of State has made an allocation of landfill allowances under section 4 of the Act,  the monitoring authority is required under regulation 5 to assign reference numbers to those allowances and to allocate them to the landfill allowance accounts of waste disposal authorities. Part 3 concerns the monitoring of the landfill allowances scheme. Part 4 contains provisions on registers. The monitoring authority must maintain a landfill allowances register, and the Secretary of State must maintain a penalties register. Part 5 contains provisions on penalties. Part 6 concerns guidance. It requires waste disposal authorities to have regard to any guidance issued by the Secretary of State in exercising functions in relation to biodegradable municipal waste.

Policy: Regional Law No. 54-Z “On state support of agriculture”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law establishes that state support of agriculture shall be a form of stimulation of agricultural development by means of allocation of regional budgetary funds as subsidies and incentives to farmers, smallholders and individual entrepreneurs operating in agricultural sector. The aforesaid subsidies shall be granted for public support of: (a) stockbreeding; (b) crop production; (c) insurance of crops; (d) improvement of agricultural soil fertility; and (e) partial compensation of interests for agricultural credits allocated by national crediting organizations, institutions and associations.

Policy_Content: Le présent arrêté du Gouvernement wallon porte exécution du décret du 11 mars 2004 relatif aux incitants destinés à favoriser la protection de l'environnement et l'utilisation durable de l'énergie. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, «le décret», «le Ministre», «l’entreprise», «la moyenne entreprise», «la petite entreprise», «la grande entreprise», «la prime», «l’administration», «le "siège d'exploitation», «les "sources d'énergie renouvelables», «la cogénération de qualité", «les normes communautaires". L’article 2 établit que le Ministre ou le fonctionnaire délégué peut octroyer la prime à l'entreprise à certaines conditions énumérées dans cet article. Le texte comprend 24 articles répartis en 3 chapitres comme suit: Définitions et champ d'application (I); Les incitants (II); Dispositions abrogatoires transitoires et finales (III).
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Benelux, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Act on assessment and control of environmental noise.
Policy_Content: This Act is composed of 12 articles and two Annexes. The objective of this Act is to establish a common approach of assessment and control of environmental noise intended to avoid, prevent or reduce harmful effects which derive from the exposure to environmental noise. This Act establishes the rights and obligations of physical persons, legal persons and roles of state organs and territorial authority organs in the area of assessment and control of environmental noise. The following actions are to be implemented: (a) the determination of exposure to environmental noise, through noise mapping; (b) ensuring that information on environmental noise and its effects is made available to the public; (c) adoption of action plans based upon noise-mapping results, with a view to preventing and reducing environmental noise, and particularly where exposure levels may cause adverse effects, intended to protect good quality of acoustic environment. This Act applies to the assessment and control of environmental noise to which humans are exposed in particular in built-up areas, in public parks or other quiet areas in an agglomeration, in quiet areas in open country, near schools, hospitals and other noise-sensitive buildings and areas. This Act does not apply to noise that is caused by the exposed person himself, noise from domestic activities, noise created by neighbours, noise at work places or noise inside means of transport or due to military activities in military areas.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Geographical_area: Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 1 February 2005.

Policy: Act (2004:1199) on emissions trade.
Policy_Content: This Act regulates the conditions for trading on the right to emit carbon dioxide (emissions). It applies to incineration plants with a rated thermal input exceeding 20 megawatts or connected to a district heating network with a total thermal input of 20 megawatts; to mineral oil refineries; to coke ovens; to plants for the production or processing of ferrous metals; to plants for the production of cement clinker or lime in rotary kilns or other furnaces, production of glass, and for the manufacture of ceramic products by firing; and to the manufacture of paper, paperboard and pulp. Authorization for carbon emissions shall be provided by the producing facilities pursuant to the Environmental Code Act or older environmental legislations with the purpose to ensure the monitoring and reporting of carbon emissions are being contained. If it is necessary to meet Sweden's obligation of membership in the European Union, authorities may revoke authorization pursuant to this Act or amend or revoke the conditions of such authorization in adherence to article 24.1 of the Emissions Trading Directive.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Arctic, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: 1 January 2005.

Policy: Petroleum (Submerged Lands) (Management of Well Operations) Regulations 2004.
Policy_Content: The object of these Regulations is to ensure that, for petroleum exploration, appraisal and production in an adjacent area: (a) the design of downhole activities is in accordance with good oil-field practice; and (b) downhole activities are carried out in accordance with an accepted well operations management plan; and (c) risks are identified and managed in accordance with sound engineering principles and good oil-field practice. A titleholder that wishes to carry out a well activity for which an accepted well operations management plan is required, or that wishes to replace an accepted well operations management plan, must submit a well operations management plan to the Designated Authority. Contents of well operations management plan are outlined in regulation 6.

Policy: Palau National Invasive Species Strategy.
Policy_Content: This nation-wide sectoral document has the main purpose of minimizing the harmful effects of invasive species on the environment and society of Palau through coordination of efforts at all levels of Palauan society, and to facilitate cooperation with neighboring countries and the Pacific Islands region to prevent the movement of invasive species. Guiding principles of the Strategy are (i) this issue management is an integral part of the sustainable management of natural resources and the environment; (ii) prevention and early intervention are the most cost effective techniques; (iii) the need for a coordinated national approach which involves all levels of government in partnership with private business, landholders, and communities; (iv) collective action is necessary where the problem is beyond the capacity of the individual land owner/manager to address.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Environment gen., Fisheries, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Regional Law No.202-OZ regarding the main directions of activity of the organs of state power in the sphere of nature management and environmental protection.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Law determines the main directions of activity of the organs of state power in the sphere of nature management and environmental protection. The main purpose of legal regulation is to ensure the constitutional rights of citizens to favourable environment and access to reliable information on its state. The target of the present Regional Law is to set up legal basis of state policy in the sphere of environmental protection and conservation of favourable environment, ensuring balanced socio-economic development and conservation of favourable environment and natural resources, and also biological diversity as the basis of vital activity of the present and future generations. The main directions of activity are: 1. participation in carrying out of state policy for the purpose of ensuring ecological safety; 2. carrying out environmental protection arrangements; 3. organization of the inter-action between regional institution, federal executive bodies and local self-government for the purpose of ensuring rational use of natural resources; 4. lease of natural resources in accordance with the regional legislation; 5. setting up environmental fees.
Subject: Environment gen.

Le Fonds de l’eau et de l’équipement rural (FEER) rénové en tant qu’outil d’intervention de l’Etat en milieu rural ne peut qu’apporter sa contribution à la mise en oeuvre de la politique ainsi définie pour le secteur rural. Il aura pour mission: "la canalisation et la gestion des fonds pour le financement de petits projets de développement dans les domaines de la production agro sylvo pastorale, de la valorisation des ressources en eau, et du renforcement des capacités professionnelles et entrepreunariales des producteurs en milieu rural".

Policy: Utility Regulatory Authority Act 2004 (No. 42 of 2004).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment as a body corporate of a public body denominated the Utility Regulatory Authority, which shall carry out such regulatory functions as may be assigned to it under this Act or a relevant utility legislation. The Authority shall principally regulate, control and supervise utility services as specified in Part B of the First Schedule to this Act. For the time being utility services shall be only electricity services in the sense of the Electricity Act, 2004, but the Act foresees the inclusion of wastewater disposal services and services relating to the sourcing, collection, production, treatment, distribution or supply of water for domestic, agricultural, commercial, industrial or other purposes.

Policy: Policy and Strategy Forestry and Watershed Subsector.
Policy_Content: The Policy and Strategy for Forestry and Watershed Subsector is a national policy with a cross-sectoral approach. The overall purpose of this policy is to ensure sustainable management of forestry and watershed resources in order to contribute to a competitive agriculture-forestry-fisheries sector and support improved living standards for people. To this end, this policy sets forth strategies to enhance protection and conservation of the environment, biodiversity and productivity in the uplands through alternative farming systems and agroforestry; enhanced production in the lowlands through sustainable irrigation systems; and protection of coral reefs and other marine resources against possible destruction in the marine areas.

Policy: Instruction No. 158 on access to information.

Policy: Regional Law No. 55-oz "On regulation of turnover of agricultural land".
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates relations concerning turnover of agricultural land and shares of agricultural land in common property. Minimum land area of consolidated agricultural land plot shall be 0.5 ha. Maximum agricultural land area within the boundaries of a single administrative-territorial unit that can be owned by a single family with close relatives or by a single legal person of which make part a single family with close relatives shall not exceed 10 percent of total agricultural land area. Local government shall have preferential right of purchase of agricultural land at face value, except for sale through public tender in case of renunciation of purchase by the Regional Government.

Policy: Regional Law No. 886 VH-I “On land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law regulates ownership on land plots, land tenure and lease, and also turnover of land plots and land shares in common land property related to agricultural land. Land tenure shall be performed in accordance with purposeful use of land, legal regime and authorized land uses in accordance with zoning of the territory. Land tenure must ensure conservation of ecosystems.  The following land rights shall be authorized on the regional territory: (a) ownership by citizens and legal persons; (b) right of permanent (open-ended) land tenure by state and municipal institutions and other public entities; (c) land tenancy free of charge for a limited period of time in the form of allotment of service land plots; and (d) life-long hereditary tenancy by citizens in case it was originated before 30 October 2001. All subjects of land relations shall be granted the right to apply servitude.

Policy: Décret n° 2004-1283 relatif aux prêts bonifiés à l'investissement dans les exploitations agricoles et modifiant le Code rural.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret modifie certaine dispostions du Code rural, notamment le chapitre IV du titre IV du livre III du code rural, relatif aux prêts bonifiés à l'investissement, qui sont des prêts accordés à taux préférentiel par rapport aux taux constatés sur le marché. Ils peuvent être accordés aux personnes satisfaisant aux conditions fixées à la section 1 du présent chapitre, en vue du financement d'investissements réalisés dans le cadre de leur activité définie par l'article L. 311-1. Les investissements doivent avoir l'un ou plusieurs des objets suivants: - a) La réduction des coûts de production; - b) L'amélioration et la réorientation de la production;- c) L'amélioration de la qualité; - d) La préservation et l'amélioration de l'environnement naturel, des conditions d'hygiène et des normes en matière de bien-être des animaux; - e) L'encouragement à la diversification des activités de l'exploitation.

Policy: Decree No. 84 of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food validating the Regulation on registration of pesticides and fertilizers.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 4 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1); 2) the modalities of submitting and examination of the documentation for the registration of fertilizers and pesticides (sect. 2); 3) the modalities of carrying out the state testing and registration of fertilizers and pesticides (sect. 3); 4) the modalities of re-registration and termination of registration of fertilizers and pesticides (sect. 4). The present Regulation establishes the modalities of the state testing and registration of pesticides and fertilizers of the national or foreign origin for the purpose of the exposure of compliance thereof with the safety requirements as regards the impact on human health, environment, biological and economic efficiency. The requirements and the provisions of the present Regulation shall be compulsory. The registration procedure shall include: 1) acceptance of the application; 2) the state testing; 3) decision-making in conformity with the outcome of the state testing; 4) issuing of the registration certificate. The state testing shall include: 1) examination of the biological and economic efficiency and the elaboration of the modalities of the application of pesticides or fertilizers (rate of utilization or application, terms and conditions of the application, repetition factor, and the period of expectation); 2) the state hygienic regulation and registration of pesticides. The state testing shall be carried out by the authorized research institutions the list of which shall be validated by the registering authority. The applicant must submit samples of pesticides and fertilizers for testing.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 181 on the prolongation of the operation of the power-generating units of atomic power-plants in the post-project period following the reassessment of safety standards.
Policy_Content: The present Order consists of 5 sections dealing with: (a) general provisions (sect. 1); (b) preparation for the functioning in the post-project period (sect. 2); (c) general prescriptions relating to obsolescent power-generating units (sect. 3); (d) general requirements for the periodical reassessment (sect. 4); (e) general requirements as to reporting periodical reassessment of the power-generating units (sect. 5). Furthermore, the present Order establishes mandatory  requirements for the prolongation of the operation of the power-generating units of atomic power-plants in the post-project period to be achieved through the introduction of load aging management programs and periodical revaluation of safety standards. Specified  periods of operation of the power-generating units are aimed at ensuring compliance with safety criteria. Post project operation  shall be authorized only after the modification of operational licensing conditions . Operating organizations must carry out periodical reassessment of safety criteria of each power-generating unit at least once in ten years. Revaluation of safety standards shall include environmental impact assessment. Reassessment shall  ensure safe functioning of equipment under adverse environmental conditions such as natural disasters, electro-magnetic pollution, radiation, etc. Inspection shall also ascertain the compliance with the designed emissions of radioactive substances into the environment within the maximum established limits. Annual and quarterly reports shall record the amount of radioactive substances discharged into the environment.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Regional Law No. VH-I “On subsidiary smallholding”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to increase the role of private subsidiary smallholding of citizens in raising production of agricultural commodities and it establishes the forms of state support of subsidiary smallholding. Subsidiary smallholding shall be considered a form of non-enterpreneurial activity for production and processing of agricultural commodities that shall be exclusive property of citizens conducting subsidiary smallholding. Trade of agricultural commodities produced and processed by citizens conducting subsidiary smallholding shall not be considered entrepreneurial activity. Citizens shall be authorized to perform subsidiary smallholding from the date of state registration of rights to a land plot. Maximum land area that can be allotted for subsidiary smallholding shall not exceed 11 ha. Subsidiary smallholding shall have the right to state support in the form of subsidies, incentives, credits and lease.

Policy: Law No.  HO-159-N “On waste”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations related to collection, transportation, storage, processing, utilization, disposal, reduction of waste, and other relations connected to this sphere, as well as legal and economic grounds for preventing negative effects on human health and the environment. The effect of this Law extends to the use of industrial waste generated in production cycle (including subsoil management) and consumer waste. The Law does not apply to: (a) radioactive waste; (b) on substances that mix with wastewater and flow into natural watercourses; and (c) on substances emitted to the atmosphere together with gases emitted from emission sources. The main objectives of this Law shall be as follows: (a) elaboration of the basic principles of the unified state policy in the area of waste management; (b) provision of basic conditions, requirements and rules of environmentally safe management of waste, as well as economic incentives for resource-saving activities; (c) guarantee of conditions for generation of minimum quantity of waste, promotion of waste recycling in the business activities, mitigation of adverse effects of waste on human health and environment; and (d) legal regulation of relations in the sphere of waste management. The basic principles of state regulation in the sphere of waste management shall be as follows: (a) protection of human health and environment from adverse effects of waste; (b) guarantee of rational use of raw materials and energy; and (c) balance of public environmental, economic and social interests in the sphere of waste management.  In order to protect human health and environment and to reduce the waste volumes as a method of waste prevention, waste disposal quotas shall be set for legal entities and private entrepreneurs involved in the waste management. State waste inventory, classification and certification of waste shall be performed in accordance with the procedure established by the Government. Waste generation, collection, processing, recycling and storage shall be subject to mandatory state registration with annual updating of the database. This Law consists of 8 Chapters. Chapter 1 lays down general provisions. Chapter 2 establishes the competence of state government authorities and local self- government bodies in the sphere of waste management. Chapter 3 regards state regulation, issuance of waste passports, statistical reporting and standardization in the sphere of waste management. Chapter 4 establishes the rights and the liability of entities in the sphere of waste management. Chapter 5 sets forth incentives for waste recycling and reduction of the amount of waste. Chapter 6 deals with supervision in the sphere of waste management. Chapter 7 establishes liability of the infringement of the legislation on waste management. Chapter 8 lays down the final provisions.

Policy: Loi sur la protection de la population (LProP).
Policy_Content: La présente loi règle les principes régissant la préparation aux situations extraordinaires et à l'état de nécessité ainsi que leur maîtrise, dans le but d'assurer la protection de la population et de ses bases d'existence suite à une catastrophe, une crise grave ou une situation d'urgence ne pouvant être gérée avec les moyens ordinaires. Sous réserve des dispositions particulières du droit fédéral, le Conseil d'Etat est compétent pour émettre des prescriptions en matière de protection de la population, notamment, entre autres,  dans les cas suivants: a) catastrophes naturelles ou anthropiques; b) afflux de personnes en quête de protection; c) épidémie et épizootie; d) élévation notable du taux de radioactivité. Le texte comprend 40 articles répartis en 10 chapitres.

Policy: Earth's Crust Act.
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the procedure for and the principles of exploration, protection and use of the earth’s crust, with the purpose of ensuring economically efficient and environmentally sound use of the earth’s crust. This Act regulates: (a) geological investigation; (b) geological explorations; (c) extraction of mineral resources, except in the part regulated by the Mining Act; (d) the rights of the owner of an immovable upon use of mineral resources within the boundaries of the owner’s immovable; (e)     restoration of the land disturbed by geological investigation, geological explorations or mining; (f) use of the earth’s crust not related to the extraction of mineral resources, except in the part regulated by the Mining Act and the Water Act; and (g) protection of the earth’s crust. Mineral deposits shall be classified as national and local. Mineral reserves shall be classified as proved reserves, inferred reserves and reconnaissance resources. Geological explorations are permitted on the basis of a geological exploration permit for mineral resources. Extraction of minerals shall be authorized in conformity with extraction permit with the term of validity varying from 15 to 30 years, subject to extension.
Subject: Mineral resources
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe
Entry into force notes: This Act enters into force on 1 April 2005.

Policy: Leasehold Valuation Tribunals (Procedure) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2004 (S.I. No. 3098 of 2004).
Policy_Content: The amendment made by regulation 4(a) has effect as regards applications to a leasehold valuation tribunal under section 20ZA(1) of the Landlord and Tenant 1985 Act to dispense with all or any of the consultation requirements relating to works and agreements for which contributions may be recovered by way of service charges. The effect of the amendment is to remove the requirement (imposed by regulation 3(3) of, and paragraph 2(3) of Schedule 2 to, the Procedure Regulations) to provide a copy of the lease when making an application under section 20ZA(1).`The amendment made by regulation 5 enables a leasehold valuation tribunal to determine an application without an oral hearing where it has given at least 28 days' notice to the applicant and the respondent and neither of them has asked for an oral hearing. The amendment made by regulation 6 removes from regulation 17 of the Procedure Regulations the requirement to give notice at the hearing where an inspection is to be made during or after the close of the hearing. The requirement to give at least 14 days' notice to the parties of the date, time and place of the inspection remains unchanged, but the opportunity has been taken to make minor drafting changes.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1466 on monitoring  of natural disasters and technological accidents.

It shall ensure appropriate arrangements for the prevention of natural disasters and technological accidents, and also for the minimization of socio-economic and ecological consequences thereof. Policy: Civil Contingencies Act 2004 (2004, Chapter 36).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for contingency planning. and civil protection measures. It sets out emergency powers of the executive and provides for coordination between the various parts of the United Kingdom and the appointment of Regional and Emergency Coordinators. An "emergency" means— (a) an event or situation which threatens serious damage to human welfare in a place in the United Kingdom, (b) an event or situation which threatens serious damage to the environment of a place in the United Kingdom, or (c) war, or terrorism, which threatens serious damage to the security of the United Kingdom. an event or situation threatens damage to the environment only if it involves, causes or may cause— (a) contamination of land, water or air with biological, chemical or radio-active matter, or (b) disruption or destruction of plant life or animal life. The Act lists "responders" for purposes of contingency planning and defines duties of such public bodies.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1553 validating the Regulation on the State fund of land use planning documentation.
Policy_Content: The State fund of land use planning documentation shall be set up on the basis of data collection, processing and registration regarding the outcome of land use planning irrespectively of the location of the plots of land and the form of ownership thereof. The materials the State fund of land use planning documentation shall be accessible to the state executive bodies, local self-government, enterprises, institutions, organizations and citizens. The documentation and the materials of the State fund of land use planning shall pertain to the state property and shall not be subject to privatization. The State fund shall be composed of the Principal fund, the regional funds and local funds. The Principal fund shall be set up, formed and kept by the State Committee on Land Resources. The Principal fund shall have as its purpose registration and storage of land use planning documentation of the land use planning carried out at the national level and the centralized registration of data contained in the regional and local funds.

Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities for calculating and collecting compensation for the transfer of forested areas to a category of land not related to forest management. The amount of payment shall be established in accordance with the basic rate set for a given category of forest, based on the composition and productivity of forest. In the process of calculation, the period of time of the transfer shall also be taken into consideration. Payments for the transfer of forested areas to establish protected areas shall be prohibited.

Policy: Ordonnance n° 2004-1199 prise pour la transposition de la directive 2002/49/CE du Parlement européen et du Conseil du 25 juin 2002 relative à l'évaluation et à la gestion du bruit dans l'environnement.
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance porte modification du livre V du Code de l'environnement :: il est ajouté au titre VII intitulé « Prévention des nuisances sonores » un chapitre II intitulé : « Evaluation, prévention et réduction du bruit dans l'environnement ». Le bruit émis dans l'environnement aux abords des principales infrastructures de transport ainsi que dans les grandes unités urbaines est évalué et fait l'objet d'actions tendant à le prévenir ou à le réduire, dans les conditions prévues par le présent chapitre. Une carte de bruit et un plan de prévention du bruit dans l'environnement sont établis: « 1° Pour chacune des infrastructures de transport suivantes : infrastructures routières et autoroutières dont le trafic annuel est supérieur à trois millions de véhicules, infrastructures ferroviaires dont le trafic annuel est supérieur à 30 000 passages de trains, aérodromes civils dont le trafic annuel est supérieur à 50 000 mouvements à l'exception des mouvements effectués exclusivement à des fins d'entraînement sur des avions légers; « 2° Pour chaque unité urbaine de plus de 100 000 habitants.

Policy: Décret instaurant un système d'échange de quotas d'émission de gaz à effet de serre, créant un Fonds wallon Kyoto et relatif aux mécanismes de flexibilité du Protocole de Kyoto (1).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret établit un système d'échange de quotas d'émission de gaz à effet de serre, afin d’en favoriser la réduction, dans des conditions économiquement efficaces et performantes. Il s'applique aux émissions dans l'atmosphère résultant des installations et activités déterminées par le Gouvernement. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, "quota", "gaz à effet de serre", "gaz à effet de serre spécifiés", "nouvel entrant", "période de référence". Le Gouvernement élabore un plan wallon d'allocation des quotas pour chaque période de référence, dans le respect de l'accord de coopération du 14 octobre 2002 relatif à l'établissement, l'exécution et le suivi d'un Plan national Climat. L’article 13 établit qu’il est créé un Fonds wallon "Kyoto" au sein du budget des recettes et du budget général des dépenses de la Région. Les fonctions de ce Fonds sont, parmi d’autres: i) la promotion d'activités et de projets qui ont pour résultat des réductions ou des stockages durables d'émission de gaz; ii) la réalisation de mécanismes de projet et l'acquisition de droits d'émission; iii) le transfert de technologies ou de savoir-faire compatibles avec le développement durable. Le texte comprend 23 articles et 3 annexes.

Policy: Order No. 238 of the Forestry and Hunting Committee regarding secondary forest management on the territory of forest estate.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that physical persons shall have the right to collect wild fruits, edible nuts, mushrooms, berries, medicinal plants and other non-timber products for proper consumption without any authorization or permit within the limits set by the regional authority. Collection and procurement by physical and legal persons of wild fruits and berries recorded in the Red Book and drug containing plants shall be authorize in exceptional cases in accordance with the national legislation and under the supervision of forest service officers. Public forest owners shall issue forest land plot usage permit to all users except for those in possession of service land allotment. Within 10 days from the date of termination of secondary forest management public forest owner must carry out on-site inspection. Forest managers carrying out for two and more seasons (years) secondary forest management on the plots of forest estate allotted to them shall have the preferential right of allotment of the same plots for subsequent season (year).
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants

Policy: Land Act No. 9/04.
Policy_Content: This Law, composed of 89 articles divided in 5 chapters, regulates the general principles on land rights. In particular, the Law rules on: property rights, rural community rights, natural resources’ use and protection measures, land expropriation, land concession, territorial planning, land classification, and registration procedures. Article 1 establishes that rural lands and paths belonging to pubic/private private domain оr to local authorities/individuals are under a regime of servitude of passage or integrated into communal lands, according to customary law, in order to allow access cattle to pastures оu water sources and other traditional utilities of rural communities. Moreover, the Law indicates the competent authorities and their related functions. Finally, the Law regulates the procedural provisions.

Ces travaux seront menés en coordination avec ceux des sections consacrées aux produits issus de l'agriculture biologique dans les interprofessions et les offices; - sur la thématique environnement et territoires, approfondissement de la connaissance: - des effets environnementaux et territoriaux de l'agriculture biologique;- des liens entre les acteurs de l'agriculture biologique (structures agricoles et entreprises d'aval) et la dynamique du tissu rural dans lequel ils s'insèrent.

Policy: Ordinance on measures against the emission of gaseous and particulate pollutants from internal combustion engines to be installed in non-road mobile machinery.
Policy_Content: The present Ordinance introduces the Directive 97/68/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to measures against the emission of gaseous and particulate pollutants from internal combustion engines to be installed in non-road mobile machinery into Austrian national legislation. For the purpose of this Ordinance “non-road mobile machinery” shall mean any mobile machine, transportable industrial equipment or vehicle with or without body work, not intended for the use of passenger or goods transport on the road, in which an internal combustion engine is installed. The present Ordinance makes provisions concerning the certification of limited levels of emission of gaseous and particulate pollutants by the said combustion engine and authorization of such machines.

Policy: Order No. 407 of the Ministry of Agrarian Policy validating the Regulation on the system of monitoring of the fishing vessels.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 9 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 1); 2) the main purposes, tasks and functions of the system of distant monitoring of the fishing vessels (sect. 2); 3) the main purposes, tasks and functions of the system of distant monitoring of the fishing vessels (sect. 3);  4) technical inspection and supervision over the compliance with the provisions of the international agreements (sect. 4); 5) registration of the fishing vessels (sect. 5); 6) training of the personnel of the fishing vessels (sect. 6); 7) compliance with the fishing requirements (sect. 7); 8) access to information regarding the fishing vessels (sect. 8); 9) financing of the system of distant monitoring of the fishing vessels (sect. 9). The system of monitoring of the fishing vessels is a complex of interrelated technical, organizational and legal arrangements regarding collection, analysis, storage and access to information regarding the fishing vessels.  Registration of the fishing vessels, distant control thereof and technical supervision over the compliance with the provisions of the international agreements shall be the components of the system of distant monitoring of the fishing vessels.    Distant monitoring of the fishing vessels shall be set up with the aim of centralization and systematization of the information regarding the fishing vessels flying the flag of Ukraine and carrying out marine fisheries in the internal waters, EEZ and territorial sea of Ukraine, outside the jurisdiction of Ukraine, and of the foreign fishing vessels carrying out fisheries in the EEZ of Ukraine. The main tasks of the system of monitoring of the fishing vessels shall be: 1) to ensure compliance with the provisions of the international fisheries agreements; 2) safe navigation of the fishing vessels; 3) prevention of pollution from fishing vessels; 4) conservation of fish stocks.
Subject: Environment gen., Fisheries, Sea
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Order No. 235 of the Forestry and Hunting Committee validating the Regulation on procurement of soft resin, wood juices and non-timber products of the plots of forest estate.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that forest resources on the plots of forest estate for the purpose of procurement of soft resin, wood juices, bark, branches, stumps, roots and buds of trees and shrubbery shall be allotted for long-term management in accordance with the contract concluded between the authorized forest institution and the forest manager. A plot of forest land can be allotted for only one or several types of forest management. Felling licence for the procurement of soft resin and wood juices shall be issued to the forest harvester annually for the whole cupping period. Procurement of soft resin and wood juices shall be carried out in mature and overmature forests that is destined for main use felling after the termination of cupping period. Cupping shall be prohibited for: (a) trees growing in the outbreaks of pests and diseases until the liquidation thereof; (b) trees damaged by forest fires, pests and diseases; (c) protected plots of forests; (d) seed plants and elite trees; (e) specimen trees. Procurement of wood juices shall be allowed in mature and overmature forests destined for main use felling no sooner than five years before felling.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Plant Health (Phytophthora ramorum) (Scotland) Order 2004 (S.S.I. No. 488 of 2004).
Policy_Content: This Order prohibits the introduction into and spread within Scotland of the plant pest Phytophthora ramorum. It implements Community Decisions in this field. The Order places certain controls on the importation of material (bark, trees and wood) of a number of susceptible plant species from the USA. In the case of susceptible trees and susceptible wood, such material must be accompanied by phytosanitary certificates which may be issued only after specific checks have been carried out during production and before consignment; or alternatively, where the material originates in a part of the USA recognised by plant health authorities as free from Phytophthora ramorum, confirming that fact. Imports of such material must be notified to an inspector at least three days before landing. These requirements do not apply in the case of wood of Quercus L. imported from Switzerland. The importation of susceptible bark originating in the USA is prohibited. Susceptible trees imported from the USA must be accompanied by a plant passport. Licenses may be granted for the importation, movement and keeping of Phytophthora ramorum for research purposes.
Subject: Forestry, Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: National Economic and Social Council Act, 2004 (No. 18 of 2004).
Policy_Content: The National Economic and Social Council (NESC) is established under section 2. The Council shall consist of members appointed by the Prime Minister, politicians, public officers and representatives of various sectors and organizations of Antigua and Barbuda. The Council shall promote the goals of economic growth, create consensus on economic and social policy and carry out other functions specified in section 3. There shall be an executive Committee of the Council (sect. 9), which shall conduct the business under direction of the Council. Functions of the Executive Committee are outlined in section 10. Section 11 provides for a Secretariat and staff of the Council. The Council may establish various committees, amongst others an environmental protection and Disaster Committee. Policy: Order No. 434 of the Ministry of Environmental Protection validating the Regulation on the modalities of approval by the environmental institutions of the materials regarding expropriation (purchase) and allotment of the plots of land.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is applicable to the Ministry of Environmental Protection and its territorial branches (environmental institutions). The Regulation establishes the mechanism of approval by the environmental institutions of the selection of the plots of land for the location of the objects thereon, allotment of all categories of land irrespectively of the form of ownership and land tenure. The main purpose of the approval by the environmental institutions of the materials regarding expropriation (purchase) and allotment of the plots of land shall be to ensure compliance with the environmental standards in the process of coming into effect or cessation of land rights of the landowners of land tenants and to promote the formation of the ecological network. The materials regarding expropriation (purchase) and allotment of the plots of land the contents and the composition of which must conform to the requirements set by environmental institution shall be examined for the compliance thereof with the legislative acts and other normative legal provisions, standards and regulations in the sphere of environmental protection, the list of which shall be validated in relation to each specific situation. The main provisions that must be taken into consideration shall be: 1) prevention of the deterioration of territories of protected areas; 2) setting conditions for conservation or re-cultivation of degraded land; 3) contributing to the formation of ecological network.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Regulation No. 734 on the procedures and conditions for licensing the processing of oil by-products.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the conditions and procedures for licensing the processing of oil by-products. The processing of oil-by products can be carried out only by companies supplied with processing licences. The licences may be issued to companies engaged exclusively in the processing of oil and gas by-products and equipped with the appropriate processing machinery for the production of new hydrocarbons. To apply for a licence, the company shall submit various documents as further laid down by the Regulation. Policy_Content: The present Regulations enact the Mineral Resources Act. The Regulations lay down provisions relating to mineral resources in the Province of Nova Scotia. Policy: Order No. 963 of the Ministry of Transport validating the Regulation on vessel survivability for inland navigation.
Policy_Content: This Order shall be considered legislative provision regulating operation of crews of vessels (excluded fishing vessels) in case of alert and alarm, firefighting, deluging, oil spill and oil pollution, and also lifesaving. It defines emergency situations, disasters and incidents, listing operations to be undertaken by the crew in each particular case. The scope of the Regulation shall be to ensure survivability of vessels and the crew. Shipmaster shall be responsible for performing timely alert that shall be mandatory for all the crew. Vessel survivability shall be ensured through: (a) reserve-buoyancy volume and reserve-sustainability volume; (b) fire safety; (c) survivability of vessel board equipment; and (d) training of the crew.

Policy: Ordonnance sur les mouvements transfrontières des organismes génétiquement modifies (Ordonnance de Cartagena, OCart).
Policy_Content: La présente ordonnance règle les mouvements transfrontières des organismes génétiquement modifiés. Elle ne s’applique pas aux mouvements transfrontières des médicaments à usage humain qui contiennent des organismes génétiquement modifiés. La partie initiale contient la définition de certains termes comme, par exemple, «utilisation dans l’environnement», «organisme génétiquement modifié», «milieu confiné », «mouvement transfrontière”, “Biosafety Clearing House”. La section 2 porte la réglementation concernant les exigences relatives aux mouvements transfrontières des organismes génétiquement modifiés. A ce propos l’article 3 établit que quiconque importe, exporte ou fait transiter des organismes génétiquement modifiés doit: a. agir avec les précautions que la situation exige afin que les organismes génétiquement modifiés, leurs métabolites et les déchets formés ne puissent pas mettre en danger les animaux, l’environnement ou, indirectement, l’être humain; b. les manipuler, les emballer, les étiqueter et les transporter en tenant compte des dispositions nationales et internationales pertinentes; c. fournir, pour chaque mouvement transfrontière, la documentation d’accompagnement au sens de l’article 4. L’article 9 contient dispositions ayant trait à la participation au mécanisme international d’échange d’informations, tandis que lárticle 10 spécifie les mesures en cas de mouvements transfrontières non intentionnels. Le texte comprend 15 articles répartis en 4 sections comme suit: Dispositions générales (1); Exigences relatives aux mouvements transfrontières des organismes génétiquement modifiés (2); Tâches des autorités (3); Dispositions finales (4). Deux annexes sont jointes: Informations devant figurer dans la demande à présenter conformément à l’article 6 (1); Renseignements à fournir selon l’article 9.(2).
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen., Cultivated plants
Geographical_area: Alps, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North-East Atlantic, Western Europe

Policy: Land Code.
Policy_Content: This Land Code stipulates that land shall be public property protected by the state and shall be rationally and efficiently managed. It regulates land relations and applies to natural and legal foreign and domestic persons and to foreign states and international organizations. Land legislation shall provide for: (a) regulation of land relations with a view to the rational and efficient use of land resources; (b) implementation of state programmes for the management and protection of land resources; (c) land use planning, keeping the state land cadastre and land monitoring; (d) establishing the grounds for origin, change and cessation land ownership, land tenure and lease; (e) creation of the rights and obligations of landlords, tenants and lessees; (f) measures to improve soil fertility and conserve the environment; and (g) creation of conditions for the equitable development of all forms of land tenure. The Act consists of eight sections: (1) general provisions; (2) land fund; (3) state regulation of land relations; (4) allotment of land plots to natural and legal foreign and domestic persons and to foreign states and international organizations; (5) land ownership; (6) land tenure; (7) leases; and (8) ownership rights to land plots, tenants and lessees. The Land Code contemplates the following forms of land tenure: (a) ownership; (b) tenancy; and (c) lease. Land plots may be allotted in ownership to citizens of Turkmenistan, and may be allotted in permanent or temporary land tenure (tenancy) to natural and legal persons of Turkmenistan. Land plots may be allotted in lease to natural and legal persons of Turkmenistan and of foreign states, as well as to foreign states and international organizations.
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Decree No. 182/2004/ND-CP on sanctioning of administrative violations in the land domain.

Administrative violations in the land domain are intentional or unintentional acts committed by individuals and organizations violating provisions of the land legislation. The acts of administrative violation in the use of land include: not using land for the right purpose; land encroachment and appropriation; destruction of land; obstruction of land use; converting, transferring, leasing, etc., land use rights without complying to the procedures prescribed by the land legislation; delayed payments of compensations or land use levies. Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the Committee on Environmental Protection shall be the authorized state institution carrying out control and supervision in the sphere of protection of environment and natural resources. The main function of the Committee shall be to ensure ecological safety of environment. The Committee shall carry out the following functions: (a) enforcement of environmental legislation; (b) supervision over compliance with ecological requirements related to keeping cadastres and registration of natural resources; (c) compliance with ecological requirements related to atmospheric air protection; (d) compliance with ecological requirements related to application, storage, disposal, recycling and burial of fertilizers, nutrients and pesticides; (e) compliance with ecological requirements related to protection, stock enhancement and management of wild fauna and wild flora; (f) recultivation of disturbed land and land reclamation; (g) waste management and waste disposal; and (h) subsoil management.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Regional Act No. 27 on the promotion of forest surfaces, landscape and economy.
Policy_Content: This Regional Act aims at the preservation and rational management of the forest resources of the Lombardia Region. At the same time it promotes economic activities related to forestry. Article 3 lays down the definition of forest, so as to clearly establish the application scope. The Act establishes the framework concerning authorizations which may be issued by local authorities, administrative functions, giving particular regard to the protection of forests against fires and biodiversity preservation. Article 7 deals with the regional forest inventory and provides for the creation of an information system. Article 14 makes provision on forestry planting material. Article 17 promotes the setting up of forest consortia. Article 24 lays down administrative sanctions.
Subject: Forestry

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1105 validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree designates the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources as the central executive body responsible for implementing state policies and for coordinating management in the sphere of energy, including nuclear energy, mineral resources, and the petrochemical and nuclear industry. The Ministry shall have the following functions: (a) elaboration and implementation of state policy in the energy sector; (b) analysis of the energy sector; (c) validation of the list of mineral deposits destined for subsoil management, and conclusion and registration of subsoil management contracts; and (d) control of compliance with subsoil management requirements. The Ministry shall have the following plenary powers: (a) request information from state bodies, organizations, officials and citizens; (b) make proposals regarding the abrogation or amendment of legislative acts; (c) make proposals to enter into international agreements; and (d) carry out administration of guarantees on product sharing contracts in the sphere of subsoil management.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1113 validating the Regulation on the Ministry of Environmental Protection.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the Ministry of Environmental Protection shall be the central executive body responsible for carrying out inter-departmental coordination and for guiding the elaboration and implementation of state policy in the sphere of environmental protection and management to ensure the favourable and sustainable development of society. The Ministry shall carry out the following functions: (a) state management in the areas of environmental protection, auditing and licensing and ecological education; and (b) international cooperation, and research and dissemination of environmental information. The Ministry shall carry out the following plenary powers: (a) to conclude international agreements concerned with environmental protection; (b) to coordinate contracts for the management of the natural environment within its sphere of competence; (c) to validate environmental quality criteria and ecological requirements for economic activity; (d) to validate research programmes; and (e) to request and obtain information regarding its sphere of competence from state bodies.
