Policy: Law No. 5/04 on Industrial Activities.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 28 articles divided ino six Chapters, approves the Industrial Activities Law, which establishes the general principles and standards applicable to industrial activities of any nature, carried out in the national territory. In addition, it specifies the prevention of risks and inconveniences resulting from the work of industrial establishments, the safeguarding of public health and workers, the safety of people and goods, hygiene and safety of workplaces, the environment and the quality of national industrial goods. This law seeks to achieve: a) guarantee and protection of the freedom to exercise industrial activity; b) modernization and industrial and/or technological promotion; c) innovation and increased competitiveness; d) industrial safety and quality; e) industrial responsibility; f) prevention, reduction and elimination of risks, inherent to industrial activities. Industrial activities, of any kind, must be carried out with minimal damage to the environment and the location where they are located. Industrial activities which, by their nature, are likely to cause damage to the environment can only be authorized after approval of the environmental impact assessment, by the authority responsible for the environmental sector.

Policy: Ley Nº 25.916 - Gestión de residuos domiciliarios.

Policy: Natural Resources Management Act 2004.
Policy_Content: The objects of this Act, consisting of 233 sections divided into twelve Chapters and completed by four Schedules, include assisting in the achievement of ecologically sustainable development in the State by establishing an integrated scheme to promote the use and management of natural resources in a manner that recognises and protects the intrinsic values of natural resources; seeks to protect biological diversity and, insofar as is reasonably practicable, to support and encourage the restoration or rehabilitation of ecological systems and processes that have been lost or degraded; provides for the protection and management of catchments and the sustainable use of land and water resources and, insofar as is reasonably practicable, seeks to enhance and restore or rehabilitate land and water resources that have been degraded; seeks to support sustainable primary and other economic production systems with particular reference to the value of agriculture and mining activities to the economy of the State; provides for the prevention or control of impacts caused by pest species of animals and plants that may have an adverse effect on the environment, primary production or the community; and promotes educational initiatives and provides support mechanisms to increase the capacity of people to be involved in the management of natural resources.

Policy: Order No. 141 of the State Nuclear Regulatory Committee validating the Provisions and safety requirements (licensing conditions) for transport of radioactive materials and the Requirements for safety report as regards transport of radioactive materials.
Policy_Content: The Regulation consists of 2 Sections dealing with the following matters: 1) general provisions (sect. 2); 2) requirements for transport of radioactive materials (sect. 2). The present Regulation shall be applicable to the agents operating in the sphere of the management of nuclear energy that carry out transportation of radioactive materials. In the process of transportation of radioactive materials shall be carried out the following operations: 1) preparation of radioactive materials; 2) loading; 3) sending off; 4) transportation; 5) transit conservation; 6) unloading; 7) acceptance at the destination. Transportation of radioactive materials shall be carried out in conformity with authorization. For the purpose of ensuring nuclear and radiation safety the licence holder must carry out transportation of radioactive materials in conformity with the norms, standards and regulations of nuclear and radiation safety, environmental, sanitary and hygienic requirements and regulations. The licence holder shall have the duty: 1) to ensure radiation control in the process of transport; 2) to use packages certified by the State Nuclear Regulatory Committee; 3) to ensure conservation and protection of radioactive materials in the process of transportation; 4) to ensure compensation of damages that could be caused by the accident in the process of transportation of radioactive materials.

The objectives of the strategy and the principal measures to be used to implement the strategy have been revised (clauses 4 and 5). The term of the strategy has been extended to 30 June 2013 (clause 6). Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 9 sections, made under the Community Services Complaints, Reviews and Monitoring) Act 1993 (for the purposes of section 8 of the Act), the following are prescribed as functions that an Official Community Visitor may exercise: a) to inform the Minister and the Ombudsman on matters affecting the welfare, interests and conditions of persons using visitable services, b) to encourage the promotion of legal and human rights of persons using visitable services, including the right to privacy, confidentiality, adequate information and consultation in relation to those services and the right to complain, c) to consider matters raised by persons using visitable services, staff of providers of visitable services and people having a genuine concern for the welfare, interests and conditions of persons using visitable services, d) to provide information to persons using visitable services as to the advocacy services available to help them in the presentation of any grievance or matter of concern and, in appropriate cases, to assist such persons to obtain such services, e) to facilitate, wherever it is reasonable and practicable to do so, the early and speedy resolution of grievances or matters of concern affecting persons using visitable services by referring those grievances or matters to the providers of the relevant services or to other appropriate bodies.

Policy: Plan Nacional de Políticas Públicas para el Ejercicio Pleno de los Derechos de las Mujeres (2004-2007).
Policy_Content: El presente documento tiene por objeto el Plan Nacional de Políticas Públicas para el Ejercicio Pleno de los Derechos de las Mujeres, de carácter multisectorial y alcance nacional, relativo al período 2004-2007. El Plan busca disminuir las brechas de inequidad de género en los ámbitos económico, social, político y cultural.  Se declara como objetivo general alcanzar en Bolivia el pleno ejercicio de los derechos de la mujer, para que éstas accedan y controlen los beneficios del desarrollo sostenible. El documento identifica las problemáticas y los objetivos a alcanzar en relación con las siguientes áreas: economía; violencia; salud; educación; participación política y ciudadana; reformas legales y justicia; institucionalidad y transversalización; comunicación y cultura. Se contemplan los siguientes objetivos específicos a largo plazo, denominados objetivos de desarrollo: 1) acceso equitativo de las mujeres al empleo, ingresos, recursos productivos y de fomento de la actividad económica; 2) las mujeres bolivianas acceden a mecanismos de prevención y servicios con calidad de atención a la violencia intrafamiliar en razón del género; 3) disminución de las brechas educativas entre hombres y mujeres; 4) ampliación de la participación política y ciudadana de las mujeres; 5) acceso oportuno y efectivo de las mujeres a la justicia; 6) la gestión pública incorpora el enfoque de género; 7) la opinión pública nacional conoce los derechos de las mujeres.  El Plan se organiza en torno a tres dimensiones del desarrollo sostenible, transversalizadas por la dimensión ambiental.

Policy: Order No. 138 on the issue of the certificate regarding transboundary movement of radioactive materials.
Policy_Content: The present Order establishes rules on the issue of certicates complying with nuclear and radiation safety in the transboundary movement of radioactive materials by the State Nuclear Regulatory Committee. The certificate is a document ascertaining the compliance with  the requirements existing in nuclear energy management, in rules and standards of nuclear and radiation safety and in the process of transboundary movement of radioactive materials. Transboundary movement of radioactive materials includes export, temporary export, import, temporary import, re-exports and transit of radioactive materials. Application must contain the following data: (1) name and address of consignor of goods and consignee; (2) data concerning goods: radioactivity expressed in beckerel (Bq) with the respective prefix in conformity with the International System of Units (Ci), type of packages, identification number of each certificate; (3) contract; (4) licensing terms and conditions (number, date of issue and expiry date); and (5) period of validity of certificate. The Certificate must specify the type of radioactive material, its activity and quantity.

Policy: Town and Country Planning (Regions)(National Parks)(England) Order 2004 (S.I. 2207 of 2004).

This Order directs that the North York Moors National Park and the Yorkshire Dales National Park are treated as falling within the Yorkshire and Humber Region and that the Peak District National Park is treated as falling within the East Midlands Region. The Order is relevant for the purposes of Part 1 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004. That Part provides, amongst other matters, for regional spatial strategies relating to the development and use of land within each of the regions referred to above.

Policy: Rubber Development Authority, Liberian (LRDA) Act.
Policy_Content: This Act establishes the Liberia Rubber Development Authority, formerly the Liberian Rubber Development Unit (LRDU), established in 1978 under the Ministry of Agriculture. The Authority shall be a corporate body of the Government of the Republic of Liberia. The primary objectives of the Liberia Rubber Development Authority shall include: a) engage in scientific research relating to all aspects of production and distribution of rubber; b) engage in the rehabilitation of rubber farms; c) engage in the establishment and organization of cooperatives; d) assist in the processing and exportation of rubber. The Act also specifies general registration requirements for rubber farms, brokers and exporters, which are renewable each year and affirms that no Law, Executive Order, or Regulation shall deprive Liberian citizens of their right to own, operate and administer rubber farms.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 1094 validating the Regulation on the modalities of elaboration of the land use planning projects on the territories of protected areas, and territories of recreation and cultural heritage.
Policy_Content: The present Regulation establishes the mechanism of elaboration of the land use planning projects on the territories of protected areas, and territories of recreation and cultural heritage. The aforesaid land use planning projects shall be elaborated in conformity with: 1) decision by rural administration, local self-government, regional, district of city administration authorized to make decisions as regards the allotment of the plots of land; 2) contract concluded between landowner, land tenant and the developers of the land use planning projects; 3) sentence of the court. Land use planning project shall be elaborated in conformity with the target validated by the customer that shall be integral part of the contract. The contract for the commissioning of land use planning project shall be elaborated in conformity with the model contract validated by the Cabinet of Ministers. Land use planning project specify: 1) the functional organization of the territory of protected areas, and territories of recreation and cultural heritage; 2) location and size of the plots of land, landowners and land tenants, including leaseholders; 3) regime of management and conservation of protected areas; 4) boundaries of the plots of land of the protected areas; 5) territory of the protection zone.

Policy: Décret n° 692/PR/MEFEPEPN du 24 août 2004 fixant les conditions d'exercice des droits d'usage coutumiers en matière de forêt, de faune, de chasse et de pêche.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret, pris en application des dispositions des articles 14 alinéa 2 et 297 de la loi n° 016-01 du 31 décembre 2001 portant Code Forestier en République Gabonaise, fixe les conditions d'exercice des droits d'usage coutumiers en matière de forêt, de faune, de chasse et de pêche. Aux termes de ce texte, les droits d'usage coutumiers visent la satisfaction des besoins personnels ou collectifs des communautés villageoises par : l'utilisation des arbres comme bois de construction et du bois mort ou des branchages comme bois de feu; la récolte des produits forestiers secondaires tels que les écorces, le latex, les champignons, les plantes médicinales ou comestibles, les pierres; l'agriculture, la chasse et la pêche de subsistance; le pâturage en clairières et l'utilisation de branches et feuilles pour le fourrage; les droits de passage et d'utilisation des eaux.
Subject: Fisheries, Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems
Keyword: Traditional rights/customary rights,Right of use,Wildlife products
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Central Africa, North Atlantic, South Atlantic

A cet effet, ce texte prévoit les outils suivants: des inventaires forestiers; une cartographie forestière; un plan d'aménagement des forêts; et une mise en œuvre de l'aménagement (plans de gestion et plans annuels d'opération).

Policy: Ministerial Decree No.889 regarding some issues of licensing and carrying out ecological audit.
Policy_Content: The Premier decrees to validate: 1) Qualification requirements for licensing of ecological audit; 2) Regulation on licensing of ecological audit; 3) Regulation on the modalities of carrying out ecological audit. Qualification requirements for licensing of ecological audit include the presence of contract with the organization in possession of accredited testing laboratory. Regulation on licensing of ecological audit establishes the modalities and conditions of issuing to legal and natural persons of licenses for carrying out ecological audit. Regulation on the modalities of carrying out ecological audit establishes the rules regulating activity of single ecological auditors and ecological auditing organizations in possession of licence for carrying out ecological audit.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 889 on licensing of environmental audit.
Policy_Content: Environmental audit shall be subject to licensing. Licences shall be issued by the authorized environmental institution within a month from the date of filing the application containing the following documentation: (a) a copy of the state registration for physical and legal persons; (b) a copy of taxpayer certificate; (c) certificate of licensing fee payment; (d) qualification certificate. All the aforesaid documents must be notarized. Environmental audit consists of the following phases: (a) purpose definition; (b) preliminary analysis of documentation; (c) making of a contract; (d) execution of environmental audit; (e) drawing up report.
Subject: Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia

Policy: Standards Act.
Policy_Content: This Act assigns functions and powers to the Surinaams Bureau voor Standaarden (SBS) and makes provisions with respect to the formulation, establishment and application of standards in Suriname and related matters such as inspection and marking of goods and a public register of standards. A standard can be developed and adopted under this Act or may be a standard proposed by the Caricom Regional Organization for Standards and Quality (CROSQ) and approved by the Caribbean Common Market Council for Trade and Economic Development (and subsequently adopted by the Suriname Standards Bureau). The Act sets out requirements and procedures for the adoption of standards by SBS. The Bureau shall be authorized to investigate complaints about goods by customers. If no mandatory standard has been established by SBS for certain goods, but there exists a non-mandatory foreign specification or standard in respect of the goods, the Bureau may declare that the goods do or do not comply with the standard or the foreign specification. In this case such goods may not be imported, exported or placed on the market without a label that indicates non-compliance with such standard. Goods subject to a mandatory standard or a foreign specification may not be imported or exported or placed on the market in case of non-compliance with the standard or specification.

Policy: Décret n° 2004-832 pris pour l'application des articles L. 229-5 à L. 229-19 du Code de l'environnement et relatif au système d'échange de quotas d'émission de gaz à effet de serre.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret s'applique aux installations classées pour la protection de l'environnement produisant ou transformant des métaux ferreux, produisant de l'énergie, des produits minéraux, du papier ou de la pâte à papier et répondant aux critères fixés dans l'annexe au présent décret, au titre de leurs rejets de dioxyde de carbone dans l'atmosphère, à l'exception des installations ou parties d'installations utilisées pour la recherche, le développement et l'expérimentation de nouveaux produits et procédés. Dès la publication du décret approuvant le plan national d'affectation des quotas, le ministre chargé de l'environnement fixe par arrêté la liste des exploitants auxquels sont affectés des quotas d'émission pour la période couverte par le plan. L'exploitant adresse au préfet, au plus tard le 15 février de chaque année, pour chaque installation, la déclaration des émissions de gaz à effet de serre de l'année précédente, vérifiée par un organisme agrée. Tout exploitant doit restituer à l'Etat, au plus tard le 30 avril de chaque année, une quantité de quotas correspondant aux émissions, déclarées et validées dans les conditions prévues par l'arrêté prévu à l'article L. 229-6 du Code de l'environnement, de chacune de ses installations.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 87-P validating Model regulations on protected areas.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree validates Model regulations on regional state biosphere reserves, nature monuments and the form of preservation order related to nature monuments. Nature monuments of regional significance shall be considered unique natural objects and complexes that are valuable from ecological, scientific, historical and cultural, aesthetic, educational point of view, of natural and artificial origin that need particular protection by the state. The scope of declaration of natural objects and complexes nature monuments shall be conservation thereof in their natural state. Declaration of natural objects and complexes nature monuments shall be authorized with the expropriation of land plots on which they are located from land owners. Expropriated territory shall be declared territory of nature monuments.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 379 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Chulpan”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve “Chulpan” shall be classified as cultivated land (landscape) protected area constituted for the purpose of conservation of cultivated land and land reclamation area as a reference model erosion-resistant ecologically balanced agriculture in water erosion zone. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of etalon light-grey forest soil, cultivated agricultural land and reference model land-reclamation and erosion-resistant area as landscape-based agriculture; (b) regulation of recreational activity; and (c) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) exploration and mining; (b) modification of hydrological regime; (c) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and pesticides; and (d) waste disposal and littering of the territory.

Policy: Mining Code Act (No. 784 of 2007).
Policy_Content: The Act applies to stone, gravel, sand, clay, lime, chalk, peat, topsoil and similar elements. Exploitation of mineral deposits on land and sea must be part of a sustainable development plan which purpose is to ensure monitoring of mining areas after extraction, raw material supply, ensure that raw materials used are quality based and that raw materials shall be, where possible, replaced by waste products. The Minister of Environment sets regulations on quality and quantity of raw materials used for construction, on the recycling thereof, on the quantity and quality of raw materials used for the manufacturing of industrial products, on the processing of certain raw material quality (abstraction) and on waste, replacement products and dredging materials from the Danish marine area to be recovered and recycled as raw material. Permission for these activities is required and is granted by the municipal council authorities for the length of max. 10 years. The county council performs a mapping of mineral deposits on land to which the Minister of Environment and Energy shall set regulations. Permission for abstraction at beaches and other coastal areas where there are no contiguous land vegetation, may be disclosed only with the consent of Coastal Inspector.
Subject: Mineral resources

Policy: Import health standard for sawn wood from all countries.
Policy_Content: This Standard, prepared by the Technical Policy section of the Quarantine Division, Ministry of Agriculture (MoA) and endorsed by the Assistant Chief Executive Officer, Quarantine Division of MoA, concerns import health standard for sawn wood from all countries. It describes the requirements to be met to enable biosecurity clearance to be given for the import of sawn wood into Samoa. It applies to wood sawn longitudinally, with or without its natural rounded surface with or without bark. This Import Health Standard may be reviewed, amended or revoked if there are changes in Samoa’s import policy or the health status of the originating country, or for any other lawful reason, at the discretion of the Assistant Chief Executive Officer. The Standard specifies treatment, packaging and certification requirements for the imported wood and provides with respect to inspection and biosecurity clearance.

Policy_Content: Por la presente Resolución se establece la Comisión Nacional Asesora en Recursos Genéticos para la Alimentación y la Agricultura (CONARGEN), la cual se encargará de : a) asesorar en las políticas, líneas de acción, marcos normativos y cualquier otra medida de gobierno que se les encomiende, relacionadas con la conservación, promoción, regulación, acceso, uso y comercio de recursos genéticos para la alimentación y la agricultura, sus derivados, sus partes y componentes, tanto de los recursos fitogenéticos, zoogenéticos, forestales y marinos, en el desarrollo de sistemas productivos multiespecíficos ; b) proponer medidas prioritarias para la conservación, prospección, recolección, caracterización, evaluación y documentación de los recursos genéticos para su uso sostenible ; c) identificar procesos y actividades que tienen o puedan tener efectos negativos sobre los recursos genéticos y aconsejar las medidas para reducirlos al mínimo o eliminarlos ; d) proponer medidas apropiadas que promuevan el acceso, la utilización sostenible, el comercio, el intercambio de los recursos genéticos y sus derivados, y la transferencia de estos recursos y de las tecnologías asociadas a ellos.

Policy: Decree-Law No. 197/2004 amending harbour reception facilities for ship-generated waste and cargo residues originating from vessels using national harbours.
Policy_Content: This Decree-Law amends the Regulation of harbour reception facilities for ship-generated waste and cargo residues originating from vessels using national harbours. Amendments deal with: Port reception facilities for waste capable of receiving ship-generated waste and cargo residues from ships normally using such port, taking into account the operational needs of port users. Size and geographic location, type of vessels calling the port, as well as the exemptions provided for in article 10. In the case of foreign ships, the IPTM inspectors act under the provisions of the Foreign Ships Inspection Regulation, approved by Decree-Law No 195/98. Vessels sailing through a national port should contribute significantly to the costs of the port reception facilities related to the waste generated on board, including the cost for treatment and disposal of such waste.

Policy: Interim Measures on clean production checks.
Policy_Content: These Measures are formulated to promote clean production and regulate clean production checks. Clean production check shall mean the process of following certain procedures to investigate into and diagnose the production and service process so as to find out the causes of high energy consumption, high material consumption and heavy pollution and to find solutions for reducing the use and production of toxic or harmful materials and decreasing energy consumption. Production checks may be divided into voluntary checks and compulsory checks. Compulsory clean production checks shall be conducted when emission of pollutants of the enterprise exceed the national and local standards for emission or when the enterprise uses toxic or harmful materials for production or emits toxic or harmful substances in its production. Clean production checks are carried out following provisions described in Chapter III. Chapter IV deals with the organization and management of clean production checks. The remaining part of these Measures contain penal provisions.
Subject: Environment gen.
Keyword: Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution,Environmental audit,Energy conservation/energy production,Hazardous substances,Emissions,Environmental standards

Policy: Decree No. 381 of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources validating the Regulation on evaluation of damage to subsoil.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of evaluation of environmental damage, resulting from the infringement of the legislation on subsoil and compensation therefore. The damages shall be classified as direct (quantitative and qualitative reduction of minerals) and indirect (manifesting after specified period of time). Compensation of damages shall not exonerate the culprit from carrying out the arrangements for the mitigation of consequences of environmental pollution. This Ministerial Decree also establishes calculation formula for damages caused to subsoil by illegal mining and extraction of minerals.

Policy: Ley de desarrollo forestal sustentable para el Estado de Tlaxcala.
Policy_Content: Las disposiciones de esta Ley tienen por objeto regular y fomentar la conservación, protección, restauración, manejo y aprovechamiento de los ecosistemas forestales del Estado de Tlaxcala. En este contexto la Ley establece disposiciones para: regular y promover la protección, conservación y restauración de suelos, ecosistemas y recursos forestales estatales y municipales, así como la ordenación y el manejo forestal; fomentar el respeto al uso y disfrute de los recursos forestales de los lugares que ocupan y habitan los pueblos y las comunidades; recuperar y desarrollar bosques en terrenos preferentemente forestales, para que cumplan con la función de conservar suelos y aguas, además de dinamizar el desarrollo rural; regular el aprovechamiento y uso de los recursos forestales maderables y no maderables; promover y consolidar las áreas forestales existentes, impulsando su delimitación y manejo sustentable, evitando que el cambio de uso de suelo con fines agropecuarios o de cualquier otra índole, afecte su permanencia y potencialidad; regular las auditorías técnicas preventivas forestales; estimular las certificaciones forestales de bienes y servicios ambientales; prevenir, combatir y controlar los incendios forestales, así como plagas y enfermedades forestales; garantizar la participación ciudadana, incluyendo a los pueblos y comunidades del Estado, en la aplicación, evaluación y seguimiento de la política forestal; impulsar el desarrollo de la empresa social forestal y comunal en los pueblos y comunidades del Estado y sus municipios.

Policy: Order No. D1-436 of the Minister of Environment validating General Regulation on municipal environmental monitoring.
Policy_Content: These General Regulations on Municipal Environmental Monitoring regulate the content of the municipal environmental monitoring program, its preparation, coordination, implementation, and the procedure for ensuring environmental monitoring control and provision of information. Municipal environmental monitoring is an integral part of environmental monitoring system, including municipal level in the areas assigned thereto, observation of the condition of components and their interaction, anthropogenic impact on the environment, its assessment and forecasts. This Regulation is binding on all municipal environmental monitoring and control of legal and natural persons. Municipal environmental monitoring shall be organized by the municipal executive bodies. The municipal environmental monitoring program shall: (a) apply to management of the quality of the environment in the territory of the municipality aimed at supply of more detailed available information on public environmental monitoring useful for assessment and forecast of changes in the environment and possible consequences with a view of preparing appropriate recommendations for planning mitigation programs aimed at contrasting negative environmental impact; (b) define the scope of municipal environmental monitoring; and (c) be based on the principle of correspondence of costs and benefits. The program shall cover the period of 3-6 years. The program is divided into parts according to the spheres of the natural environment: atmospheric air, water (surface water, groundwater), soil, wildlife, landscape.
Subject: Environment gen., Land & soil
Geographical_area: Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Northern Europe

Policy_Content: This Regulation amends some provisions of the previous one. The representative of the controlling and/or certification agencies for Turkey should preferably be an Agricultural Engineer, and these agencies should conform to Turkish Accreditation criteria and to EN 45011. The controlling and/or certification agencies, managers, partners, controllers and employees are not allowed to engage in organic farming commercially. Apprentice controllers neither are allowed to perform single handed controlling nor prepare controlling reports. Controlling courses are organized by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs once a year when deemed necessary.

Policy: Loi nº 04-09 relative à la promotion des énergies renouvelables dans le cadre du développement durable.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objet de fixer les modalités de promotion des énergies renouvelables dans le cadre du développement durable. Au sens de la présente loi, sont qualifiées d'énergies renouvelables: 1) les formes d'énergies électriques, mécaniques, thermiques ou gazeuses obtenues à partir de la transformation du rayonnement solaire, de l'énergie du vent, de la géothermie, des déchets organiques, de l'énergie hydraulique et des techniques d'utilisation de la biomasse; 2) l'ensemble des procédés permettant des économies d'énergies significatives par le recours à des techniques de construction relevant de l'architecture bioclimatique. La promotion des énergies renouvelables est réalisée à travers:1) Un programme national de promotion des énergies renouvelables dans le cadre du développement durable, et un bilan annuel de l'usage des énergies renouvelables; 2) Des instruments de promotion des énergies renouvelables, constitués par un mécanisme de certification d'origine et par un système d'incitation à l'utilisation des énergies renouvelables. Il est créé un organisme national chargé de la promotion et du développement de l’utilisation des énergies renouvelables dénommé "observatoire national de promotion des énergies renouvelables".
Subject: Energy

Policy: Law No. 115 «On sustainable development of ecological and economic area “Issyk Kul” “.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Law shall be regulation of the relations concerning protected ecological and economic area “Issyk Kul”. Issyk Kul lake has special status as natural ecosystem of global importance with a series of objects of cultural heritage protected by the state. Basic conservation principles shall regard: (a) conservation of global and local biological diversity; (b) conservation of cultural heritage; (c) recreational tourism; and (d) sustainable development of the area. This Law shall be applicable to all natural and legal persons whose activity deals with management, conservation and development of Issyk Kul area. Natural resources of Issyk Kul area subject to conservation and protection shall include Issyk Kul lake, glaciers and forests. Issyk Kul area shall be classified as biosphere territory, reserves, sanctuaries, glaciers, wetlands, forests and health resort institutions.

Policy: Measures for the license administration of qualification for operation of environmental pollution control facilities.
Policy_Content: These Measures are formulated for the purpose of improving the level of management and regulating the order of the market on the operation of environmental pollution control facilities. A certificate of qualification must be obtained to undertake activities of operation of environmental pollution control facilities. The various levels of qualification shall be divided into professional types such as life sewage, industry waste water, dust removal and desulfurization, industrial exhaust gas, industrial solid waste, life rubbish, etc. The standards for determining levels and types of qualification shall be formulated by the State Environmental Protection Administration. Chapter II deals with application forms for qualification certificates. Examinations and approval of qualification certificates are dealt with in Chapter III. A certificate holding entity shall abide by the relevant state provisions on environmental protection in its operation activities and the pollutants it discharges shall reach the standards and requirements for pollutants discharge as prescribed by the state and local region (Chapter IV). The remaining provisions deal with legal liabilities.

Policy: Merchant Shipping (Vessel Traffic Monitoring and Reporting Requirements) Regulations 2004  (S.I. No. 2110 of 2004).
Policy_Content: These Regulations, give effect to Directive 2002/59/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing a Community vessel traffic monitoring and information system and repealing Council Directive 93/75/EEC and to similar provisions in the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships 1973 as modified by the Protocol of 1978 relating thereto and in the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea 1974 relating to the notification of dangerous and polluting goods and the reporting of incidents and accidents at sea. The principal provisions of these Regulations are as follows. Regulation 4 specifies the ships to which the Regulations apply. Provision is made imposing obligations to report the destination of a ship and provide other information, to require ships to participate in, and comply with the rules of, vessel traffic services and to install in ships, and maintain in operation, automatic identification systems (regs. 5 to 9). Provision is made requiring the notification of dangerous or polluting goods carried by ships and for the granting of exemptions from the requirements (regs. 10 and 11). The Regulations contain requirements relating to the reporting of incidents and accidents at sea (the terms "incident" and "accident" are defined in regulation 2(2)) and for measures to be taken in the event of an incident or accident and bad weather or sea conditions (regs. 12 to 15).
Subject: Sea, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Atlantic Ocean Islands, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, North Atlantic, North Sea, North-East Atlantic, Northern Europe

Policy: Décret n° 665/PR/MEFBP du 9 août 2004 Portant création, attributions et organisation de la direction générale de la concurrence et de la consommation.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée au sein du ministère de l'économie, des finances, du budget et de la privatisation, une direction générale de la concurrence et de la consommation (DGCC). À ce titre, la direction générale de la concurrence et de la consommation est notamment chargée de : concevoir la réglementation générale en matière de concurrence et de consommation; garantir la liberté des prix et des échanges, le libre jeu de la concurrence et le fonctionnement régulier des marchés; prévenir les pratiques anticoncurrentielles et de pourvoir à leur répression; assurer la transparence dans les transactions commerciales; suivre l'évolution du marché et des prix; renseigner le gouvernement sur l'évolution des prix, d'en signaler toute hausse anormale, d'en déterminer les causes et de proposer toutes mesures propres à y remédier; veiller à la transparence des procédures de marché public et de délégation de service public; veiller à la régularité des conventions et des baux; garantir la qualité des biens et services; concevoir les normes de référence en matière de qualité et de sécurité des produits; assurer la défense et la protection des intérêts des consommateurs; informer, d'éduquer et de conseiller les agents économiques; constater et de réprimer les infractions à la réglementation de la concurrence et de la consommation, conformément aux textes en vigueur; suivre la coopération internationale en matière de concurrence et de consommation; contribuer et d'assister aux travaux de la commission de la concurrence; harmoniser les règles nationales avec le droit communautaire et international en matière de concurrence; appliquer et de coordonner les mesures prises par le gouvernement en matière de concurrence et de consommation; gérer le personnel et les moyens mis à sa disposition. La direction générale de la concurrence et de la consommation peut recevoir du gouvernement toute autre mission entrant dans le domaine de ses compétences.
Subject: Food & nutrition, General

Policy: Regional Decree No. 360 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Baltasinsky”.
Policy_Content: Regional state nature reserve “Baltasinsky” shall be classified as complex, constituted with a view of conservation of unique natural ecosystem, forests, rare and endangered wild fauna and wild flora species. It shall perform the following functions: (a) conservation, reproduction of natural complexes and ecosystems, natural habitats of rare, endangered wild fauna and wild flora species; (b) regulation of recreational activity; and (c) ecological education. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) drainage and land reclamation; (b) soil disturbance; (c) commercial hunting and fisheries; (d) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers and pesticides; and (e) gathering of zoological, botanical and mineral collections.

Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of three articles and one Annex, approves the Regulation on Oil Operations, with the aim of granting that they are carried out in a systematic and coordinated manner and that are correctly monitored. Policy: Decree No. 26/2004 on the Environmental Regulation for Mining Activities.
Policy_Content: This Decree, composed of two articles and one Annex, approves the Environmental Regulation of Mining Activities, with the aim of assuring environmental quality protection and sustainable development. The annexed Regulation, composed of 30 articles divided in seven Chapters, defines norms for the prevention, control, mitigation and compensation of adverse effects that mining activity might cause to environment, with the view of sustainable development of such activity. In particular, it defines roles and competences between all relevant national bodies and institutes a Consultative Committee for the monitoring of the specific projects envisaged by the regulation. Moreover, it provides specific environmental protection measures according to the classification of mining activities provided in the Mining Act. Furthermore, it defines the required environmental management instruments, such as, for instance, the environmental impact assessment (EIA) and the use of licenses. Finally, it recalls all specific environmental protection measures required by national legislation and applicable to water, air, noise/vibrations, waste and protected areas. The Regulation rules on inspection procedures and applicable penalties.

Policy: Loi nº 2004-72 relative à la maîtrise de l'énergie.
Policy_Content: La présente loi relative à la maîtrise d’énergie, prépare la voie à la Tunisie pour passer dans ce domaine à un palier supérieur en ce qui concerne l'utilisation des énergies renouvelables et en premier lieu l'énergie solaire et éolienne La stratégie tunisienne s'article autour de trois volets: - le renforcement des mesures d'économie d'énergie, - la promotion des énergies renouvelables et le remplacement des hydrocarbures par le gaz naturel. Le plan national prévoit 5 mesures consistant à: développer les ressources nationales d'hydrocarbures ; orienter la consommation vers les produits énergétiques les moins coûteux comme le gaz naturel ; utiliser rationnellement l'énergie ; promouvoir les énergies renouvelables ; renforcer la sensibilisation et appeler le sens civique des consommateurs. Le mécanisme qui est mis en place accorde 20% de subvention pour l'économie d'énergie dans l'industrie, la connexion des ménages au gaz naturel, l'installation de stations diagnostic moteurs et les chauffe-eau solaires.

Les titulaires d'une autorisation d’exploitation visée au chapitre II du titre III de la présente loi acquièrent la propriété des Hydrocarbures extraits à la tête de puits. Aucune personne physique ou morale, y compris les propriétaires du sol, ne peut entreprendre des Opérations Pétrolières, si elle n’a pas été préalablement autorisée par l’Etat conformément aux dispositions de la présente loi. L’Etat se réserve le droit d’entreprendre toutes Opérations Pétrolières ; directement, par lui-même ou par toute entreprise ou tout organisme public ou toute société d’Etat. Policy: Assessment and Management of Environmental Noise Law, 2004 (Law No. 224(I)/2004).
Policy_Content: On a European level, a number of legislative measures have been enacted for regulating noise from various sources, such as occupational noise, noise from equipment for outdoor use as well as for the assessment and management of environmental noise. In Cyprus, the competent authority for the implementation of the law on the assessment and management of environmental noise is the Environment Service of the Ministry of Agriculture, Natural Resources and Environment. The present law transposes European Directive 2002/49/EC, whose main aim is to define a common approach intended to avoid, prevent or reduce on a prioritised basis the harmful effects, including annoyance, due to exposure to environmental noise. To this end the following actions are progressively implemented: Determination of exposure to environmental noise through noise mapping; Ensuring that information on environmental noise and its effects is made available to the public; Adoption of action plans with a view to preventing and reducing environmental noise where necessary and particularly where exposure levels can induce harmful effects on human health and to preserving environmental noise quality where it is good; Developing of Community measures to reduce noise emitted by the major sources, in particular: Road and rail vehicles, including infrastructure, aircrafts, outdoor equipment, industrial equipment and mobile machinery. The law sets out a specific time-table for the implementation of the above.
Subject: Air & atmosphere
Keyword: Access-to-information,Data collection/reporting,Noise pollution,Pollution control,Air quality/air pollution
Geographical_area: EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, European Union Countries, Mediterranean, Middle East, Western Asia

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 400 validating the Regulation on the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes that the Federal Nature Management Supervision Service shall be the Federal executive body for supervision and control in the sphere of nature management. The Federal Nature Management Supervision Service shall carry out supervision and control of the following: (a) protection, conservation and management of wild fauna and its natural habitat (except for game and fish); (b) management of Federal protected areas; (c) exploration, rational management and protection of subsoil; (d) state forest supervision related to forestries and urban forests; (e) protection of water bodies (Federal state control); (f) safety of waterworks; (g) land surveys within its area(s) of competence; and (f) forest fire control. It shall issue licences for: (a) hunting of game recorded in the Red Book and harvest of rare and endangered plants; (b) hunting of wildlife species and catching fish that are not subject to hunting and fishing; (c) import and export of trophies, wild fauna and wild flora species; and (d) export of live fish, crustaceans and molluscs.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Regional Law No. 23-RZ “On turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Law regulates relations concerning ownership, land tenure, and disposal of agricultural land. It establishes terms and conditions for allotment of plots of agricultural land pertaining to state and municipal property, and also the modalities of expropriation thereof in regional and municipal ownership. Agricultural land shall be used exclusively for agricultural production. Privatization of agricultural land, pertaining to regional of municipal property, shall be authorizeв 49 years after entry into force of this Regional Law, except for distant (outrun) pastures. Minimum land area of agricultural land plots authorized for transactions shall be equivalent to one ha and maximum agricultural land area that can be owned by a single natural or legal person shall not exceed ten percent of total available agricultural land area.

Policy: Regional Law No. 23-RZ “On turnover of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law shall be applicable to turnover of agricultural land pertaining to public or municipal property. Privatization of agricultural land pertaining to public and municipal property can be performed 49 years after the date of entry into force of this Regional Law. Distant pastures shall be excluded from privatization. Agricultural land parcels can be expropriated from the owners if it remains unused or non-purposefully used for the period of three years. Plots of land used as distant pastures and pertaining to public property can only be conceded on lease to natural and legal persons. Minimum lease period under perennial plants (gardens, vineland etc.) shall be 25 years; arable land – 7 years; hayland and pasture – 5 years.

Policy: Law No. 9235 on restitution and compensation of property.
Policy_Content: The object of this Law is: (a) the just regulation of the issues of property rights that have arisen from expropriation, nationalization, or confiscation; (b) restitution and compensation, whenever restitution is not possible; (c) the procedures for accomplishing restitution and compensation of property and the administrative bodies charged with its completion. Policy: Regional Law No. 368-OZ regarding the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another.
Policy_Content: The present Regional Law determines the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another and is valid till entry into force of the federal law regulating the issue. The present Regional Law does not apply to the relations connected with transfer of land pertaining to federal property, forest land and land of inhabited areas situated within the boundaries of sub-urban areas and green zones occupied by the forests of the first category. The Regional Law consists of 15 articles. Article 1 lays down general provisions. Article 2 regards authorized institutions. Article 3 establishes the grounds for transfer of land from one category into another. Article 4 deals with applications for transfer. Article 5 regards the decisions on transfer. Article 6 regards the rejection of transfer. Article 7 regards modification of the documentation in relation to transfer of land. Article 8 regards the modalities of transfer of land from one category into another in case of expropriation (purchase) of land for state or municipal needs. Article 9 regards transfer of agricultural land into another categories of land. Article 10 regards transfer of land of inhabited areas into other categories and vice versa. Article 11 regards transfer of industrial, energy, communication, broadcasting television, information, space, defence, safety and other types of land of special destination into other categories of land. Article 12 regards transfer of land of protected areas and objects into other categories. Article 13 regards transfer of land pertaining to water stock into other categories. Article 14 regards transfer of reserve land. Article 15 regards entry into force of the present Regional Law.
Subject: Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy_Content: Le présent modifie ceratines dispoaitions de l'arrêté qui fixe les divers critères, engagements et conditions à respecter pour pouvoir bénéficier des indemnités compensatoires de handicaps naturels (ICHN) en application du décret nº 2001-535 du 21 juin 2001. Pour bénéficier des indemnités compensatoires de handicaps naturels (ICHN), un exploitant agricole doit respecter l'ensemble des engagements décrits à l'article R. 113-20 du Code rural, dont les bonnes pratiques agricoles habituelles. Celles-ci sont réputées respectées lorsque, pour la partie des indemnités associées aux surfaces fourragères, le chargement est compris entre les limites définies ci-dessous. Le chargement est le rapport entre le nombre d'unités de gros bétail (UGB) retenues et la surface fourragère de l'exploitation.

Policy: Arrêté du 22 juillet 2004 relatif aux indices de qualité de l'air.
Policy_Content: Les indices de qualité de l'air requis par l'article 7 (c) du décret n° 98-360 du 6 mai 1998 susvisé sont des outils de communication qui permettent de décrire périodiquement sous une forme simple (qualificatif, chiffre) l'état global de la qualité de l'air dans une agglomération ou aire géographique donnée. Ces indices ne sont pas des outils de déclenchement ou de gestion des actions prévues par le titre II du décret n° 98-360 du 6 mai 1998. Ces indices sont des nombres entiers compris entre 1 et 10. Ils sont calculés pour une journée et pour une zone géographique retenues par l'association agréée pour la surveillance de la qualité de l'air territorialement compétente. Dans les agglomérations de plus de 100 000 habitants, l'indice ATMO est le résultat agrégé de la surveillance de quatre polluants. L'indice de qualité de l'air simplifié,qui peut être calculé dans des agglomérations ou des zones géographiques de moins de 100 000 habitants, est le résultat agrégé de la surveillance de un, deux, trois ou quatre polluants, en fonction de l'équipement de surveillance de la qualité de l'air déployé dans la zone géographique considérée.
Subject: Air & atmosphere

Policy: Single Farm Payment Scheme Implementing Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of the present Act is to implement the Council Regulation (EC) No. 1782/2003 establishing common rules for direct support schemes under the common agricultural policy and establishing certain support schemes for farmers of 29 September 2003 and Council Regulation (EC) No. 73/2009 establishing common rules for direct support schemes for farmers under the common agricultural policy and establishing certain support schemes for farmers of 19 January 2001. In particular, the Act lays down provisions relating to the distribution of payments made under the single farm payment scheme amongst the Länder. The text consists of 7 articles as follows: Sphere of application (1); Regional use of subsidies (2); Value relationship (3); Establishment of permanent pastures (4); Entry into force (5). Three Annexes are enclosed.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Livestock

Policy: Decree No. 219 of 2004 (VII. 21.) Korm. of the Government on the protection of underground waters.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decree is the determination of tasks, rights and obligations related to groundwater, through the assurance and conservation of good conditions, the reduction and prevention of pollution, the sustainable management and the remediation of geological media. This Decree shall apply to groundwater, geological media and pollutants, and to the activities affecting their status. The Decree is composed of 11 chapters. Articles 4, 4A and 4B sets out environmental objectives to be achieved, assessment of chemical status and identification of deteriorating trends and the establishment of trend-reversal points. The fundamental objective is to meet the requirements of good quantitative and qualitative conditions. Articles 5-7 provide rules on how the objectives set out should be achieved. Chapter III (Articles 12-15) contains rules concerning the authorization of water abstraction and pollutants disposal or immission. Chapter IV regulates the notification and reporting of activities which are subject to approval. Chapter V lays down rules on inspection. Chapter VI concerns the National Environmental Remediation Programme. Chapter VII provides rules on remediation. Chapter VIII contains the definition of environmental damage and proceedings related to it. Chapter IX provides for the operation of the Environmental Registration System of Groundwater and Geological Media. Chapter X sets out sanctions (penalty for offenders).
Subject: Environment gen., Water
Keyword: Data collection/reporting,Freshwater quality/freshwater pollution,Inspection,Monitoring,Offences/penalties,Pollution control,Precautionary principle,Resource/damage valuation,Groundwater,Authorization/permit,Freshwater resources management,Water abstraction

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 547 validating the Regulation on tenders for allocation of plots of public land in recreational and health resort area in Issyk-Kul province.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the modalities of carrying out tenders for allocation of plots of public land in recreational and health resort area in Issyk-Kul province for construction of health resort facilities, objects of tourism and service. State administration shall be granted the right to concede the aforesaid plots of public land for aforesaid purposes with the consideration of restrictions imposed by the national legislation. The plots of land must be free of abridgement of rights related to third party. National natural and legal persons shall be authorized to participate in tenders, and also foreign natural and legal persons in case of concession of the plots of land for fixed term (provisional land tenure).
Subject: Land & soil

Policy: Ordinance on land use planning for the area Berlin-Brandenburg – completing provisions for the outer developing area.
Policy_Content: The Annex of the present Ordinance lays down comprehensive provisions relating to land use planning in the area Berlin-Brandenburg. The first Part of the Annex concerns the compliance of the present Plan with federal provisions. Furthermore, it also deals with charcoal areas and their redevelopment. Part II concerns the economic, social and ecological aspects of the 250 km long border between Germany and Poland. Part III regards the general area development plan for Berlin and Brandenburg with a view to housing schemes, traffic development, recreation areas and flooding prevention. Part IV deals with the compatibility of land development and the principles of Natura 2000. The text consists of 4 Parts.
